Bug Summary

File:eval.c
Location:line 18550, column 40
Description:Access to field 'v_type' results in a dereference of a null pointer (loaded from field 'rettv')

Annotated Source Code

90#define DICT_MAXNEST100 100 /* maximum nesting of lists and dicts */
91
92#define DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999 99999 /* refcount for dict or list that should not
93 be freed. */
94
95#define AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#' '#' /* Character used as separator in autoload
96 function/variable names. */
97
98/*
99 * In a hashtab item "hi_key" points to "di_key" in a dictitem.
100 * This avoids adding a pointer to the hashtab item.
101 * DI2HIKEY() converts a dictitem pointer to a hashitem key pointer.
102 * HIKEY2DI() converts a hashitem key pointer to a dictitem pointer.
103 * HI2DI() converts a hashitem pointer to a dictitem pointer.
104 */
105static dictitem_T dumdi;
106#define DI2HIKEY(di)((di)->di_key) ((di)->di_key)
107#define HIKEY2DI(p)((dictitem_T *)(p - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&dumdi))) ((dictitem_T *)(p - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&dumdi)))
108#define HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi))) HIKEY2DI((hi)->hi_key)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)))
109
110/*
111 * Structure returned by get_lval() and used by set_var_lval().
112 * For a plain name:
113 * "name" points to the variable name.
114 * "exp_name" is NULL.
115 * "tv" is NULL
116 * For a magic braces name:
117 * "name" points to the expanded variable name.
118 * "exp_name" is non-NULL, to be freed later.
119 * "tv" is NULL
120 * For an index in a list:
121 * "name" points to the (expanded) variable name.
122 * "exp_name" NULL or non-NULL, to be freed later.
123 * "tv" points to the (first) list item value
124 * "li" points to the (first) list item
125 * "range", "n1", "n2" and "empty2" indicate what items are used.
126 * For an existing Dict item:
127 * "name" points to the (expanded) variable name.
128 * "exp_name" NULL or non-NULL, to be freed later.
129 * "tv" points to the dict item value
130 * "newkey" is NULL
131 * For a non-existing Dict item:
132 * "name" points to the (expanded) variable name.
133 * "exp_name" NULL or non-NULL, to be freed later.
134 * "tv" points to the Dictionary typval_T
135 * "newkey" is the key for the new item.
136 */
137typedef struct lval_S {
138 char_u *ll_name; /* start of variable name (can be NULL) */
139 char_u *ll_exp_name; /* NULL or expanded name in allocated memory. */
140 typval_T *ll_tv; /* Typeval of item being used. If "newkey"
141 isn't NULL it's the Dict to which to add
142 the item. */
143 listitem_T *ll_li; /* The list item or NULL. */
144 list_T *ll_list; /* The list or NULL. */
145 int ll_range; /* TRUE when a [i:j] range was used */
146 long ll_n1; /* First index for list */
147 long ll_n2; /* Second index for list range */
148 int ll_empty2; /* Second index is empty: [i:] */
149 dict_T *ll_dict; /* The Dictionary or NULL */
150 dictitem_T *ll_di; /* The dictitem or NULL */
151 char_u *ll_newkey; /* New key for Dict in alloc. mem or NULL. */
152} lval_T;
153
154
155static char *e_letunexp = N_("E18: Unexpected characters in :let")"E18: Unexpected characters in :let";
156static char *e_listidx = N_("E684: list index out of range: %" PRId64)"E684: list index out of range: %" "l" "d";

158static char *e_missbrac = N_("E111: Missing ']'")"E111: Missing ']'";
159static char *e_listarg = N_("E686: Argument of %s must be a List")"E686: Argument of %s must be a List";

166static char *e_dictkey = N_("E716: Key not present in Dictionary: %s")"E716: Key not present in Dictionary: %s";
167static char *e_funcexts = N_("E122: Function %s already exists, add ! to replace it"
168 "E122: Function %s already exists, add ! to replace it")"E122: Function %s already exists, add ! to replace it";
169static char *e_funcdict = N_("E717: Dictionary entry already exists")"E717: Dictionary entry already exists";
170static char *e_funcref = N_("E718: Funcref required")"E718: Funcref required";
171static char *e_dictrange = N_("E719: Cannot use [:] with a Dictionary")"E719: Cannot use [:] with a Dictionary";
172static char *e_letwrong = N_("E734: Wrong variable type for %s=")"E734: Wrong variable type for %s=";
173static char *e_nofunc = N_("E130: Unknown function: %s")"E130: Unknown function: %s";
174static char *e_illvar = N_("E461: Illegal variable name: %s")"E461: Illegal variable name: %s";
175static char *e_float_as_string = N_("E806: using Float as a String")"E806: using Float as a String";

177static dictitem_T globvars_var; /* variable used for g: */
178#define globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab globvardict.dv_hashtab

180/*
181 * Old Vim variables such as "v:version" are also available without the "v:".
182 * Also in functions. We need a special hashtable for them.
183 */
184static hashtab_T compat_hashtab;
185
186/*
187 * When recursively copying lists and dicts we need to remember which ones we
188 * have done to avoid endless recursiveness. This unique ID is used for that.
189 * The last bit is used for previous_funccal, ignored when comparing.
190 */
191static int current_copyID = 0;
192#define COPYID_INC2 2
193#define COPYID_MASK(~0x1) (~0x1)
194
195/// Abort conversion to string after a recursion error.
196static bool_Bool did_echo_string_emsg = false0;

198/*
199 * Array to hold the hashtab with variables local to each sourced script.
200 * Each item holds a variable (nameless) that points to the dict_T.
201 */
202typedef struct {
203 dictitem_T sv_var;
204 dict_T sv_dict;
205} scriptvar_T;
206
207static garray_T ga_scripts = {0, 0, sizeof(scriptvar_T *), 4, NULL((void*)0)};
208#define SCRIPT_SV(id)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1]) (((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1])
209#define SCRIPT_VARS(id)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1])->sv_dict
.dv_hashtab) (SCRIPT_SV(id)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(id) - 1])->sv_dict.dv_hashtab)

211static int echo_attr = 0; /* attributes used for ":echo" */
212
213/* Values for trans_function_name() argument: */
214#define TFN_INT1 1 /* internal function name OK */
215#define TFN_QUIET2 2 /* no error messages */
216#define TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD4 4 /* do not use script autoloading */
217
218/* Values for get_lval() flags argument: */
219#define GLV_QUIET2 TFN_QUIET2 /* no error messages */
220#define GLV_NO_AUTOLOAD4 TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD4 /* do not use script autoloading */
221
222/*
223 * Structure to hold info for a user function.
224 */
225typedef struct ufunc ufunc_T;
226
227struct ufunc {
228 int uf_varargs; /* variable nr of arguments */
229 int uf_flags;
230 int uf_calls; /* nr of active calls */
231 garray_T uf_args; /* arguments */
232 garray_T uf_lines; /* function lines */
233 int uf_profiling; /* TRUE when func is being profiled */
234 /* profiling the function as a whole */
235 int uf_tm_count; /* nr of calls */
236 proftime_T uf_tm_total; /* time spent in function + children */
237 proftime_T uf_tm_self; /* time spent in function itself */
238 proftime_T uf_tm_children; /* time spent in children this call */
239 /* profiling the function per line */
240 int *uf_tml_count; /* nr of times line was executed */
241 proftime_T *uf_tml_total; /* time spent in a line + children */
242 proftime_T *uf_tml_self; /* time spent in a line itself */
243 proftime_T uf_tml_start; /* start time for current line */
244 proftime_T uf_tml_children; /* time spent in children for this line */
245 proftime_T uf_tml_wait; /* start wait time for current line */
246 int uf_tml_idx; /* index of line being timed; -1 if none */
247 int uf_tml_execed; /* line being timed was executed */
248 scid_T uf_script_ID; /* ID of script where function was defined,
249 used for s: variables */
250 int uf_refcount; /* for numbered function: reference count */
251 char_u uf_name[1]; /* name of function (actually longer); can
252 start with <SNR>123_ (<SNR> is K_SPECIAL
253 KS_EXTRA KE_SNR) */
254};
255
256/* function flags */
257#define FC_ABORT1 1 /* abort function on error */
258#define FC_RANGE2 2 /* function accepts range */
259#define FC_DICT4 4 /* Dict function, uses "self" */
260
261/*
262 * All user-defined functions are found in this hashtable.
263 */
264static hashtab_T func_hashtab;
265
266/* The names of packages that once were loaded are remembered. */
267static garray_T ga_loaded = {0, 0, sizeof(char_u *), 4, NULL((void*)0)};
268
269/* list heads for garbage collection */
270static dict_T *first_dict = NULL((void*)0); /* list of all dicts */
271static list_T *first_list = NULL((void*)0); /* list of all lists */
272
273/* From user function to hashitem and back. */
274static ufunc_T dumuf;
275#define UF2HIKEY(fp)((fp)->uf_name) ((fp)->uf_name)
276#define HIKEY2UF(p)((ufunc_T *)(p - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&dumuf))) ((ufunc_T *)(p - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&dumuf)))
277#define HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf))) HIKEY2UF((hi)->hi_key)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)))
278
279#define FUNCARG(fp, j)((char_u **)(fp->uf_args.ga_data))[j] ((char_u **)(fp->uf_args.ga_data))[j]
280#define FUNCLINE(fp, j)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[j] ((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[j]
281
282#define MAX_FUNC_ARGS20 20 /* maximum number of function arguments */
283#define VAR_SHORT_LEN20 20 /* short variable name length */
284#define FIXVAR_CNT12 12 /* number of fixed variables */
285
286/* structure to hold info for a function that is currently being executed. */
287typedef struct funccall_S funccall_T;
288
289struct funccall_S {
290 ufunc_T *func; /* function being called */
291 int linenr; /* next line to be executed */
292 int returned; /* ":return" used */
293 struct /* fixed variables for arguments */
294 {
295 dictitem_T var; /* variable (without room for name) */
296 char_u room[VAR_SHORT_LEN20]; /* room for the name */
297 } fixvar[FIXVAR_CNT12];
298 dict_T l_vars; /* l: local function variables */
299 dictitem_T l_vars_var; /* variable for l: scope */
300 dict_T l_avars; /* a: argument variables */
301 dictitem_T l_avars_var; /* variable for a: scope */
302 list_T l_varlist; /* list for a:000 */
303 listitem_T l_listitems[MAX_FUNC_ARGS20]; /* listitems for a:000 */
304 typval_T *rettv; /* return value */
305 linenr_T breakpoint; /* next line with breakpoint or zero */
306 int dbg_tick; /* debug_tick when breakpoint was set */
307 int level; /* top nesting level of executed function */
308 proftime_T prof_child; /* time spent in a child */
309 funccall_T *caller; /* calling function or NULL */
310};
311
312/*
313 * Info used by a ":for" loop.
314 */
315typedef struct {
316 int fi_semicolon; /* TRUE if ending in '; var]' */
317 int fi_varcount; /* nr of variables in the list */
318 listwatch_T fi_lw; /* keep an eye on the item used. */
319 list_T *fi_list; /* list being used */
320} forinfo_T;
321
322/*
323 * Struct used by trans_function_name()
324 */
325typedef struct {
326 dict_T *fd_dict; /* Dictionary used */
327 char_u *fd_newkey; /* new key in "dict" in allocated memory */
328 dictitem_T *fd_di; /* Dictionary item used */
329} funcdict_T;
330
331/*
332 * enum used by var_flavour()
333 */
334typedef enum {
335 VAR_FLAVOUR_DEFAULT, /* doesn't start with uppercase */
336 VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION, /* starts with uppercase, some lower */
337 VAR_FLAVOUR_VIMINFO /* all uppercase */
338} var_flavour_T;
339
340/*
341 * Array to hold the value of v: variables.
342 * The value is in a dictitem, so that it can also be used in the v: scope.
343 * The reason to use this table anyway is for very quick access to the
344 * variables with the VV_ defines.
345 */
346#include "nvim/version_defs.h"
347
348/* values for vv_flags: */
349#define VV_COMPAT1 1 /* compatible, also used without "v:" */
350#define VV_RO2 2 /* read-only */
351#define VV_RO_SBX4 4 /* read-only in the sandbox */
352
353#define VV_NAME(s, t)s, {{t, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0} s, {{t, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0}
354
355static struct vimvar {
356 char *vv_name; /* name of variable, without v: */
357 dictitem_T vv_di; /* value and name for key */
358 char vv_filler[16]; /* space for LONGEST name below!!! */
359 char vv_flags; /* VV_COMPAT, VV_RO, VV_RO_SBX */
360} vimvars[VV_LEN] =
361{
362 /*
363 * The order here must match the VV_ defines in vim.h!
364 * Initializing a union does not work, leave tv.vval empty to get zero's.
365 */
366 {VV_NAME("count", VAR_NUMBER)"count", {{1, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0}, VV_COMPAT1+VV_RO2},

419 {VV_NAME("searchforward", VAR_NUMBER)"searchforward", {{1, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0}, 0},
420 {VV_NAME("hlsearch", VAR_NUMBER)"hlsearch", {{1, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0}, 0},
421 {VV_NAME("oldfiles", VAR_LIST)"oldfiles", {{4, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0}, 0},
422 {VV_NAME("windowid", VAR_NUMBER)"windowid", {{1, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0}, VV_RO2},
423 {VV_NAME("progpath", VAR_STRING)"progpath", {{2, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0}, VV_RO2},
424 {VV_NAME("job_data", VAR_LIST)"job_data", {{4, 0, {0}}, 0, {0}}, {0}, 0}
425};
426
427/* shorthand */
428#define vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type vv_di.di_tv.v_type
429#define vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number
430#define vv_floatvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_float vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_float
431#define vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string
432#define vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list vv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list
433#define vv_tvvv_di.di_tv vv_di.di_tv
434
435static dictitem_T vimvars_var; /* variable used for v: */
436#define vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab vimvardict.dv_hashtab
437
438#ifdef INCLUDE_GENERATED_DECLARATIONS1
439# include "eval.c.generated.h"
440#endif
441
442#define FNE_INCL_BR1 1 /* find_name_end(): include [] in name */
443#define FNE_CHECK_START2 2 /* find_name_end(): check name starts with
444 valid character */
445
446/*
447 * Initialize the global and v: variables.
448 */
449void eval_init(void)
450{
451 int i;
452 struct vimvar *p;
453
454 init_var_dict(&globvardict, &globvars_var, VAR_DEF_SCOPE2);
455 init_var_dict(&vimvardict, &vimvars_var, VAR_SCOPE1);
456 vimvardict.dv_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
457 hash_init(&compat_hashtab);
458 hash_init(&func_hashtab);
459
460 for (i = 0; i < VV_LEN; ++i) {
461 p = &vimvars[i];
462 STRCPY(p->vv_di.di_key, p->vv_name)strcpy((char *)(p->vv_di.di_key), (char *)(p->vv_name));
463 if (p->vv_flags & VV_RO2)
464 p->vv_di.di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
465 else if (p->vv_flags & VV_RO_SBX4)
466 p->vv_di.di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO_SBX2 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
467 else
468 p->vv_di.di_flags = DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
469
470 /* add to v: scope dict, unless the value is not always available */
471 if (p->vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0)
472 hash_add(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, p->vv_di.di_key);
473 if (p->vv_flags & VV_COMPAT1)
474 /* add to compat scope dict */
475 hash_add(&compat_hashtab, p->vv_di.di_key);
476 }
477 set_vim_var_nr(VV_SEARCHFORWARD, 1L);
478 set_vim_var_nr(VV_HLSEARCH, 1L);
479 set_reg_var(0); /* default for v:register is not 0 but '"' */
480
481}
482
483#if defined(EXITFREE) || defined(PROTO)
484void eval_clear(void)
485{
486 struct vimvar *p;
487
488 for (int i = 0; i < VV_LEN; ++i) {
489 p = &vimvars[i];
490 if (p->vv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2) {
491 free(p->vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string);
492 p->vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
493 } else if (p->vv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
494 list_unref(p->vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list);
495 p->vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list = NULL((void*)0);
496 }
497 }
498 hash_clear(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab);
499 hash_init(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab); /* garbage_collect() will access it */
500 hash_clear(&compat_hashtab);
501
502 free_scriptnames();
503 free_locales();
504
505 /* global variables */
506 vars_clear(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab);
507
508 /* autoloaded script names */
509 ga_clear_strings(&ga_loaded);
510
511 /* Script-local variables. First clear all the variables and in a second
512 * loop free the scriptvar_T, because a variable in one script might hold
513 * a reference to the whole scope of another script. */
514 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i)
515 vars_clear(&SCRIPT_VARS(i)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1])->sv_dict.
dv_hashtab));
516 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i)
517 free(SCRIPT_SV(i)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1]));
518 ga_clear(&ga_scripts);
519
520 /* unreferenced lists and dicts */
521 (void)garbage_collect();
522
523 /* functions */
524 free_all_functions();
525 hash_clear(&func_hashtab);
526}
527
528#endif
529
530/*
531 * Return the name of the executed function.
532 */
533char_u *func_name(void *cookie)
534{
535 return ((funccall_T *)cookie)->func->uf_name;
536}
537
538/*
539 * Return the address holding the next breakpoint line for a funccall cookie.
540 */
541linenr_T *func_breakpoint(void *cookie)
542{
543 return &((funccall_T *)cookie)->breakpoint;
544}
545
546/*
547 * Return the address holding the debug tick for a funccall cookie.
548 */
549int *func_dbg_tick(void *cookie)
550{
551 return &((funccall_T *)cookie)->dbg_tick;
552}
553
554/*
555 * Return the nesting level for a funccall cookie.
556 */
557int func_level(void *cookie)
558{
559 return ((funccall_T *)cookie)->level;
560}
561
562/* pointer to funccal for currently active function */
563funccall_T *current_funccal = NULL((void*)0);
564
565/* pointer to list of previously used funccal, still around because some
566 * item in it is still being used. */
567funccall_T *previous_funccal = NULL((void*)0);
568
569/*
570 * Return TRUE when a function was ended by a ":return" command.
571 */
572int current_func_returned(void)
573{
574 return current_funccal->returned;
575}
576
577/*
578 * Set an internal variable to a string value. Creates the variable if it does
579 * not already exist.
580 */
581void set_internal_string_var(char_u *name, char_u *value)
582{
583 char_u *val = vim_strsave(value);
584 typval_T *tvp = xcalloc(1, sizeof(typval_T));
585
586 tvp->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
587 tvp->vval.v_string = val;
588 set_var(name, tvp, FALSE0);
589 free_tv(tvp);
590}
591
592static lval_T *redir_lval = NULL((void*)0);
593static garray_T redir_ga; /* only valid when redir_lval is not NULL */
594static char_u *redir_endp = NULL((void*)0);
595static char_u *redir_varname = NULL((void*)0);
596
597/*
598 * Start recording command output to a variable
599 * Returns OK if successfully completed the setup. FAIL otherwise.
600 */
601int
602var_redir_start (
603 char_u *name,
604 int append /* append to an existing variable */
605)
606{
607 int save_emsg;
608 int err;
609 typval_T tv;
610
611 /* Catch a bad name early. */
612 if (!eval_isnamec1(*name)) {
613 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
614 return FAIL0;
615 }
616
617 /* Make a copy of the name, it is used in redir_lval until redir ends. */
618 redir_varname = vim_strsave(name);
619
620 redir_lval = xcalloc(1, sizeof(lval_T));
621
622 /* The output is stored in growarray "redir_ga" until redirection ends. */
623 ga_init(&redir_ga, (int)sizeof(char), 500);
624
625 /* Parse the variable name (can be a dict or list entry). */
626 redir_endp = get_lval(redir_varname, NULL((void*)0), redir_lval, FALSE0, FALSE0, 0,
627 FNE_CHECK_START2);
628 if (redir_endp == NULL((void*)0) || redir_lval->ll_name == NULL((void*)0) || *redir_endp !=
629 NUL'\000') {
630 clear_lval(redir_lval);
631 if (redir_endp != NULL((void*)0) && *redir_endp != NUL'\000')
632 /* Trailing characters are present after the variable name */
633 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
634 else
635 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
636 redir_endp = NULL((void*)0); /* don't store a value, only cleanup */
637 var_redir_stop();
638 return FAIL0;
639 }
640
641 /* check if we can write to the variable: set it to or append an empty
642 * string */
643 save_emsg = did_emsg;
644 did_emsg = FALSE0;
645 tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
646 tv.vval.v_string = (char_u *)"";
647 if (append)
648 set_var_lval(redir_lval, redir_endp, &tv, TRUE1, (char_u *)".");
649 else
650 set_var_lval(redir_lval, redir_endp, &tv, TRUE1, (char_u *)"=");
651 clear_lval(redir_lval);
652 err = did_emsg;
653 did_emsg |= save_emsg;
654 if (err) {
655 redir_endp = NULL((void*)0); /* don't store a value, only cleanup */
656 var_redir_stop();
657 return FAIL0;
658 }
659
660 return OK1;
661}
662
663/*
664 * Append "value[value_len]" to the variable set by var_redir_start().
665 * The actual appending is postponed until redirection ends, because the value
666 * appended may in fact be the string we write to, changing it may cause freed
667 * memory to be used:
668 * :redir => foo
669 * :let foo
670 * :redir END
671 */
672void var_redir_str(char_u *value, int value_len)
673{
674 int len;
675
676 if (redir_lval == NULL((void*)0))
677 return;
678
679 if (value_len == -1)
680 len = (int)STRLEN(value)strlen((char *)(value)); /* Append the entire string */
681 else
682 len = value_len; /* Append only "value_len" characters */
683
684 ga_grow(&redir_ga, len);
685 memmove((char *)redir_ga.ga_data + redir_ga.ga_len, value, len);
686 redir_ga.ga_len += len;
687}
688
689/*
690 * Stop redirecting command output to a variable.
691 * Frees the allocated memory.
692 */
693void var_redir_stop(void)
694{
695 typval_T tv;
696
697 if (redir_lval != NULL((void*)0)) {
698 /* If there was no error: assign the text to the variable. */
699 if (redir_endp != NULL((void*)0)) {
700 ga_append(&redir_ga, NUL'\000'); /* Append the trailing NUL. */
701 tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
702 tv.vval.v_string = redir_ga.ga_data;
703 /* Call get_lval() again, if it's inside a Dict or List it may
704 * have changed. */
705 redir_endp = get_lval(redir_varname, NULL((void*)0), redir_lval,
706 FALSE0, FALSE0, 0, FNE_CHECK_START2);
707 if (redir_endp != NULL((void*)0) && redir_lval->ll_name != NULL((void*)0))
708 set_var_lval(redir_lval, redir_endp, &tv, FALSE0, (char_u *)".");
709 clear_lval(redir_lval);
710 }
711
712 /* free the collected output */
713 free(redir_ga.ga_data);
714 redir_ga.ga_data = NULL((void*)0);
715
716 free(redir_lval);
717 redir_lval = NULL((void*)0);
718 }
719 free(redir_varname);
720 redir_varname = NULL((void*)0);
721}
722
723int eval_charconvert(char_u *enc_from, char_u *enc_to, char_u *fname_from, char_u *fname_to)
724{
725 int err = FALSE0;
726
727 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_FROM, enc_from, -1);
728 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_TO, enc_to, -1);
729 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, fname_from, -1);
730 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, fname_to, -1);
731 if (eval_to_bool(p_ccv, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0))
732 err = TRUE1;
733 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_FROM, NULL((void*)0), -1);
734 set_vim_var_string(VV_CC_TO, NULL((void*)0), -1);
735 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
736 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, NULL((void*)0), -1);
737
738 if (err)
739 return FAIL0;
740 return OK1;
741}
742
743int eval_printexpr(char_u *fname, char_u *args)
744{
745 int err = FALSE0;
746
747 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, fname, -1);
748 set_vim_var_string(VV_CMDARG, args, -1);
749 if (eval_to_bool(p_pexpr, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0))
750 err = TRUE1;
751 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
752 set_vim_var_string(VV_CMDARG, NULL((void*)0), -1);
753
754 if (err) {
755 os_remove((char *)fname);
756 return FAIL0;
757 }
758 return OK1;
759}
760
761void eval_diff(char_u *origfile, char_u *newfile, char_u *outfile)
762{
763 int err = FALSE0;
764
765 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, origfile, -1);
766 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_NEW, newfile, -1);
767 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, outfile, -1);
768 (void)eval_to_bool(p_dex, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
769 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
770 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_NEW, NULL((void*)0), -1);
771 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, NULL((void*)0), -1);
772}
773
774void eval_patch(char_u *origfile, char_u *difffile, char_u *outfile)
775{
776 int err;
777
778 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, origfile, -1);
779 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_DIFF, difffile, -1);
780 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, outfile, -1);
781 (void)eval_to_bool(p_pex, &err, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
782 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_IN, NULL((void*)0), -1);
783 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_DIFF, NULL((void*)0), -1);
784 set_vim_var_string(VV_FNAME_OUT, NULL((void*)0), -1);
785}
786
787/*
788 * Top level evaluation function, returning a boolean.
789 * Sets "error" to TRUE if there was an error.
790 * Return TRUE or FALSE.
791 */
792int
793eval_to_bool (
794 char_u *arg,
795 int *error,
796 char_u **nextcmd,
797 int skip /* only parse, don't execute */
798)
799{
800 typval_T tv;
801 int retval = FALSE0;
802
803 if (skip)
804 ++emsg_skip;
805 if (eval0(arg, &tv, nextcmd, !skip) == FAIL0)
806 *error = TRUE1;
807 else {
808 *error = FALSE0;
809 if (!skip) {
810 retval = (get_tv_number_chk(&tv, error) != 0);
811 clear_tv(&tv);
812 }
813 }
814 if (skip)
815 --emsg_skip;
816
817 return retval;
818}
819
820/*
821 * Top level evaluation function, returning a string. If "skip" is TRUE,
822 * only parsing to "nextcmd" is done, without reporting errors. Return
823 * pointer to allocated memory, or NULL for failure or when "skip" is TRUE.
824 */
825char_u *
826eval_to_string_skip (
827 char_u *arg,
828 char_u **nextcmd,
829 int skip /* only parse, don't execute */
830)
831{
832 typval_T tv;
833 char_u *retval;
834
835 if (skip)
836 ++emsg_skip;
837 if (eval0(arg, &tv, nextcmd, !skip) == FAIL0 || skip)
838 retval = NULL((void*)0);
839 else {
840 retval = vim_strsave(get_tv_string(&tv));
841 clear_tv(&tv);
842 }
843 if (skip)
844 --emsg_skip;
845
846 return retval;
847}
848
849/*
850 * Skip over an expression at "*pp".
851 * Return FAIL for an error, OK otherwise.
852 */
853int skip_expr(char_u **pp)
854{
855 typval_T rettv;
856
857 *pp = skipwhite(*pp);
858 return eval1(pp, &rettv, FALSE0);
859}
860
861/*
862 * Top level evaluation function, returning a string.
863 * When "convert" is TRUE convert a List into a sequence of lines and convert
864 * a Float to a String.
865 * Return pointer to allocated memory, or NULL for failure.
866 */
867char_u *eval_to_string(char_u *arg, char_u **nextcmd, int convert)
868{
869 typval_T tv;
870 char_u *retval;
871 garray_T ga;
872 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
873
874 if (eval0(arg, &tv, nextcmd, TRUE1) == FAIL0)
875 retval = NULL((void*)0);
876 else {
877 if (convert && tv.v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
878 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char), 80);
879 if (tv.vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
880 list_join(&ga, tv.vval.v_list, (char_u *)"\n", TRUE1, 0);
881 if (tv.vval.v_list->lv_len > 0)
882 ga_append(&ga, NL'\012');
883 }
884 ga_append(&ga, NUL'\000');
885 retval = (char_u *)ga.ga_data;
886 } else if (convert && tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
887 vim_snprintf((char *)numbuf, NUMBUFLEN30, "%g", tv.vval.v_float);
888 retval = vim_strsave(numbuf);
889 } else
890 retval = vim_strsave(get_tv_string(&tv));
891 clear_tv(&tv);
892 }
893
894 return retval;
895}
896
897/*
898 * Call eval_to_string() without using current local variables and using
899 * textlock. When "use_sandbox" is TRUE use the sandbox.
900 */
901char_u *eval_to_string_safe(char_u *arg, char_u **nextcmd, int use_sandbox)
902{
903 char_u *retval;
904 void *save_funccalp;
905
906 save_funccalp = save_funccal();
907 if (use_sandbox)
908 ++sandbox;
909 ++textlock;
910 retval = eval_to_string(arg, nextcmd, FALSE0);
911 if (use_sandbox)
912 --sandbox;
913 --textlock;
914 restore_funccal(save_funccalp);
915 return retval;
916}
917
918/*
919 * Top level evaluation function, returning a number.
920 * Evaluates "expr" silently.
921 * Returns -1 for an error.
922 */
923int eval_to_number(char_u *expr)
924{
925 typval_T rettv;
926 int retval;
927 char_u *p = skipwhite(expr);
928
929 ++emsg_off;
930
931 if (eval1(&p, &rettv, TRUE1) == FAIL0)
932 retval = -1;
933 else {
934 retval = get_tv_number_chk(&rettv, NULL((void*)0));
935 clear_tv(&rettv);
936 }
937 --emsg_off;
938
939 return retval;
940}
941
942
943/*
944 * Prepare v: variable "idx" to be used.
945 * Save the current typeval in "save_tv".
946 * When not used yet add the variable to the v: hashtable.
947 */
948static void prepare_vimvar(int idx, typval_T *save_tv)
949{
950 *save_tv = vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv;
951 if (vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0)
952 hash_add(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, vimvars[idx].vv_di.di_key);
953}
954
955/*
956 * Restore v: variable "idx" to typeval "save_tv".
957 * When no longer defined, remove the variable from the v: hashtable.
958 */
959static void restore_vimvar(int idx, typval_T *save_tv)
960{
961 hashitem_T *hi;
962
963 vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv = *save_tv;
964 if (vimvars[idx].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
965 hi = hash_find(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, vimvars[idx].vv_di.di_key);
966 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
967 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "restore_vimvar()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("restore_vimvar()"
));
968 else
969 hash_remove(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, hi);
970 }
971}
972
973/*
974 * Evaluate an expression to a list with suggestions.
975 * For the "expr:" part of 'spellsuggest'.
976 * Returns NULL when there is an error.
977 */
978list_T *eval_spell_expr(char_u *badword, char_u *expr)
979{
980 typval_T save_val;
981 typval_T rettv;
982 list_T *list = NULL((void*)0);
983 char_u *p = skipwhite(expr);
984
985 /* Set "v:val" to the bad word. */
986 prepare_vimvar(VV_VAL, &save_val);
987 vimvars[VV_VAL].vv_typevv_di.di_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
988 vimvars[VV_VAL].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = badword;
989 if (p_verbose == 0)
990 ++emsg_off;
991
992 if (eval1(&p, &rettv, TRUE1) == OK1) {
993 if (rettv.v_type != VAR_LIST4)
994 clear_tv(&rettv);
995 else
996 list = rettv.vval.v_list;
997 }
998
999 if (p_verbose == 0)
1000 --emsg_off;
1001 restore_vimvar(VV_VAL, &save_val);
1002
1003 return list;
1004}
1005
1006/*
1007 * "list" is supposed to contain two items: a word and a number. Return the
1008 * word in "pp" and the number as the return value.
1009 * Return -1 if anything isn't right.
1010 * Used to get the good word and score from the eval_spell_expr() result.
1011 */
1012int get_spellword(list_T *list, char_u **pp)
1013{
1014 listitem_T *li;
1015
1016 li = list->lv_first;
1017 if (li == NULL((void*)0))
1018 return -1;
1019 *pp = get_tv_string(&li->li_tv);
1020
1021 li = li->li_next;
1022 if (li == NULL((void*)0))
1023 return -1;
1024 return get_tv_number(&li->li_tv);
1025}
1026
1027/*
1028 * Top level evaluation function.
1029 * Returns an allocated typval_T with the result.
1030 * Returns NULL when there is an error.
1031 */
1032typval_T *eval_expr(char_u *arg, char_u **nextcmd)
1033{
1034 typval_T *tv = xmalloc(sizeof(typval_T));
1035
1036 if (eval0(arg, tv, nextcmd, TRUE1) == FAIL0) {
1037 free(tv);
1038 return NULL((void*)0);
1039 }
1040
1041 return tv;
1042}
1043
1044
1045/*
1046 * Call some vimL function and return the result in "*rettv".
1047 * Uses argv[argc] for the function arguments. Only Number and String
1048 * arguments are currently supported.
1049 * Returns OK or FAIL.
1050 */
1051int
1052call_vim_function (
1053 char_u *func,
1054 int argc,
1055 char_u **argv,
1056 int safe, /* use the sandbox */
1057 int str_arg_only, /* all arguments are strings */
1058 typval_T *rettv
1059)
1060{
1061 long n;
1062 int len;
1063 int doesrange;
1064 void *save_funccalp = NULL((void*)0);
1065 int ret;
1066
1067 typval_T *argvars = xmalloc((argc + 1) * sizeof(typval_T));
1068
1069 for (int i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
1070 /* Pass a NULL or empty argument as an empty string */
1071 if (argv[i] == NULL((void*)0) || *argv[i] == NUL'\000') {
1072 argvars[i].v_type = VAR_STRING2;
1073 argvars[i].vval.v_string = (char_u *)"";
1074 continue;
1075 }
1076
1077 if (str_arg_only)
1078 len = 0;
1079 else
1080 /* Recognize a number argument, the others must be strings. */
1081 vim_str2nr(argv[i], NULL((void*)0), &len, TRUE1, TRUE1, &n, NULL((void*)0));
1082 if (len != 0 && len == (int)STRLEN(argv[i])strlen((char *)(argv[i]))) {
1083 argvars[i].v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
1084 argvars[i].vval.v_number = n;
1085 } else {
1086 argvars[i].v_type = VAR_STRING2;
1087 argvars[i].vval.v_string = argv[i];
1088 }
1089 }
1090
1091 if (safe) {
1092 save_funccalp = save_funccal();
1093 ++sandbox;
1094 }
1095
1096 rettv->v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0; /* clear_tv() uses this */
1097 ret = call_func(func, (int)STRLEN(func)strlen((char *)(func)), rettv, argc, argvars,
1098 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
1099 &doesrange, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
1100 if (safe) {
1101 --sandbox;
1102 restore_funccal(save_funccalp);
1103 }
1104 free(argvars);
1105
1106 if (ret == FAIL0)
1107 clear_tv(rettv);
1108
1109 return ret;
1110}
1111
1112/*
1113 * Call vimL function "func" and return the result as a number.
1114 * Returns -1 when calling the function fails.
1115 * Uses argv[argc] for the function arguments.
1116 */
1117long
1118call_func_retnr (
1119 char_u *func,
1120 int argc,
1121 char_u **argv,
1122 int safe /* use the sandbox */
1123)
1124{
1125 typval_T rettv;
1126 long retval;
1127
1128 /* All arguments are passed as strings, no conversion to number. */
1129 if (call_vim_function(func, argc, argv, safe, TRUE1, &rettv) == FAIL0)
1130 return -1;
1131
1132 retval = get_tv_number_chk(&rettv, NULL((void*)0));
1133 clear_tv(&rettv);
1134 return retval;
1135}
1136
1137/*
1138 * Call vimL function "func" and return the result as a string.
1139 * Returns NULL when calling the function fails.
1140 * Uses argv[argc] for the function arguments.
1141 */
1142void *
1143call_func_retstr (
1144 char_u *func,
1145 int argc,
1146 char_u **argv,
1147 int safe /* use the sandbox */
1148)
1149{
1150 typval_T rettv;
1151 char_u *retval;
1152
1153 /* All arguments are passed as strings, no conversion to number. */
1154 if (call_vim_function(func, argc, argv, safe, TRUE1, &rettv) == FAIL0)
1155 return NULL((void*)0);
1156
1157 retval = vim_strsave(get_tv_string(&rettv));
1158 clear_tv(&rettv);
1159 return retval;
1160}
1161
1162/*
1163 * Call vimL function "func" and return the result as a List.
1164 * Uses argv[argc] for the function arguments.
1165 * Returns NULL when there is something wrong.
1166 */
1167void *
1168call_func_retlist (
1169 char_u *func,
1170 int argc,
1171 char_u **argv,
1172 int safe /* use the sandbox */
1173)
1174{
1175 typval_T rettv;
1176
1177 /* All arguments are passed as strings, no conversion to number. */
1178 if (call_vim_function(func, argc, argv, safe, TRUE1, &rettv) == FAIL0)
1179 return NULL((void*)0);
1180
1181 if (rettv.v_type != VAR_LIST4) {
1182 clear_tv(&rettv);
1183 return NULL((void*)0);
1184 }
1185
1186 return rettv.vval.v_list;
1187}
1188
1189/*
1190 * Save the current function call pointer, and set it to NULL.
1191 * Used when executing autocommands and for ":source".
1192 */
1193void *save_funccal(void)
1194{
1195 funccall_T *fc = current_funccal;
1196
1197 current_funccal = NULL((void*)0);
1198 return (void *)fc;
1199}
1200
1201void restore_funccal(void *vfc)
1202{
1203 funccall_T *fc = (funccall_T *)vfc;
1204
1205 current_funccal = fc;
1206}
1207
1208/*
1209 * Prepare profiling for entering a child or something else that is not
1210 * counted for the script/function itself.
1211 * Should always be called in pair with prof_child_exit().
1212 */
1213void prof_child_enter(proftime_T *tm /* place to store waittime */
1214 )
1215{
1216 funccall_T *fc = current_funccal;
1217
1218 if (fc != NULL((void*)0) && fc->func->uf_profiling) {
1219 fc->prof_child = profile_start();
1220 }
1221
1222 script_prof_save(tm);
1223}
1224
1225/*
1226 * Take care of time spent in a child.
1227 * Should always be called after prof_child_enter().
1228 */
1229void prof_child_exit(proftime_T *tm /* where waittime was stored */
1230 )
1231{
1232 funccall_T *fc = current_funccal;
1233
1234 if (fc != NULL((void*)0) && fc->func->uf_profiling) {
1235 fc->prof_child = profile_end(fc->prof_child);
1236 // don't count waiting time
1237 fc->prof_child = profile_sub_wait(*tm, fc->prof_child);
1238 fc->func->uf_tm_children =
1239 profile_add(fc->func->uf_tm_children, fc->prof_child);
1240 fc->func->uf_tml_children =
1241 profile_add(fc->func->uf_tml_children, fc->prof_child);
1242 }
1243 script_prof_restore(tm);
1244}
1245
1246
1247/*
1248 * Evaluate 'foldexpr'. Returns the foldlevel, and any character preceding
1249 * it in "*cp". Doesn't give error messages.
1250 */
1251int eval_foldexpr(char_u *arg, int *cp)
1252{
1253 typval_T tv;
1254 int retval;
1255 char_u *s;
1256 int use_sandbox = was_set_insecurely((char_u *)"foldexpr",
1257 OPT_LOCAL4);
1258
1259 ++emsg_off;
1260 if (use_sandbox)
1261 ++sandbox;
1262 ++textlock;
1263 *cp = NUL'\000';
1264 if (eval0(arg, &tv, NULL((void*)0), TRUE1) == FAIL0)
1265 retval = 0;
1266 else {
1267 /* If the result is a number, just return the number. */
1268 if (tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1)
1269 retval = tv.vval.v_number;
1270 else if (tv.v_type != VAR_STRING2 || tv.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0))
1271 retval = 0;
1272 else {
1273 /* If the result is a string, check if there is a non-digit before
1274 * the number. */
1275 s = tv.vval.v_string;
1276 if (!VIM_ISDIGIT(*s)((unsigned)(*s) - '0' < 10) && *s != '-')
1277 *cp = *s++;
1278 retval = atol((char *)s);
1279 }
1280 clear_tv(&tv);
1281 }
1282 --emsg_off;
1283 if (use_sandbox)
1284 --sandbox;
1285 --textlock;
1286
1287 return retval;
1288}
1289
1290/*
1291 * ":let" list all variable values
1292 * ":let var1 var2" list variable values
1293 * ":let var = expr" assignment command.
1294 * ":let var += expr" assignment command.
1295 * ":let var -= expr" assignment command.
1296 * ":let var .= expr" assignment command.
1297 * ":let [var1, var2] = expr" unpack list.
1298 */
1299void ex_let(exarg_T *eap)
1300{
1301 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
1302 char_u *expr = NULL((void*)0);
1303 typval_T rettv;
1304 int i;
1305 int var_count = 0;
1306 int semicolon = 0;
1307 char_u op[2];
1308 char_u *argend;
1309 int first = TRUE1;
1310
1311 argend = skip_var_list(arg, &var_count, &semicolon);
1312 if (argend == NULL((void*)0))
1313 return;
1314 if (argend > arg && argend[-1] == '.') /* for var.='str' */
1315 --argend;
1316 expr = skipwhite(argend);
1317 if (*expr != '=' && !(vim_strchr((char_u *)"+-.", *expr) != NULL((void*)0)
1318 && expr[1] == '=')) {
1319 // ":let" without "=": list variables
1320 if (*arg == '[')
1321 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
1322 else if (!ends_excmd(*arg))
1323 /* ":let var1 var2" */
1324 arg = list_arg_vars(eap, arg, &first);
1325 else if (!eap->skip) {
1326 /* ":let" */
1327 list_glob_vars(&first);
1328 list_buf_vars(&first);
1329 list_win_vars(&first);
1330 list_tab_vars(&first);
1331 list_script_vars(&first);
1332 list_func_vars(&first);
1333 list_vim_vars(&first);
1334 }
1335 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
1336 } else {
1337 op[0] = '=';
1338 op[1] = NUL'\000';
1339 if (*expr != '=') {
1340 if (vim_strchr((char_u *)"+-.", *expr) != NULL((void*)0)) {
1341 op[0] = *expr; // +=, -=, .=
1342 }
1343 expr = skipwhite(expr + 2);
1344 } else {
1345 expr = skipwhite(expr + 1);
1346 }
1347
1348 if (eap->skip)
1349 ++emsg_skip;
1350 i = eval0(expr, &rettv, &eap->nextcmd, !eap->skip);
1351 if (eap->skip) {
1352 if (i != FAIL0)
1353 clear_tv(&rettv);
1354 --emsg_skip;
1355 } else if (i != FAIL0) {
1356 (void)ex_let_vars(eap->arg, &rettv, FALSE0, semicolon, var_count,
1357 op);
1358 clear_tv(&rettv);
1359 }
1360 }
1361}
1362
1363/*
1364 * Assign the typevalue "tv" to the variable or variables at "arg_start".
1365 * Handles both "var" with any type and "[var, var; var]" with a list type.
1366 * When "nextchars" is not NULL it points to a string with characters that
1367 * must appear after the variable(s). Use "+", "-" or "." for add, subtract
1368 * or concatenate.
1369 * Returns OK or FAIL;
1370 */
1371static int
1372ex_let_vars (
1373 char_u *arg_start,
1374 typval_T *tv,
1375 int copy, /* copy values from "tv", don't move */
1376 int semicolon, /* from skip_var_list() */
1377 int var_count, /* from skip_var_list() */
1378 char_u *nextchars
1379)
1380{
1381 char_u *arg = arg_start;
1382 list_T *l;
1383 int i;
1384 listitem_T *item;
1385 typval_T ltv;
1386
1387 if (*arg != '[') {
1388 /*
1389 * ":let var = expr" or ":for var in list"
1390 */
1391 if (ex_let_one(arg, tv, copy, nextchars, nextchars) == NULL((void*)0))
1392 return FAIL0;
1393 return OK1;
1394 }
1395
1396 /*
1397 * ":let [v1, v2] = list" or ":for [v1, v2] in listlist"
1398 */
1399 if (tv->v_type != VAR_LIST4 || (l = tv->vval.v_list) == NULL((void*)0)) {
1400 EMSG(_(e_listreq))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listreq))));
1401 return FAIL0;
1402 }
1403
1404 i = list_len(l);
1405 if (semicolon == 0 && var_count < i) {
1406 EMSG(_("E687: Less targets than List items"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E687: Less targets than List items"
))));
1407 return FAIL0;
1408 }
1409 if (var_count - semicolon > i) {
1410 EMSG(_("E688: More targets than List items"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E688: More targets than List items"
))));
1411 return FAIL0;
1412 }
1413
1414 item = l->lv_first;
1415 while (*arg != ']') {
1416 arg = skipwhite(arg + 1);
1417 arg = ex_let_one(arg, &item->li_tv, TRUE1, (char_u *)",;]", nextchars);
1418 item = item->li_next;
1419 if (arg == NULL((void*)0))
1420 return FAIL0;
1421
1422 arg = skipwhite(arg);
1423 if (*arg == ';') {
1424 /* Put the rest of the list (may be empty) in the var after ';'.
1425 * Create a new list for this. */
1426 l = list_alloc();
1427 while (item != NULL((void*)0)) {
1428 list_append_tv(l, &item->li_tv);
1429 item = item->li_next;
1430 }
1431
1432 ltv.v_type = VAR_LIST4;
1433 ltv.v_lock = 0;
1434 ltv.vval.v_list = l;
1435 l->lv_refcount = 1;
1436
1437 arg = ex_let_one(skipwhite(arg + 1), &ltv, FALSE0,
1438 (char_u *)"]", nextchars);
1439 clear_tv(&ltv);
1440 if (arg == NULL((void*)0))
1441 return FAIL0;
1442 break;
1443 } else if (*arg != ',' && *arg != ']') {
1444 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "ex_let_vars()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("ex_let_vars()"
));
1445 return FAIL0;
1446 }
1447 }
1448
1449 return OK1;
1450}
1451
1452/*
1453 * Skip over assignable variable "var" or list of variables "[var, var]".
1454 * Used for ":let varvar = expr" and ":for varvar in expr".
1455 * For "[var, var]" increment "*var_count" for each variable.
1456 * for "[var, var; var]" set "semicolon".
1457 * Return NULL for an error.
1458 */
1459static char_u *skip_var_list(char_u *arg, int *var_count, int *semicolon)
1460{
1461 char_u *p, *s;
1462
1463 if (*arg == '[') {
1464 /* "[var, var]": find the matching ']'. */
1465 p = arg;
1466 for (;; ) {
1467 p = skipwhite(p + 1); /* skip whites after '[', ';' or ',' */
1468 s = skip_var_one(p);
1469 if (s == p) {
1470 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), p)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(p)
);
1471 return NULL((void*)0);
1472 }
1473 ++*var_count;
1474
1475 p = skipwhite(s);
1476 if (*p == ']')
1477 break;
1478 else if (*p == ';') {
1479 if (*semicolon == 1) {
1480 EMSG(_("Double ; in list of variables"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("Double ; in list of variables"
))));
1481 return NULL((void*)0);
1482 }
1483 *semicolon = 1;
1484 } else if (*p != ',') {
1485 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), p)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(p)
);
1486 return NULL((void*)0);
1487 }
1488 }
1489 return p + 1;
1490 } else
1491 return skip_var_one(arg);
1492}
1493
1494/*
1495 * Skip one (assignable) variable name, including @r, $VAR, &option, d.key,
1496 * l[idx].
1497 */
1498static char_u *skip_var_one(char_u *arg)
1499{
1500 if (*arg == '@' && arg[1] != NUL'\000')
1501 return arg + 2;
1502 return find_name_end(*arg == '$' || *arg == '&' ? arg + 1 : arg,
1503 NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FNE_INCL_BR1 | FNE_CHECK_START2);
1504}
1505
1506/*
1507 * List variables for hashtab "ht" with prefix "prefix".
1508 * If "empty" is TRUE also list NULL strings as empty strings.
1509 */
1510static void list_hashtable_vars(hashtab_T *ht, char_u *prefix, int empty, int *first)
1511{
1512 hashitem_T *hi;
1513 dictitem_T *di;
1514 int todo;
1515
1516 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
1517 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
1518 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
1519 --todo;
1520 di = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
1521 if (empty || di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_STRING2
1522 || di->di_tv.vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0))
1523 list_one_var(di, prefix, first);
1524 }
1525 }
1526}
1527
1528/*
1529 * List global variables.
1530 */
1531static void list_glob_vars(int *first)
1532{
1533 list_hashtable_vars(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab, (char_u *)"", TRUE1, first);
1534}
1535
1536/*
1537 * List buffer variables.
1538 */
1539static void list_buf_vars(int *first)
1540{
1541 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
1542
1543 list_hashtable_vars(&curbuf->b_vars->dv_hashtab, (char_u *)"b:",
1544 TRUE1, first);
1545
1546 sprintf((char *)numbuf, "%" PRId64"l" "d", (int64_t)curbuf->b_changedtick);
1547 list_one_var_a((char_u *)"b:", (char_u *)"changedtick", VAR_NUMBER1,
1548 numbuf, first);
1549}
1550
1551/*
1552 * List window variables.
1553 */
1554static void list_win_vars(int *first)
1555{
1556 list_hashtable_vars(&curwin->w_vars->dv_hashtab,
1557 (char_u *)"w:", TRUE1, first);
1558}
1559
1560/*
1561 * List tab page variables.
1562 */
1563static void list_tab_vars(int *first)
1564{
1565 list_hashtable_vars(&curtab->tp_vars->dv_hashtab,
1566 (char_u *)"t:", TRUE1, first);
1567}
1568
1569/*
1570 * List Vim variables.
1571 */
1572static void list_vim_vars(int *first)
1573{
1574 list_hashtable_vars(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, (char_u *)"v:", FALSE0, first);
1575}
1576
1577/*
1578 * List script-local variables, if there is a script.
1579 */
1580static void list_script_vars(int *first)
1581{
1582 if (current_SID > 0 && current_SID <= ga_scripts.ga_len)
1583 list_hashtable_vars(&SCRIPT_VARS(current_SID)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(current_SID) - 1])->
sv_dict.dv_hashtab),
1584 (char_u *)"s:", FALSE0, first);
1585}
1586
1587/*
1588 * List function variables, if there is a function.
1589 */
1590static void list_func_vars(int *first)
1591{
1592 if (current_funccal != NULL((void*)0))
1593 list_hashtable_vars(&current_funccal->l_vars.dv_hashtab,
1594 (char_u *)"l:", FALSE0, first);
1595}
1596
1597/*
1598 * List variables in "arg".
1599 */
1600static char_u *list_arg_vars(exarg_T *eap, char_u *arg, int *first)
1601{
1602 int error = FALSE0;
1603 int len;
1604 char_u *name;
1605 char_u *name_start;
1606 char_u *arg_subsc;
1607 char_u *tofree;
1608 typval_T tv;
1609
1610 while (!ends_excmd(*arg) && !got_int) {
1611 if (error || eap->skip) {
1612 arg = find_name_end(arg, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FNE_INCL_BR1 | FNE_CHECK_START2);
1613 if (!vim_iswhite(*arg)((*arg) == ' ' || (*arg) == '\t') && !ends_excmd(*arg)) {
1614 emsg_severe = TRUE1;
1615 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
1616 break;
1617 }
1618 } else {
1619 /* get_name_len() takes care of expanding curly braces */
1620 name_start = name = arg;
1621 len = get_name_len(&arg, &tofree, TRUE1, TRUE1);
1622 if (len <= 0) {
1623 /* This is mainly to keep test 49 working: when expanding
1624 * curly braces fails overrule the exception error message. */
1625 if (len < 0 && !aborting()) {
1626 emsg_severe = TRUE1;
1627 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(arg
));
1628 break;
1629 }
1630 error = TRUE1;
1631 } else {
1632 if (tofree != NULL((void*)0))
1633 name = tofree;
1634 if (get_var_tv(name, len, &tv, TRUE1, FALSE0) == FAIL0)
1635 error = TRUE1;
1636 else {
1637 /* handle d.key, l[idx], f(expr) */
1638 arg_subsc = arg;
1639 if (handle_subscript(&arg, &tv, TRUE1, TRUE1) == FAIL0)
1640 error = TRUE1;
1641 else {
1642 if (arg == arg_subsc && len == 2 && name[1] == ':') {
1643 switch (*name) {
1644 case 'g': list_glob_vars(first); break;
1645 case 'b': list_buf_vars(first); break;
1646 case 'w': list_win_vars(first); break;
1647 case 't': list_tab_vars(first); break;
1648 case 'v': list_vim_vars(first); break;
1649 case 's': list_script_vars(first); break;
1650 case 'l': list_func_vars(first); break;
1651 default:
1652 EMSG2(_("E738: Can't list variables for %s"), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E738: Can't list variables for %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
1653 }
1654 } else {
1655 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
1656 char_u *tf;
1657 int c;
1658 char_u *s;
1659
1660 s = echo_string(&tv, &tf, numbuf, 0);
1661 c = *arg;
1662 *arg = NUL'\000';
1663 list_one_var_a((char_u *)"",
1664 arg == arg_subsc ? name : name_start,
1665 tv.v_type,
1666 s == NULL((void*)0) ? (char_u *)"" : s,
1667 first);
1668 *arg = c;
1669 free(tf);
1670 }
1671 clear_tv(&tv);
1672 }
1673 }
1674 }
1675
1676 free(tofree);
1677 }
1678
1679 arg = skipwhite(arg);
1680 }
1681
1682 return arg;
1683}
1684
1685/*
1686 * Set one item of ":let var = expr" or ":let [v1, v2] = list" to its value.
1687 * Returns a pointer to the char just after the var name.
1688 * Returns NULL if there is an error.
1689 */
1690static char_u *
1691ex_let_one (
1692 char_u *arg, /* points to variable name */
1693 typval_T *tv, /* value to assign to variable */
1694 int copy, /* copy value from "tv" */
1695 char_u *endchars, /* valid chars after variable name or NULL */
1696 char_u *op /* "+", "-", "." or NULL*/
1697)
1698{
1699 int c1;
1700 char_u *name;
1701 char_u *p;
1702 char_u *arg_end = NULL((void*)0);
1703 int len;
1704 int opt_flags;
1705 char_u *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
1706
1707 /*
1708 * ":let $VAR = expr": Set environment variable.
1709 */
1710 if (*arg == '$') {
1711 /* Find the end of the name. */
1712 ++arg;
1713 name = arg;
1714 len = get_env_len(&arg);
1715 if (len == 0)
1716 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), name - 1)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(name
- 1));
1717 else {
1718 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && (*op == '+' || *op == '-'))
1719 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (char_u *)(op
));
1720 else if (endchars != NULL((void*)0)
1721 && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(arg)) == NULL((void*)0))
1722 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1723 else if (!check_secure()) {
1724 c1 = name[len];
1725 name[len] = NUL'\000';
1726 p = get_tv_string_chk(tv);
1727 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && op != NULL((void*)0) && *op == '.') {
1728 int mustfree = FALSE0;
1729 char_u *s = vim_getenv(name, &mustfree);
1730
1731 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
1732 p = tofree = concat_str(s, p);
1733 if (mustfree)
1734 free(s);
1735 }
1736 }
1737 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
1738 vim_setenv(name, p);
1739 if (STRICMP(name, "HOME")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("HOME")) == 0)
1740 init_homedir();
1741 else if (didset_vim && STRICMP(name, "VIM")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("VIM")) == 0)
1742 didset_vim = FALSE0;
1743 else if (didset_vimruntime
1744 && STRICMP(name, "VIMRUNTIME")strcasecmp((char *)(name), (char *)("VIMRUNTIME")) == 0)
1745 didset_vimruntime = FALSE0;
1746 arg_end = arg;
1747 }
1748 name[len] = c1;
1749 free(tofree);
1750 }
1751 }
1752 }
1753 /*
1754 * ":let &option = expr": Set option value.
1755 * ":let &l:option = expr": Set local option value.
1756 * ":let &g:option = expr": Set global option value.
1757 */
1758 else if (*arg == '&') {
1759 /* Find the end of the name. */
1760 p = find_option_end(&arg, &opt_flags);
1761 if (p == NULL((void*)0) || (endchars != NULL((void*)0)
1762 && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(p)) == NULL((void*)0)))
1763 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1764 else {
1765 long n;
1766 int opt_type;
1767 long numval;
1768 char_u *stringval = NULL((void*)0);
1769 char_u *s;
1770
1771 c1 = *p;
1772 *p = NUL'\000';
1773
1774 n = get_tv_number(tv);
1775 s = get_tv_string_chk(tv); /* != NULL if number or string */
1776 if (s != NULL((void*)0) && op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
1777 opt_type = get_option_value(arg, &numval,
1778 &stringval, opt_flags);
1779 if ((opt_type == 1 && *op == '.')
1780 || (opt_type == 0 && *op != '.'))
1781 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (char_u *)(op
));
1782 else {
1783 if (opt_type == 1) { /* number */
1784 if (*op == '+')
1785 n = numval + n;
1786 else
1787 n = numval - n;
1788 } else if (opt_type == 0 && stringval != NULL((void*)0)) { /* string */
1789 s = concat_str(stringval, s);
1790 free(stringval);
1791 stringval = s;
1792 }
1793 }
1794 }
1795 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
1796 set_option_value(arg, n, s, opt_flags);
1797 arg_end = p;
1798 }
1799 *p = c1;
1800 free(stringval);
1801 }
1802 }
1803 /*
1804 * ":let @r = expr": Set register contents.
1805 */
1806 else if (*arg == '@') {
1807 ++arg;
1808 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && (*op == '+' || *op == '-'))
1809 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (char_u *)(op
));
1810 else if (endchars != NULL((void*)0)
1811 && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(arg + 1)) == NULL((void*)0))
1812 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1813 else {
1814 char_u *ptofree = NULL((void*)0);
1815 char_u *s;
1816
1817 p = get_tv_string_chk(tv);
1818 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && op != NULL((void*)0) && *op == '.') {
1819 s = get_reg_contents(*arg == '@' ? '"' : *arg, TRUE1, TRUE1);
1820 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
1821 p = ptofree = concat_str(s, p);
1822 free(s);
1823 }
1824 }
1825 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
1826 write_reg_contents(*arg == '@' ? '"' : *arg, p, -1, FALSE0);
1827 arg_end = arg + 1;
1828 }
1829 free(ptofree);
1830 }
1831 }
1832 /*
1833 * ":let var = expr": Set internal variable.
1834 * ":let {expr} = expr": Idem, name made with curly braces
1835 */
1836 else if (eval_isnamec1(*arg) || *arg == '{') {
1837 lval_T lv;
1838
1839 p = get_lval(arg, tv, &lv, FALSE0, FALSE0, 0, FNE_CHECK_START2);
1840 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && lv.ll_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
1841 if (endchars != NULL((void*)0) && vim_strchr(endchars, *skipwhite(p)) == NULL((void*)0))
1842 EMSG(_(e_letunexp))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letunexp))));
1843 else {
1844 set_var_lval(&lv, p, tv, copy, op);
1845 arg_end = p;
1846 }
1847 }
1848 clear_lval(&lv);
1849 } else
1850 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(arg
));
1851
1852 return arg_end;
1853}
1854
1855/*
1856 * If "arg" is equal to "b:changedtick" give an error and return TRUE.
1857 */
1858static int check_changedtick(char_u *arg)
1859{
1860 if (STRNCMP(arg, "b:changedtick", 13)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("b:changedtick"), (size_t)(13
)) == 0 && !eval_isnamec(arg[13])) {
1861 EMSG2(_(e_readonlyvar), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_readonlyvar))), (char_u *
)(arg));
1862 return TRUE1;
1863 }
1864 return FALSE0;
1865}
1866
1867/*
1868 * Get an lval: variable, Dict item or List item that can be assigned a value
1869 * to: "name", "na{me}", "name[expr]", "name[expr:expr]", "name[expr][expr]",
1870 * "name.key", "name.key[expr]" etc.
1871 * Indexing only works if "name" is an existing List or Dictionary.
1872 * "name" points to the start of the name.
1873 * If "rettv" is not NULL it points to the value to be assigned.
1874 * "unlet" is TRUE for ":unlet": slightly different behavior when something is
1875 * wrong; must end in space or cmd separator.
1876 *
1877 * flags:
1878 * GLV_QUIET: do not give error messages
1879 * GLV_NO_AUTOLOAD: do not use script autoloading
1880 *
1881 * Returns a pointer to just after the name, including indexes.
1882 * When an evaluation error occurs "lp->ll_name" is NULL;
1883 * Returns NULL for a parsing error. Still need to free items in "lp"!
1884 */
1885static char_u *
1886get_lval (
1887 char_u *name,
1888 typval_T *rettv,
1889 lval_T *lp,
1890 int unlet,
1891 int skip,
1892 int flags, /* GLV_ values */
1893 int fne_flags /* flags for find_name_end() */
1894)
1895{
1896 char_u *p;
1897 char_u *expr_start, *expr_end;
1898 int cc;
1899 dictitem_T *v;
1900 typval_T var1;
1901 typval_T var2;
1902 int empty1 = FALSE0;
1903 listitem_T *ni;
1904 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
1905 int len;
1906 hashtab_T *ht;
1907 int quiet = flags & GLV_QUIET2;
1908
1909 /* Clear everything in "lp". */
1910 memset(lp, 0, sizeof(lval_T));
1911
1912 if (skip) {
1913 /* When skipping just find the end of the name. */
1914 lp->ll_name = name;
1915 return find_name_end(name, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FNE_INCL_BR1 | fne_flags);
1916 }
1917
1918 /* Find the end of the name. */
1919 p = find_name_end(name, &expr_start, &expr_end, fne_flags);
1920 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
1921 /* Don't expand the name when we already know there is an error. */
1922 if (unlet && !vim_iswhite(*p)((*p) == ' ' || (*p) == '\t') && !ends_excmd(*p)
1923 && *p != '[' && *p != '.') {
1924 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
1925 return NULL((void*)0);
1926 }
1927
1928 lp->ll_exp_name = make_expanded_name(name, expr_start, expr_end, p);
1929 if (lp->ll_exp_name == NULL((void*)0)) {
1930 /* Report an invalid expression in braces, unless the
1931 * expression evaluation has been cancelled due to an
1932 * aborting error, an interrupt, or an exception. */
1933 if (!aborting() && !quiet) {
1934 emsg_severe = TRUE1;
1935 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(name
));
1936 return NULL((void*)0);
1937 }
1938 }
1939 lp->ll_name = lp->ll_exp_name;
1940 } else
1941 lp->ll_name = name;
1942
1943 /* Without [idx] or .key we are done. */
1944 if ((*p != '[' && *p != '.') || lp->ll_name == NULL((void*)0))
1945 return p;
1946
1947 cc = *p;
1948 *p = NUL'\000';
1949 v = find_var(lp->ll_name, &ht, flags & GLV_NO_AUTOLOAD4);
1950 if (v == NULL((void*)0) && !quiet)
1951 EMSG2(_(e_undefvar), lp->ll_name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_undefvar))), (char_u *)(lp
->ll_name));
1952 *p = cc;
1953 if (v == NULL((void*)0))
1954 return NULL((void*)0);
1955
1956 /*
1957 * Loop until no more [idx] or .key is following.
1958 */
1959 lp->ll_tv = &v->di_tv;
1960 while (*p == '[' || (*p == '.' && lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5)) {
1961 if (!(lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_LIST4 && lp->ll_tv->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0))
1962 && !(lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5
1963 && lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict != NULL((void*)0))) {
1964 if (!quiet)
1965 EMSG(_("E689: Can only index a List or Dictionary"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E689: Can only index a List or Dictionary"
))));
1966 return NULL((void*)0);
1967 }
1968 if (lp->ll_range) {
1969 if (!quiet)
1970 EMSG(_("E708: [:] must come last"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E708: [:] must come last"))
));
1971 return NULL((void*)0);
1972 }
1973
1974 len = -1;
1975 if (*p == '.') {
1976 key = p + 1;
1977 for (len = 0; ASCII_ISALNUM(key[len])((((unsigned)(key[len]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(key[len
]) - 'a' < 26)) || ((unsigned)(key[len]) - '0' < 10)) || key[len] == '_'; ++len)
1978 ;
1979 if (len == 0) {
1980 if (!quiet)
1981 EMSG(_(e_emptykey))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_emptykey))));
1982 return NULL((void*)0);
1983 }
1984 p = key + len;
1985 } else {
1986 /* Get the index [expr] or the first index [expr: ]. */
1987 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
1988 if (*p == ':')
1989 empty1 = TRUE1;
1990 else {
1991 empty1 = FALSE0;
1992 if (eval1(&p, &var1, TRUE1) == FAIL0) /* recursive! */
1993 return NULL((void*)0);
1994 if (get_tv_string_chk(&var1) == NULL((void*)0)) {
1995 /* not a number or string */
1996 clear_tv(&var1);
1997 return NULL((void*)0);
1998 }
1999 }
2000
2001 /* Optionally get the second index [ :expr]. */
2002 if (*p == ':') {
2003 if (lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5) {
2004 if (!quiet)
2005 EMSG(_(e_dictrange))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictrange))));
2006 if (!empty1)
2007 clear_tv(&var1);
2008 return NULL((void*)0);
2009 }
2010 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0) && (rettv->v_type != VAR_LIST4
2011 || rettv->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))) {
2012 if (!quiet)
2013 EMSG(_("E709: [:] requires a List value"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E709: [:] requires a List value"
))));
2014 if (!empty1)
2015 clear_tv(&var1);
2016 return NULL((void*)0);
2017 }
2018 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
2019 if (*p == ']')
2020 lp->ll_empty2 = TRUE1;
2021 else {
2022 lp->ll_empty2 = FALSE0;
2023 if (eval1(&p, &var2, TRUE1) == FAIL0) { /* recursive! */
2024 if (!empty1)
2025 clear_tv(&var1);
2026 return NULL((void*)0);
2027 }
2028 if (get_tv_string_chk(&var2) == NULL((void*)0)) {
2029 /* not a number or string */
2030 if (!empty1)
2031 clear_tv(&var1);
2032 clear_tv(&var2);
2033 return NULL((void*)0);
2034 }
2035 }
2036 lp->ll_range = TRUE1;
2037 } else
2038 lp->ll_range = FALSE0;
2039
2040 if (*p != ']') {
2041 if (!quiet)
2042 EMSG(_(e_missbrac))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_missbrac))));
2043 if (!empty1)
2044 clear_tv(&var1);
2045 if (lp->ll_range && !lp->ll_empty2)
2046 clear_tv(&var2);
2047 return NULL((void*)0);
2048 }
2049
2050 /* Skip to past ']'. */
2051 ++p;
2052 }
2053
2054 if (lp->ll_tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5) {
2055 if (len == -1) {
2056 /* "[key]": get key from "var1" */
2057 key = get_tv_string(&var1); /* is number or string */
2058 if (*key == NUL'\000') {
2059 if (!quiet)
2060 EMSG(_(e_emptykey))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_emptykey))));
2061 clear_tv(&var1);
2062 return NULL((void*)0);
2063 }
2064 }
2065 lp->ll_list = NULL((void*)0);
2066 lp->ll_dict = lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict;
2067 lp->ll_di = dict_find(lp->ll_dict, key, len);
2068
2069 /* When assigning to a scope dictionary check that a function and
2070 * variable name is valid (only variable name unless it is l: or
2071 * g: dictionary). Disallow overwriting a builtin function. */
2072 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0) && lp->ll_dict->dv_scope != 0) {
2073 int prevval;
2074 int wrong;
2075
2076 if (len != -1) {
2077 prevval = key[len];
2078 key[len] = NUL'\000';
2079 } else
2080 prevval = 0; /* avoid compiler warning */
2081 wrong = (lp->ll_dict->dv_scope == VAR_DEF_SCOPE2
2082 && rettv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3
2083 && var_check_func_name(key, lp->ll_di == NULL((void*)0)))
2084 || !valid_varname(key);
2085 if (len != -1)
2086 key[len] = prevval;
2087 if (wrong)
2088 return NULL((void*)0);
2089 }
2090
2091 if (lp->ll_di == NULL((void*)0)) {
2092 /* Can't add "v:" variable. */
2093 if (lp->ll_dict == &vimvardict) {
2094 EMSG2(_(e_illvar), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_illvar))), (char_u *)(name
));
2095 return NULL((void*)0);
2096 }
2097
2098 /* Key does not exist in dict: may need to add it. */
2099 if (*p == '[' || *p == '.' || unlet) {
2100 if (!quiet)
2101 EMSG2(_(e_dictkey), key)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictkey))), (char_u *)(key
));
2102 if (len == -1)
2103 clear_tv(&var1);
2104 return NULL((void*)0);
2105 }
2106 if (len == -1)
2107 lp->ll_newkey = vim_strsave(key);
2108 else
2109 lp->ll_newkey = vim_strnsave(key, len);
2110 if (len == -1)
2111 clear_tv(&var1);
2112 break;
2113 }
2114 /* existing variable, need to check if it can be changed */
2115 else if (var_check_ro(lp->ll_di->di_flags, name))
2116 return NULL((void*)0);
2117
2118 if (len == -1)
2119 clear_tv(&var1);
2120 lp->ll_tv = &lp->ll_di->di_tv;
2121 } else {
2122 /*
2123 * Get the number and item for the only or first index of the List.
2124 */
2125 if (empty1)
2126 lp->ll_n1 = 0;
2127 else {
2128 lp->ll_n1 = get_tv_number(&var1); /* is number or string */
2129 clear_tv(&var1);
2130 }
2131 lp->ll_dict = NULL((void*)0);
2132 lp->ll_list = lp->ll_tv->vval.v_list;
2133 lp->ll_li = list_find(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_n1);
2134 if (lp->ll_li == NULL((void*)0)) {
2135 if (lp->ll_n1 < 0) {
2136 lp->ll_n1 = 0;
2137 lp->ll_li = list_find(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_n1);
2138 }
2139 }
2140 if (lp->ll_li == NULL((void*)0)) {
2141 if (lp->ll_range && !lp->ll_empty2)
2142 clear_tv(&var2);
2143 if (!quiet)
2144 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), lp->ll_n1)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(lp->
ll_n1));
2145 return NULL((void*)0);
2146 }
2147
2148 /*
2149 * May need to find the item or absolute index for the second
2150 * index of a range.
2151 * When no index given: "lp->ll_empty2" is TRUE.
2152 * Otherwise "lp->ll_n2" is set to the second index.
2153 */
2154 if (lp->ll_range && !lp->ll_empty2) {
2155 lp->ll_n2 = get_tv_number(&var2); /* is number or string */
2156 clear_tv(&var2);
2157 if (lp->ll_n2 < 0) {
2158 ni = list_find(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_n2);
2159 if (ni == NULL((void*)0)) {
2160 if (!quiet)
2161 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), lp->ll_n2)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(lp->
ll_n2));
2162 return NULL((void*)0);
2163 }
2164 lp->ll_n2 = list_idx_of_item(lp->ll_list, ni);
2165 }
2166
2167 /* Check that lp->ll_n2 isn't before lp->ll_n1. */
2168 if (lp->ll_n1 < 0)
2169 lp->ll_n1 = list_idx_of_item(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li);
2170 if (lp->ll_n2 < lp->ll_n1) {
2171 if (!quiet)
2172 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), lp->ll_n2)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(lp->
ll_n2));
2173 return NULL((void*)0);
2174 }
2175 }
2176
2177 lp->ll_tv = &lp->ll_li->li_tv;
2178 }
2179 }
2180
2181 return p;
2182}
2183
2184/*
2185 * Clear lval "lp" that was filled by get_lval().
2186 */
2187static void clear_lval(lval_T *lp)
2188{
2189 free(lp->ll_exp_name);
2190 free(lp->ll_newkey);
2191}
2192
2193/*
2194 * Set a variable that was parsed by get_lval() to "rettv".
2195 * "endp" points to just after the parsed name.
2196 * "op" is NULL, "+" for "+=", "-" for "-=", "." for ".=" or "=" for "=".
2197 */
2198static void set_var_lval(lval_T *lp, char_u *endp, typval_T *rettv, int copy, char_u *op)
2199{
2200 int cc;
2201 listitem_T *ri;
2202 dictitem_T *di;
2203
2204 if (lp->ll_tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
2205 if (!check_changedtick(lp->ll_name)) {
2206 cc = *endp;
2207 *endp = NUL'\000';
2208 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
2209 typval_T tv;
2210
2211 /* handle +=, -= and .= */
2212 if (get_var_tv(lp->ll_name, (int)STRLEN(lp->ll_name)strlen((char *)(lp->ll_name)),
2213 &tv, TRUE1, FALSE0) == OK1) {
2214 if (tv_op(&tv, rettv, op) == OK1)
2215 set_var(lp->ll_name, &tv, FALSE0);
2216 clear_tv(&tv);
2217 }
2218 } else
2219 set_var(lp->ll_name, rettv, copy);
2220 *endp = cc;
2221 }
2222 } else if (tv_check_lock(lp->ll_newkey == NULL((void*)0)
2223 ? lp->ll_tv->v_lock
2224 : lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict->dv_lock, lp->ll_name))
2225 ;
2226 else if (lp->ll_range) {
2227 /*
2228 * Assign the List values to the list items.
2229 */
2230 for (ri = rettv->vval.v_list->lv_first; ri != NULL((void*)0); ) {
2231 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=')
2232 tv_op(&lp->ll_li->li_tv, &ri->li_tv, op);
2233 else {
2234 clear_tv(&lp->ll_li->li_tv);
2235 copy_tv(&ri->li_tv, &lp->ll_li->li_tv);
2236 }
2237 ri = ri->li_next;
2238 if (ri == NULL((void*)0) || (!lp->ll_empty2 && lp->ll_n2 == lp->ll_n1))
2239 break;
2240 if (lp->ll_li->li_next == NULL((void*)0)) {
2241 /* Need to add an empty item. */
2242 list_append_number(lp->ll_list, 0);
2243 }
2244 lp->ll_li = lp->ll_li->li_next;
2245 ++lp->ll_n1;
2246 }
2247 if (ri != NULL((void*)0))
2248 EMSG(_("E710: List value has more items than target"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E710: List value has more items than target"
))));
2249 else if (lp->ll_empty2
2250 ? (lp->ll_li != NULL((void*)0) && lp->ll_li->li_next != NULL((void*)0))
2251 : lp->ll_n1 != lp->ll_n2)
2252 EMSG(_("E711: List value has not enough items"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E711: List value has not enough items"
))));
2253 } else {
2254 /*
2255 * Assign to a List or Dictionary item.
2256 */
2257 if (lp->ll_newkey != NULL((void*)0)) {
2258 if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
2259 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (char_u *)(op
));
2260 return;
2261 }
2262
2263 /* Need to add an item to the Dictionary. */
2264 di = dictitem_alloc(lp->ll_newkey);
2265 if (dict_add(lp->ll_tv->vval.v_dict, di) == FAIL0) {
2266 free(di);
2267 return;
2268 }
2269 lp->ll_tv = &di->di_tv;
2270 } else if (op != NULL((void*)0) && *op != '=') {
2271 tv_op(lp->ll_tv, rettv, op);
2272 return;
2273 } else
2274 clear_tv(lp->ll_tv);
2275
2276 /*
2277 * Assign the value to the variable or list item.
2278 */
2279 if (copy)
2280 copy_tv(rettv, lp->ll_tv);
2281 else {
2282 *lp->ll_tv = *rettv;
2283 lp->ll_tv->v_lock = 0;
2284 init_tv(rettv);
2285 }
2286 }
2287}
2288
2289/*
2290 * Handle "tv1 += tv2", "tv1 -= tv2" and "tv1 .= tv2"
2291 * Returns OK or FAIL.
2292 */
2293static int tv_op(typval_T *tv1, typval_T *tv2, char_u *op)
2294{
2295 long n;
2296 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
2297 char_u *s;
2298
2299 /* Can't do anything with a Funcref or a Dict on the right. */
2300 if (tv2->v_type != VAR_FUNC3 && tv2->v_type != VAR_DICT5) {
2301 switch (tv1->v_type) {
2302 case VAR_DICT5:
2303 case VAR_FUNC3:
2304 break;
2305
2306 case VAR_LIST4:
2307 if (*op != '+' || tv2->v_type != VAR_LIST4)
2308 break;
2309 /* List += List */
2310 if (tv1->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0) && tv2->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0))
2311 list_extend(tv1->vval.v_list, tv2->vval.v_list, NULL((void*)0));
2312 return OK1;
2313
2314 case VAR_NUMBER1:
2315 case VAR_STRING2:
2316 if (tv2->v_type == VAR_LIST4)
2317 break;
2318 if (*op == '+' || *op == '-') {
2319 /* nr += nr or nr -= nr*/
2320 n = get_tv_number(tv1);
2321 if (tv2->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
2322 float_T f = n;
2323
2324 if (*op == '+')
2325 f += tv2->vval.v_float;
2326 else
2327 f -= tv2->vval.v_float;
2328 clear_tv(tv1);
2329 tv1->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
2330 tv1->vval.v_float = f;
2331 } else {
2332 if (*op == '+')
2333 n += get_tv_number(tv2);
2334 else
2335 n -= get_tv_number(tv2);
2336 clear_tv(tv1);
2337 tv1->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
2338 tv1->vval.v_number = n;
2339 }
2340 } else {
2341 if (tv2->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
2342 break;
2343
2344 /* str .= str */
2345 s = get_tv_string(tv1);
2346 s = concat_str(s, get_tv_string_buf(tv2, numbuf));
2347 clear_tv(tv1);
2348 tv1->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
2349 tv1->vval.v_string = s;
2350 }
2351 return OK1;
2352
2353 case VAR_FLOAT6:
2354 {
2355 float_T f;
2356
2357 if (*op == '.' || (tv2->v_type != VAR_FLOAT6
2358 && tv2->v_type != VAR_NUMBER1
2359 && tv2->v_type != VAR_STRING2))
2360 break;
2361 if (tv2->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
2362 f = tv2->vval.v_float;
2363 else
2364 f = get_tv_number(tv2);
2365 if (*op == '+')
2366 tv1->vval.v_float += f;
2367 else
2368 tv1->vval.v_float -= f;
2369 }
2370 return OK1;
2371 }
2372 }
2373
2374 EMSG2(_(e_letwrong), op)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_letwrong))), (char_u *)(op
));
2375 return FAIL0;
2376}
2377
2378/*
2379 * Add a watcher to a list.
2380 */
2381void list_add_watch(list_T *l, listwatch_T *lw)
2382{
2383 lw->lw_next = l->lv_watch;
2384 l->lv_watch = lw;
2385}
2386
2387/*
2388 * Remove a watcher from a list.
2389 * No warning when it isn't found...
2390 */
2391void list_rem_watch(list_T *l, listwatch_T *lwrem)
2392{
2393 listwatch_T *lw, **lwp;
2394
2395 lwp = &l->lv_watch;
2396 for (lw = l->lv_watch; lw != NULL((void*)0); lw = lw->lw_next) {
2397 if (lw == lwrem) {
2398 *lwp = lw->lw_next;
2399 break;
2400 }
2401 lwp = &lw->lw_next;
2402 }
2403}
2404
2405/*
2406 * Just before removing an item from a list: advance watchers to the next
2407 * item.
2408 */
2409static void list_fix_watch(list_T *l, listitem_T *item)
2410{
2411 listwatch_T *lw;
2412
2413 for (lw = l->lv_watch; lw != NULL((void*)0); lw = lw->lw_next)
2414 if (lw->lw_item == item)
2415 lw->lw_item = item->li_next;
2416}
2417
2418/*
2419 * Evaluate the expression used in a ":for var in expr" command.
2420 * "arg" points to "var".
2421 * Set "*errp" to TRUE for an error, FALSE otherwise;
2422 * Return a pointer that holds the info. Null when there is an error.
2423 */
2424void *eval_for_line(char_u *arg, int *errp, char_u **nextcmdp, int skip)
2425{
2426 forinfo_T *fi = xcalloc(1, sizeof(forinfo_T));
2427 char_u *expr;
2428 typval_T tv;
2429 list_T *l;
2430
2431 *errp = TRUE1; /* default: there is an error */
2432
2433 expr = skip_var_list(arg, &fi->fi_varcount, &fi->fi_semicolon);
2434 if (expr == NULL((void*)0))
2435 return fi;
2436
2437 expr = skipwhite(expr);
2438 if (expr[0] != 'i' || expr[1] != 'n' || !vim_iswhite(expr[2])((expr[2]) == ' ' || (expr[2]) == '\t')) {
2439 EMSG(_("E690: Missing \"in\" after :for"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E690: Missing \"in\" after :for"
))));
2440 return fi;
2441 }
2442
2443 if (skip)
2444 ++emsg_skip;
2445 if (eval0(skipwhite(expr + 2), &tv, nextcmdp, !skip) == OK1) {
2446 *errp = FALSE0;
2447 if (!skip) {
2448 l = tv.vval.v_list;
2449 if (tv.v_type != VAR_LIST4 || l == NULL((void*)0)) {
2450 EMSG(_(e_listreq))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listreq))));
2451 clear_tv(&tv);
2452 } else {
2453 /* No need to increment the refcount, it's already set for the
2454 * list being used in "tv". */
2455 fi->fi_list = l;
2456 list_add_watch(l, &fi->fi_lw);
2457 fi->fi_lw.lw_item = l->lv_first;
2458 }
2459 }
2460 }
2461 if (skip)
2462 --emsg_skip;
2463
2464 return fi;
2465}
2466
2467/*
2468 * Use the first item in a ":for" list. Advance to the next.
2469 * Assign the values to the variable (list). "arg" points to the first one.
2470 * Return TRUE when a valid item was found, FALSE when at end of list or
2471 * something wrong.
2472 */
2473int next_for_item(void *fi_void, char_u *arg)
2474{
2475 forinfo_T *fi = (forinfo_T *)fi_void;
2476 int result;
2477 listitem_T *item;
2478
2479 item = fi->fi_lw.lw_item;
2480 if (item == NULL((void*)0))
2481 result = FALSE0;
2482 else {
2483 fi->fi_lw.lw_item = item->li_next;
2484 result = (ex_let_vars(arg, &item->li_tv, TRUE1,
2485 fi->fi_semicolon, fi->fi_varcount, NULL((void*)0)) == OK1);
2486 }
2487 return result;
2488}
2489
2490/*
2491 * Free the structure used to store info used by ":for".
2492 */
2493void free_for_info(void *fi_void)
2494{
2495 forinfo_T *fi = (forinfo_T *)fi_void;
2496
2497 if (fi != NULL((void*)0) && fi->fi_list != NULL((void*)0)) {
2498 list_rem_watch(fi->fi_list, &fi->fi_lw);
2499 list_unref(fi->fi_list);
2500 }
2501 free(fi);
2502}
2503
2504
2505void set_context_for_expression(expand_T *xp, char_u *arg, cmdidx_T cmdidx)
2506{
2507 int got_eq = FALSE0;
2508 int c;
2509 char_u *p;
2510
2511 if (cmdidx == CMD_let) {
2512 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_USER_VARS;
2513 if (vim_strpbrk(arg, (char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#")(char_u *)strpbrk((char *)(arg), (char *)((char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#"
)) == NULL((void*)0)) {
2514 /* ":let var1 var2 ...": find last space. */
2515 for (p = arg + STRLEN(arg)strlen((char *)(arg)); p >= arg; ) {
2516 xp->xp_pattern = p;
2517 mb_ptr_back(arg, p)p -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(arg, p - 1) + 1) : 1;
2518 if (vim_iswhite(*p)((*p) == ' ' || (*p) == '\t'))
2519 break;
2520 }
2521 return;
2522 }
2523 } else
2524 xp->xp_context = cmdidx == CMD_call ? EXPAND_FUNCTIONS
2525 : EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2526 while ((xp->xp_pattern = vim_strpbrk(arg,(char_u *)strpbrk((char *)(arg), (char *)((char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#"
))
2527 (char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#")(char_u *)strpbrk((char *)(arg), (char *)((char_u *)"\"'+-*/%.=!?~|&$([<>,#"
))) != NULL((void*)0)) {
2528 c = *xp->xp_pattern;
2529 if (c == '&') {
2530 c = xp->xp_pattern[1];
2531 if (c == '&') {
2532 ++xp->xp_pattern;
2533 xp->xp_context = cmdidx != CMD_let || got_eq
2534 ? EXPAND_EXPRESSION : EXPAND_NOTHING;
2535 } else if (c != ' ') {
2536 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_SETTINGS;
2537 if ((c == 'l' || c == 'g') && xp->xp_pattern[2] == ':')
2538 xp->xp_pattern += 2;
2539
2540 }
2541 } else if (c == '$') {
2542 /* environment variable */
2543 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_ENV_VARS;
2544 } else if (c == '=') {
2545 got_eq = TRUE1;
2546 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2547 } else if (c == '<'
2548 && xp->xp_context == EXPAND_FUNCTIONS
2549 && vim_strchr(xp->xp_pattern, '(') == NULL((void*)0)) {
2550 /* Function name can start with "<SNR>" */
2551 break;
2552 } else if (cmdidx != CMD_let || got_eq) {
2553 if (c == '"') { /* string */
2554 while ((c = *++xp->xp_pattern) != NUL'\000' && c != '"')
2555 if (c == '\\' && xp->xp_pattern[1] != NUL'\000')
2556 ++xp->xp_pattern;
2557 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
2558 } else if (c == '\'') { /* literal string */
2559 /* Trick: '' is like stopping and starting a literal string. */
2560 while ((c = *++xp->xp_pattern) != NUL'\000' && c != '\'')
2561 /* skip */;
2562 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_NOTHING;
2563 } else if (c == '|') {
2564 if (xp->xp_pattern[1] == '|') {
2565 ++xp->xp_pattern;
2566 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2567 } else
2568 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_COMMANDS;
2569 } else
2570 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2571 } else
2572 /* Doesn't look like something valid, expand as an expression
2573 * anyway. */
2574 xp->xp_context = EXPAND_EXPRESSION;
2575 arg = xp->xp_pattern;
2576 if (*arg != NUL'\000')
2577 while ((c = *++arg) != NUL'\000' && (c == ' ' || c == '\t'))
2578 /* skip */;
2579 }
2580 xp->xp_pattern = arg;
2581}
2582
2583
2584/*
2585 * ":1,25call func(arg1, arg2)" function call.
2586 */
2587void ex_call(exarg_T *eap)
2588{
2589 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
2590 char_u *startarg;
2591 char_u *name;
2592 char_u *tofree;
2593 int len;
2594 typval_T rettv;
2595 linenr_T lnum;
2596 int doesrange;
2597 int failed = FALSE0;
2598 funcdict_T fudi;
2599
2600 if (eap->skip) {
2601 /* trans_function_name() doesn't work well when skipping, use eval0()
2602 * instead to skip to any following command, e.g. for:
2603 * :if 0 | call dict.foo().bar() | endif */
2604 ++emsg_skip;
2605 if (eval0(eap->arg, &rettv, &eap->nextcmd, FALSE0) != FAIL0)
2606 clear_tv(&rettv);
2607 --emsg_skip;
2608 return;
2609 }
2610
2611 tofree = trans_function_name(&arg, eap->skip, TFN_INT1, &fudi);
2612 if (fudi.fd_newkey != NULL((void*)0)) {
2613 /* Still need to give an error message for missing key. */
2614 EMSG2(_(e_dictkey), fudi.fd_newkey)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictkey))), (char_u *)(fudi
.fd_newkey));
2615 free(fudi.fd_newkey);
2616 }
2617 if (tofree == NULL((void*)0))
2618 return;
2619
2620 /* Increase refcount on dictionary, it could get deleted when evaluating
2621 * the arguments. */
2622 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0))
2623 ++fudi.fd_dict->dv_refcount;
2624
2625 /* If it is the name of a variable of type VAR_FUNC use its contents. */
2626 len = (int)STRLEN(tofree)strlen((char *)(tofree));
2627 name = deref_func_name(tofree, &len, FALSE0);
2628
2629 /* Skip white space to allow ":call func ()". Not good, but required for
2630 * backward compatibility. */
2631 startarg = skipwhite(arg);
2632 rettv.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0; /* clear_tv() uses this */
2633
2634 if (*startarg != '(') {
2635 EMSG2(_("E107: Missing parentheses: %s"), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E107: Missing parentheses: %s"
))), (char_u *)(eap->arg));
2636 goto end;
2637 }
2638
2639 /*
2640 * When skipping, evaluate the function once, to find the end of the
2641 * arguments.
2642 * When the function takes a range, this is discovered after the first
2643 * call, and the loop is broken.
2644 */
2645 if (eap->skip) {
2646 ++emsg_skip;
2647 lnum = eap->line2; /* do it once, also with an invalid range */
2648 } else
2649 lnum = eap->line1;
2650 for (; lnum <= eap->line2; ++lnum) {
2651 if (!eap->skip && eap->addr_count > 0) {
2652 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum;
2653 curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
2654 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = 0;
2655 }
2656 arg = startarg;
2657 if (get_func_tv(name, (int)STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)), &rettv, &arg,
2658 eap->line1, eap->line2, &doesrange,
2659 !eap->skip, fudi.fd_dict) == FAIL0) {
2660 failed = TRUE1;
2661 break;
2662 }
2663
2664 /* Handle a function returning a Funcref, Dictionary or List. */
2665 if (handle_subscript(&arg, &rettv, !eap->skip, TRUE1) == FAIL0) {
2666 failed = TRUE1;
2667 break;
2668 }
2669
2670 clear_tv(&rettv);
2671 if (doesrange || eap->skip)
2672 break;
2673
2674 /* Stop when immediately aborting on error, or when an interrupt
2675 * occurred or an exception was thrown but not caught.
2676 * get_func_tv() returned OK, so that the check for trailing
2677 * characters below is executed. */
2678 if (aborting())
2679 break;
2680 }
2681 if (eap->skip)
