2682 --emsg_skip;
2683
2684 if (!failed) {
2685 /* Check for trailing illegal characters and a following command. */
2686 if (!ends_excmd(*arg)) {
2687 emsg_severe = TRUE1;
2688 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
2689 } else
2690 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
2691 }
2692
2693end:
2694 dict_unref(fudi.fd_dict);
2695 free(tofree);
2696}
2697
2698/*
2699 * ":unlet[!] var1 ... " command.
2700 */
2701void ex_unlet(exarg_T *eap)
2702{
2703 ex_unletlock(eap, eap->arg, 0);
2704}
2705
2706/*
2707 * ":lockvar" and ":unlockvar" commands
2708 */
2709void ex_lockvar(exarg_T *eap)
2710{
2711 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
2712 int deep = 2;
2713
2714 if (eap->forceit)
2715 deep = -1;
2716 else if (vim_isdigit(*arg)) {
2717 deep = getdigits(&arg);
2718 arg = skipwhite(arg);
2719 }
2720
2721 ex_unletlock(eap, arg, deep);
2722}
2723
2724/*
2725 * ":unlet", ":lockvar" and ":unlockvar" are quite similar.
2726 */
2727static void ex_unletlock(exarg_T *eap, char_u *argstart, int deep)
2728{
2729 char_u *arg = argstart;
2730 char_u *name_end;
2731 int error = FALSE0;
2732 lval_T lv;
2733
2734 do {
2735 /* Parse the name and find the end. */
2736 name_end = get_lval(arg, NULL((void*)0), &lv, TRUE1, eap->skip || error, 0,
2737 FNE_CHECK_START2);
2738 if (lv.ll_name == NULL((void*)0))
2739 error = TRUE1; /* error but continue parsing */
2740 if (name_end == NULL((void*)0) || (!vim_iswhite(*name_end)((*name_end) == ' ' || (*name_end) == '\t')
2741 && !ends_excmd(*name_end))) {
2742 if (name_end != NULL((void*)0)) {
2743 emsg_severe = TRUE1;
2744 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
2745 }
2746 if (!(eap->skip || error))
2747 clear_lval(&lv);
2748 break;
2749 }
2750
2751 if (!error && !eap->skip) {
2752 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_unlet) {
2753 if (do_unlet_var(&lv, name_end, eap->forceit) == FAIL0)
2754 error = TRUE1;
2755 } else {
2756 if (do_lock_var(&lv, name_end, deep,
2757 eap->cmdidx == CMD_lockvar) == FAIL0)
2758 error = TRUE1;
2759 }
2760 }
2761
2762 if (!eap->skip)
2763 clear_lval(&lv);
2764
2765 arg = skipwhite(name_end);
2766 } while (!ends_excmd(*arg));
2767
2768 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
2769}
2770
2771static int do_unlet_var(lval_T *lp, char_u *name_end, int forceit)
2772{
2773 int ret = OK1;
2774 int cc;
2775
2776 if (lp->ll_tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
2777 cc = *name_end;
2778 *name_end = NUL'\000';
2779
2780 /* Normal name or expanded name. */
2781 if (check_changedtick(lp->ll_name))
2782 ret = FAIL0;
2783 else if (do_unlet(lp->ll_name, forceit) == FAIL0)
2784 ret = FAIL0;
2785 *name_end = cc;
2786 } else if (tv_check_lock(lp->ll_tv->v_lock, lp->ll_name))
2787 return FAIL0;
2788 else if (lp->ll_range) {
2789 listitem_T *li;
2790
2791 /* Delete a range of List items. */
2792 while (lp->ll_li != NULL((void*)0) && (lp->ll_empty2 || lp->ll_n2 >= lp->ll_n1)) {
2793 li = lp->ll_li->li_next;
2794 listitem_remove(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li);
2795 lp->ll_li = li;
2796 ++lp->ll_n1;
2797 }
2798 } else {
2799 if (lp->ll_list != NULL((void*)0))
2800 /* unlet a List item. */
2801 listitem_remove(lp->ll_list, lp->ll_li);
2802 else
2803 /* unlet a Dictionary item. */
2804 dictitem_remove(lp->ll_dict, lp->ll_di);
2805 }
2806
2807 return ret;
2808}
2809
2810/*
2811 * "unlet" a variable. Return OK if it existed, FAIL if not.
2812 * When "forceit" is TRUE don't complain if the variable doesn't exist.
2813 */
2814int do_unlet(char_u *name, int forceit)
2815{
2816 hashtab_T *ht;
2817 hashitem_T *hi;
2818 char_u *varname;
2819 dictitem_T *di;
2820
2821 ht = find_var_ht(name, &varname);
2822 if (ht != NULL((void*)0) && *varname != NUL'\000') {
2823 hi = hash_find(ht, varname);
2824 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
2825 di = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
2826 if (var_check_fixed(di->di_flags, name)
2827 || var_check_ro(di->di_flags, name))
2828 return FAIL0;
2829 delete_var(ht, hi);
2830 return OK1;
2831 }
2832 }
2833 if (forceit)
2834 return OK1;
2835 EMSG2(_("E108: No such variable: \"%s\""), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E108: No such variable: \"%s\""
))), (char_u *)(name));
2836 return FAIL0;
2837}
2838
2839/*
2840 * Lock or unlock variable indicated by "lp".
2841 * "deep" is the levels to go (-1 for unlimited);
2842 * "lock" is TRUE for ":lockvar", FALSE for ":unlockvar".
2843 */
2844static int do_lock_var(lval_T *lp, char_u *name_end, int deep, int lock)
2845{
2846 int ret = OK1;
2847 int cc;
2848 dictitem_T *di;
2849
2850 if (deep == 0) /* nothing to do */
2851 return OK1;
2852
2853 if (lp->ll_tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
2854 cc = *name_end;
2855 *name_end = NUL'\000';
2856
2857 /* Normal name or expanded name. */
2858 if (check_changedtick(lp->ll_name))
2859 ret = FAIL0;
2860 else {
2861 di = find_var(lp->ll_name, NULL((void*)0), TRUE1);
2862 if (di == NULL((void*)0))
2863 ret = FAIL0;
2864 else {
2865 if (lock)
2866 di->di_flags |= DI_FLAGS_LOCK8;
2867 else
2868 di->di_flags &= ~DI_FLAGS_LOCK8;
2869 item_lock(&di->di_tv, deep, lock);
2870 }
2871 }
2872 *name_end = cc;
2873 } else if (lp->ll_range) {
2874 listitem_T *li = lp->ll_li;
2875
2876 /* (un)lock a range of List items. */
2877 while (li != NULL((void*)0) && (lp->ll_empty2 || lp->ll_n2 >= lp->ll_n1)) {
2878 item_lock(&li->li_tv, deep, lock);
2879 li = li->li_next;
2880 ++lp->ll_n1;
2881 }
2882 } else if (lp->ll_list != NULL((void*)0))
2883 /* (un)lock a List item. */
2884 item_lock(&lp->ll_li->li_tv, deep, lock);
2885 else
2886 /* un(lock) a Dictionary item. */
2887 item_lock(&lp->ll_di->di_tv, deep, lock);
2888
2889 return ret;
2890}
2891
2892/*
2893 * Lock or unlock an item. "deep" is nr of levels to go.
2894 */
2895static void item_lock(typval_T *tv, int deep, int lock)
2896{
2897 static int recurse = 0;
2898 list_T *l;
2899 listitem_T *li;
2900 dict_T *d;
2901 hashitem_T *hi;
2902 int todo;
2903
2904 if (recurse >= DICT_MAXNEST100) {
2905 EMSG(_("E743: variable nested too deep for (un)lock"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E743: variable nested too deep for (un)lock"
))));
2906 return;
2907 }
2908 if (deep == 0)
2909 return;
2910 ++recurse;
2911
2912 /* lock/unlock the item itself */
2913 if (lock)
2914 tv->v_lock |= VAR_LOCKED1;
2915 else
2916 tv->v_lock &= ~VAR_LOCKED1;
2917
2918 switch (tv->v_type) {
2919 case VAR_LIST4:
2920 if ((l = tv->vval.v_list) != NULL((void*)0)) {
2921 if (lock)
2922 l->lv_lock |= VAR_LOCKED1;
2923 else
2924 l->lv_lock &= ~VAR_LOCKED1;
2925 if (deep < 0 || deep > 1)
2926 /* recursive: lock/unlock the items the List contains */
2927 for (li = l->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next)
2928 item_lock(&li->li_tv, deep - 1, lock);
2929 }
2930 break;
2931 case VAR_DICT5:
2932 if ((d = tv->vval.v_dict) != NULL((void*)0)) {
2933 if (lock)
2934 d->dv_lock |= VAR_LOCKED1;
2935 else
2936 d->dv_lock &= ~VAR_LOCKED1;
2937 if (deep < 0 || deep > 1) {
2938 /* recursive: lock/unlock the items the List contains */
2939 todo = (int)d->dv_hashtab.ht_used;
2940 for (hi = d->dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
2941 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
2942 --todo;
2943 item_lock(&HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)))->di_tv, deep - 1, lock);
2944 }
2945 }
2946 }
2947 }
2948 }
2949 --recurse;
2950}
2951
2952/*
2953 * Return TRUE if typeval "tv" is locked: Either that value is locked itself
2954 * or it refers to a List or Dictionary that is locked.
2955 */
2956static int tv_islocked(typval_T *tv)
2957{
2958 return (tv->v_lock & VAR_LOCKED1)
2959 || (tv->v_type == VAR_LIST4
2960 && tv->vval.v_list != NULL((void*)0)
2961 && (tv->vval.v_list->lv_lock & VAR_LOCKED1))
2962 || (tv->v_type == VAR_DICT5
2963 && tv->vval.v_dict != NULL((void*)0)
2964 && (tv->vval.v_dict->dv_lock & VAR_LOCKED1));
2965}
2966
2967/*
2968 * Delete all "menutrans_" variables.
2969 */
2970void del_menutrans_vars(void)
2971{
2972 hashitem_T *hi;
2973 int todo;
2974
2975 hash_lock(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab);
2976 todo = (int)globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_used;
2977 for (hi = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
2978 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
2979 --todo;
2980 if (STRNCMP(HI2DI(hi)->di_key, "menutrans_", 10)strncmp((char *)(((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key
- (char_u *)&dumdi)))->di_key), (char *)("menutrans_"
), (size_t)(10)) == 0)
2981 delete_var(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab, hi);
2982 }
2983 }
2984 hash_unlock(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab);
2985}
2986
2987/*
2988 * Local string buffer for the next two functions to store a variable name
2989 * with its prefix. Allocated in cat_prefix_varname(), freed later in
2990 * get_user_var_name().
2991 */
2992
2993
2994static char_u *varnamebuf = NULL((void*)0);
2995static size_t varnamebuflen = 0;
2996
2997/*
2998 * Function to concatenate a prefix and a variable name.
2999 */
3000static char_u *cat_prefix_varname(int prefix, char_u *name)
3001{
3002 size_t len = STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)) + 3;
3003
3004 if (len > varnamebuflen) {
3005 free(varnamebuf);
3006 len += 10; /* some additional space */
3007 varnamebuf = xmalloc(len);
3008 varnamebuflen = len;
3009 }
3010 *varnamebuf = prefix;
3011 varnamebuf[1] = ':';
3012 STRCPY(varnamebuf + 2, name)strcpy((char *)(varnamebuf + 2), (char *)(name));
3013 return varnamebuf;
3014}
3015
3016/*
3017 * Function given to ExpandGeneric() to obtain the list of user defined
3018 * (global/buffer/window/built-in) variable names.
3019 */
3020char_u *get_user_var_name(expand_T *xp, int idx)
3021{
3022 static long_u gdone;
3023 static long_u bdone;
3024 static long_u wdone;
3025 static long_u tdone;
3026 static int vidx;
3027 static hashitem_T *hi;
3028 hashtab_T *ht;
3029
3030 if (idx == 0) {
3031 gdone = bdone = wdone = vidx = 0;
3032 tdone = 0;
3033 }
3034
3035 /* Global variables */
3036 if (gdone < globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_used) {
3037 if (gdone++ == 0)
3038 hi = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array;
3039 else
3040 ++hi;
3041 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
3042 ++hi;
3043 if (STRNCMP("g:", xp->xp_pattern, 2)strncmp((char *)("g:"), (char *)(xp->xp_pattern), (size_t)
(2)) == 0)
3044 return cat_prefix_varname('g', hi->hi_key);
3045 return hi->hi_key;
3046 }
3047
3048 /* b: variables */
3049 ht = &curbuf->b_vars->dv_hashtab;
3050 if (bdone < ht->ht_used) {
3051 if (bdone++ == 0)
3052 hi = ht->ht_array;
3053 else
3054 ++hi;
3055 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
3056 ++hi;
3057 return cat_prefix_varname('b', hi->hi_key);
3058 }
3059 if (bdone == ht->ht_used) {
3060 ++bdone;
3061 return (char_u *)"b:changedtick";
3062 }
3063
3064 /* w: variables */
3065 ht = &curwin->w_vars->dv_hashtab;
3066 if (wdone < ht->ht_used) {
3067 if (wdone++ == 0)
3068 hi = ht->ht_array;
3069 else
3070 ++hi;
3071 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
3072 ++hi;
3073 return cat_prefix_varname('w', hi->hi_key);
3074 }
3075
3076 /* t: variables */
3077 ht = &curtab->tp_vars->dv_hashtab;
3078 if (tdone < ht->ht_used) {
3079 if (tdone++ == 0)
3080 hi = ht->ht_array;
3081 else
3082 ++hi;
3083 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
3084 ++hi;
3085 return cat_prefix_varname('t', hi->hi_key);
3086 }
3087
3088 /* v: variables */
3089 if (vidx < VV_LEN)
3090 return cat_prefix_varname('v', (char_u *)vimvars[vidx++].vv_name);
3091
3092 free(varnamebuf);
3093 varnamebuf = NULL((void*)0);
3094 varnamebuflen = 0;
3095 return NULL((void*)0);
3096}
3097
3098
3099/*
3100 * types for expressions.
3101 */
3102typedef enum {
3103 TYPE_UNKNOWN = 0
3104 , TYPE_EQUAL /* == */
3105 , TYPE_NEQUAL /* != */
3106 , TYPE_GREATER /* > */
3107 , TYPE_GEQUAL /* >= */
3108 , TYPE_SMALLER /* < */
3109 , TYPE_SEQUAL /* <= */
3110 , TYPE_MATCH /* =~ */
3111 , TYPE_NOMATCH /* !~ */
3112} exptype_T;
3113
3114/*
3115 * The "evaluate" argument: When FALSE, the argument is only parsed but not
3116 * executed. The function may return OK, but the rettv will be of type
3117 * VAR_UNKNOWN. The function still returns FAIL for a syntax error.
3118 */
3119
3120/*
3121 * Handle zero level expression.
3122 * This calls eval1() and handles error message and nextcmd.
3123 * Put the result in "rettv" when returning OK and "evaluate" is TRUE.
3124 * Note: "rettv.v_lock" is not set.
3125 * Return OK or FAIL.
3126 */
3127static int eval0(char_u *arg, typval_T *rettv, char_u **nextcmd, int evaluate)
3128{
3129 int ret;
3130 char_u *p;
3131
3132 p = skipwhite(arg);
3133 ret = eval1(&p, rettv, evaluate);
3134 if (ret == FAIL0 || !ends_excmd(*p)) {
3135 if (ret != FAIL0)
3136 clear_tv(rettv);
3137 /*
3138 * Report the invalid expression unless the expression evaluation has
3139 * been cancelled due to an aborting error, an interrupt, or an
3140 * exception.
3141 */
3142 if (!aborting())
3143 EMSG2(_(e_invexpr2), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2))), (char_u *)(arg
));
3144 ret = FAIL0;
3145 }
3146 if (nextcmd != NULL((void*)0))
3147 *nextcmd = check_nextcmd(p);
3148
3149 return ret;
3150}
3151
3152/*
3153 * Handle top level expression:
3154 * expr2 ? expr1 : expr1
3155 *
3156 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3157 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3158 *
3159 * Note: "rettv.v_lock" is not set.
3160 *
3161 * Return OK or FAIL.
3162 */
3163static int eval1(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3164{
3165 int result;
3166 typval_T var2;
3167
3168 /*
3169 * Get the first variable.
3170 */
3171 if (eval2(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3172 return FAIL0;
3173
3174 if ((*arg)[0] == '?') {
3175 result = FALSE0;
3176 if (evaluate) {
3177 int error = FALSE0;
3178
3179 if (get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error) != 0)
3180 result = TRUE1;
3181 clear_tv(rettv);
3182 if (error)
3183 return FAIL0;
3184 }
3185
3186 /*
3187 * Get the second variable.
3188 */
3189 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3190 if (eval1(arg, rettv, evaluate && result) == FAIL0) /* recursive! */
3191 return FAIL0;
3192
3193 /*
3194 * Check for the ":".
3195 */
3196 if ((*arg)[0] != ':') {
3197 EMSG(_("E109: Missing ':' after '?'"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E109: Missing ':' after '?'"
))));
3198 if (evaluate && result)
3199 clear_tv(rettv);
3200 return FAIL0;
3201 }
3202
3203 /*
3204 * Get the third variable.
3205 */
3206 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3207 if (eval1(arg, &var2, evaluate && !result) == FAIL0) { /* recursive! */
3208 if (evaluate && result)
3209 clear_tv(rettv);
3210 return FAIL0;
3211 }
3212 if (evaluate && !result)
3213 *rettv = var2;
3214 }
3215
3216 return OK1;
3217}
3218
3219/*
3220 * Handle first level expression:
3221 * expr2 || expr2 || expr2 logical OR
3222 *
3223 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3224 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3225 *
3226 * Return OK or FAIL.
3227 */
3228static int eval2(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3229{
3230 typval_T var2;
3231 long result;
3232 int first;
3233 int error = FALSE0;
3234
3235 /*
3236 * Get the first variable.
3237 */
3238 if (eval3(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3239 return FAIL0;
3240
3241 /*
3242 * Repeat until there is no following "||".
3243 */
3244 first = TRUE1;
3245 result = FALSE0;
3246 while ((*arg)[0] == '|' && (*arg)[1] == '|') {
3247 if (evaluate && first) {
3248 if (get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error) != 0)
3249 result = TRUE1;
3250 clear_tv(rettv);
3251 if (error)
3252 return FAIL0;
3253 first = FALSE0;
3254 }
3255
3256 /*
3257 * Get the second variable.
3258 */
3259 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 2);
3260 if (eval3(arg, &var2, evaluate && !result) == FAIL0)
3261 return FAIL0;
3262
3263 /*
3264 * Compute the result.
3265 */
3266 if (evaluate && !result) {
3267 if (get_tv_number_chk(&var2, &error) != 0)
3268 result = TRUE1;
3269 clear_tv(&var2);
3270 if (error)
3271 return FAIL0;
3272 }
3273 if (evaluate) {
3274 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
3275 rettv->vval.v_number = result;
3276 }
3277 }
3278
3279 return OK1;
3280}
3281
3282/*
3283 * Handle second level expression:
3284 * expr3 && expr3 && expr3 logical AND
3285 *
3286 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3287 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3288 *
3289 * Return OK or FAIL.
3290 */
3291static int eval3(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3292{
3293 typval_T var2;
3294 long result;
3295 int first;
3296 int error = FALSE0;
3297
3298 /*
3299 * Get the first variable.
3300 */
3301 if (eval4(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3302 return FAIL0;
3303
3304 /*
3305 * Repeat until there is no following "&&".
3306 */
3307 first = TRUE1;
3308 result = TRUE1;
3309 while ((*arg)[0] == '&' && (*arg)[1] == '&') {
3310 if (evaluate && first) {
3311 if (get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error) == 0)
3312 result = FALSE0;
3313 clear_tv(rettv);
3314 if (error)
3315 return FAIL0;
3316 first = FALSE0;
3317 }
3318
3319 /*
3320 * Get the second variable.
3321 */
3322 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 2);
3323 if (eval4(arg, &var2, evaluate && result) == FAIL0)
3324 return FAIL0;
3325
3326 /*
3327 * Compute the result.
3328 */
3329 if (evaluate && result) {
3330 if (get_tv_number_chk(&var2, &error) == 0)
3331 result = FALSE0;
3332 clear_tv(&var2);
3333 if (error)
3334 return FAIL0;
3335 }
3336 if (evaluate) {
3337 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
3338 rettv->vval.v_number = result;
3339 }
3340 }
3341
3342 return OK1;
3343}
3344
3345/*
3346 * Handle third level expression:
3347 * var1 == var2
3348 * var1 =~ var2
3349 * var1 != var2
3350 * var1 !~ var2
3351 * var1 > var2
3352 * var1 >= var2
3353 * var1 < var2
3354 * var1 <= var2
3355 * var1 is var2
3356 * var1 isnot var2
3357 *
3358 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3359 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3360 *
3361 * Return OK or FAIL.
3362 */
3363static int eval4(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3364{
3365 typval_T var2;
3366 char_u *p;
3367 int i;
3368 exptype_T type = TYPE_UNKNOWN;
3369 int type_is = FALSE0; /* TRUE for "is" and "isnot" */
3370 int len = 2;
3371 long n1, n2;
3372 char_u *s1, *s2;
3373 char_u buf1[NUMBUFLEN30], buf2[NUMBUFLEN30];
3374 regmatch_T regmatch;
3375 int ic;
3376 char_u *save_cpo;
3377
3378 /*
3379 * Get the first variable.
3380 */
3381 if (eval5(arg, rettv, evaluate) == FAIL0)
3382 return FAIL0;
3383
3384 p = *arg;
3385 switch (p[0]) {
3386 case '=': if (p[1] == '=')
3387 type = TYPE_EQUAL;
3388 else if (p[1] == '~')
3389 type = TYPE_MATCH;
3390 break;
3391 case '!': if (p[1] == '=')
3392 type = TYPE_NEQUAL;
3393 else if (p[1] == '~')
3394 type = TYPE_NOMATCH;
3395 break;
3396 case '>': if (p[1] != '=') {
3397 type = TYPE_GREATER;
3398 len = 1;
3399 } else
3400 type = TYPE_GEQUAL;
3401 break;
3402 case '<': if (p[1] != '=') {
3403 type = TYPE_SMALLER;
3404 len = 1;
3405 } else
3406 type = TYPE_SEQUAL;
3407 break;
3408 case 'i': if (p[1] == 's') {
3409 if (p[2] == 'n' && p[3] == 'o' && p[4] == 't')
3410 len = 5;
3411 if (!vim_isIDc(p[len])) {
3412 type = len == 2 ? TYPE_EQUAL : TYPE_NEQUAL;
3413 type_is = TRUE1;
3414 }
3415 }
3416 break;
3417 }
3418
3419 /*
3420 * If there is a comparative operator, use it.
3421 */
3422 if (type != TYPE_UNKNOWN) {
3423 /* extra question mark appended: ignore case */
3424 if (p[len] == '?') {
3425 ic = TRUE1;
3426 ++len;
3427 }
3428 /* extra '#' appended: match case */
3429 else if (p[len] == '#') {
3430 ic = FALSE0;
3431 ++len;
3432 }
3433 /* nothing appended: use 'ignorecase' */
3434 else
3435 ic = p_ic;
3436
3437 /*
3438 * Get the second variable.
3439 */
3440 *arg = skipwhite(p + len);
3441 if (eval5(arg, &var2, evaluate) == FAIL0) {
3442 clear_tv(rettv);
3443 return FAIL0;
3444 }
3445
3446 if (evaluate) {
3447 if (type_is && rettv->v_type != var2.v_type) {
3448 /* For "is" a different type always means FALSE, for "notis"
3449 * it means TRUE. */
3450 n1 = (type == TYPE_NEQUAL);
3451 } else if (rettv->v_type == VAR_LIST4 || var2.v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
3452 if (type_is) {
3453 n1 = (rettv->v_type == var2.v_type
3454 && rettv->vval.v_list == var2.vval.v_list);
3455 if (type == TYPE_NEQUAL)
3456 n1 = !n1;
3457 } else if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type
3458 || (type != TYPE_EQUAL && type != TYPE_NEQUAL)) {
3459 if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type) {
3460 EMSG(_("E691: Can only compare List with List"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E691: Can only compare List with List"
))));
3461 } else {
3462 EMSG(_("E692: Invalid operation for List"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E692: Invalid operation for List"
))));
3463 }
3464 clear_tv(rettv);
3465 clear_tv(&var2);
3466 return FAIL0;
3467 } else {
3468 /* Compare two Lists for being equal or unequal. */
3469 n1 = list_equal(rettv->vval.v_list, var2.vval.v_list,
3470 ic, FALSE0);
3471 if (type == TYPE_NEQUAL)
3472 n1 = !n1;
3473 }
3474 } else if (rettv->v_type == VAR_DICT5 || var2.v_type == VAR_DICT5) {
3475 if (type_is) {
3476 n1 = (rettv->v_type == var2.v_type
3477 && rettv->vval.v_dict == var2.vval.v_dict);
3478 if (type == TYPE_NEQUAL)
3479 n1 = !n1;
3480 } else if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type
3481 || (type != TYPE_EQUAL && type != TYPE_NEQUAL)) {
3482 if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type)
3483 EMSG(_("E735: Can only compare Dictionary with Dictionary"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E735: Can only compare Dictionary with Dictionary"
))));
3484 else
3485 EMSG(_("E736: Invalid operation for Dictionary"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E736: Invalid operation for Dictionary"
))));
3486 clear_tv(rettv);
3487 clear_tv(&var2);
3488 return FAIL0;
3489 } else {
3490 /* Compare two Dictionaries for being equal or unequal. */
3491 n1 = dict_equal(rettv->vval.v_dict, var2.vval.v_dict,
3492 ic, FALSE0);
3493 if (type == TYPE_NEQUAL)
3494 n1 = !n1;
3495 }
3496 } else if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3 || var2.v_type == VAR_FUNC3) {
3497 if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type
3498 || (type != TYPE_EQUAL && type != TYPE_NEQUAL)) {
3499 if (rettv->v_type != var2.v_type)
3500 EMSG(_("E693: Can only compare Funcref with Funcref"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E693: Can only compare Funcref with Funcref"
))));
3501 else
3502 EMSG(_("E694: Invalid operation for Funcrefs"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E694: Invalid operation for Funcrefs"
))));
3503 clear_tv(rettv);
3504 clear_tv(&var2);
3505 return FAIL0;
3506 } else {
3507 /* Compare two Funcrefs for being equal or unequal. */
3508 if (rettv->vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0)
3509 || var2.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0))
3510 n1 = FALSE0;
3511 else
3512 n1 = STRCMP(rettv->vval.v_string,strcmp((char *)(rettv->vval.v_string), (char *)(var2.vval.
v_string))
3513 var2.vval.v_string)strcmp((char *)(rettv->vval.v_string), (char *)(var2.vval.
v_string)) == 0;
3514 if (type == TYPE_NEQUAL)
3515 n1 = !n1;
3516 }
3517 }
3518 /*
3519 * If one of the two variables is a float, compare as a float.
3520 * When using "=~" or "!~", always compare as string.
3521 */
3522 else if ((rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6 || var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
3523 && type != TYPE_MATCH && type != TYPE_NOMATCH) {
3524 float_T f1, f2;
3525
3526 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
3527 f1 = rettv->vval.v_float;
3528 else
3529 f1 = get_tv_number(rettv);
3530 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
3531 f2 = var2.vval.v_float;
3532 else
3533 f2 = get_tv_number(&var2);
3534 n1 = FALSE0;
3535 switch (type) {
3536 case TYPE_EQUAL: n1 = (f1 == f2); break;
3537 case TYPE_NEQUAL: n1 = (f1 != f2); break;
3538 case TYPE_GREATER: n1 = (f1 > f2); break;
3539 case TYPE_GEQUAL: n1 = (f1 >= f2); break;
3540 case TYPE_SMALLER: n1 = (f1 < f2); break;
3541 case TYPE_SEQUAL: n1 = (f1 <= f2); break;
3542 case TYPE_UNKNOWN:
3543 case TYPE_MATCH:
3544 case TYPE_NOMATCH: break; /* avoid gcc warning */
3545 }
3546 }
3547 /*
3548 * If one of the two variables is a number, compare as a number.
3549 * When using "=~" or "!~", always compare as string.
3550 */
3551 else if ((rettv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER1 || var2.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1)
3552 && type != TYPE_MATCH && type != TYPE_NOMATCH) {
3553 n1 = get_tv_number(rettv);
3554 n2 = get_tv_number(&var2);
3555 switch (type) {
3556 case TYPE_EQUAL: n1 = (n1 == n2); break;
3557 case TYPE_NEQUAL: n1 = (n1 != n2); break;
3558 case TYPE_GREATER: n1 = (n1 > n2); break;
3559 case TYPE_GEQUAL: n1 = (n1 >= n2); break;
3560 case TYPE_SMALLER: n1 = (n1 < n2); break;
3561 case TYPE_SEQUAL: n1 = (n1 <= n2); break;
3562 case TYPE_UNKNOWN:
3563 case TYPE_MATCH:
3564 case TYPE_NOMATCH: break; /* avoid gcc warning */
3565 }
3566 } else {
3567 s1 = get_tv_string_buf(rettv, buf1);
3568 s2 = get_tv_string_buf(&var2, buf2);
3569 if (type != TYPE_MATCH && type != TYPE_NOMATCH)
3570 i = ic ? MB_STRICMP(s1, s2)mb_strnicmp((char_u *)(s1), (char_u *)(s2), (int)(0x7fffffffL
)) : STRCMP(s1, s2)strcmp((char *)(s1), (char *)(s2));
3571 else
3572 i = 0;
3573 n1 = FALSE0;
3574 switch (type) {
3575 case TYPE_EQUAL: n1 = (i == 0); break;
3576 case TYPE_NEQUAL: n1 = (i != 0); break;
3577 case TYPE_GREATER: n1 = (i > 0); break;
3578 case TYPE_GEQUAL: n1 = (i >= 0); break;
3579 case TYPE_SMALLER: n1 = (i < 0); break;
3580 case TYPE_SEQUAL: n1 = (i <= 0); break;
3581
3582 case TYPE_MATCH:
3583 case TYPE_NOMATCH:
3584 /* avoid 'l' flag in 'cpoptions' */
3585 save_cpo = p_cpo;
3586 p_cpo = (char_u *)"";
3587 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(s2,
3588 RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2);
3589 regmatch.rm_ic = ic;
3590 if (regmatch.regprog != NULL((void*)0)) {
3591 n1 = vim_regexec_nl(&regmatch, s1, (colnr_T)0);
3592 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
3593 if (type == TYPE_NOMATCH)
3594 n1 = !n1;
3595 }
3596 p_cpo = save_cpo;
3597 break;
3598
3599 case TYPE_UNKNOWN: break; /* avoid gcc warning */
3600 }
3601 }
3602 clear_tv(rettv);
3603 clear_tv(&var2);
3604 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
3605 rettv->vval.v_number = n1;
3606 }
3607 }
3608
3609 return OK1;
3610}
3611
3612/*
3613 * Handle fourth level expression:
3614 * + number addition
3615 * - number subtraction
3616 * . string concatenation
3617 *
3618 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3619 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3620 *
3621 * Return OK or FAIL.
3622 */
3623static int eval5(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
3624{
3625 typval_T var2;
3626 typval_T var3;
3627 int op;
3628 long n1, n2;
3629 float_T f1 = 0, f2 = 0;
3630 char_u *s1, *s2;
3631 char_u buf1[NUMBUFLEN30], buf2[NUMBUFLEN30];
3632 char_u *p;
3633
3634 /*
3635 * Get the first variable.
3636 */
3637 if (eval6(arg, rettv, evaluate, FALSE0) == FAIL0)
3638 return FAIL0;
3639
3640 /*
3641 * Repeat computing, until no '+', '-' or '.' is following.
3642 */
3643 for (;; ) {
3644 op = **arg;
3645 if (op != '+' && op != '-' && op != '.')
3646 break;
3647
3648 if ((op != '+' || rettv->v_type != VAR_LIST4)
3649 && (op == '.' || rettv->v_type != VAR_FLOAT6)
3650 ) {
3651 /* For "list + ...", an illegal use of the first operand as
3652 * a number cannot be determined before evaluating the 2nd
3653 * operand: if this is also a list, all is ok.
3654 * For "something . ...", "something - ..." or "non-list + ...",
3655 * we know that the first operand needs to be a string or number
3656 * without evaluating the 2nd operand. So check before to avoid
3657 * side effects after an error. */
3658 if (evaluate && get_tv_string_chk(rettv) == NULL((void*)0)) {
3659 clear_tv(rettv);
3660 return FAIL0;
3661 }
3662 }
3663
3664 /*
3665 * Get the second variable.
3666 */
3667 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3668 if (eval6(arg, &var2, evaluate, op == '.') == FAIL0) {
3669 clear_tv(rettv);
3670 return FAIL0;
3671 }
3672
3673 if (evaluate) {
3674 /*
3675 * Compute the result.
3676 */
3677 if (op == '.') {
3678 s1 = get_tv_string_buf(rettv, buf1); /* already checked */
3679 s2 = get_tv_string_buf_chk(&var2, buf2);
3680 if (s2 == NULL((void*)0)) { /* type error ? */
3681 clear_tv(rettv);
3682 clear_tv(&var2);
3683 return FAIL0;
3684 }
3685 p = concat_str(s1, s2);
3686 clear_tv(rettv);
3687 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
3688 rettv->vval.v_string = p;
3689 } else if (op == '+' && rettv->v_type == VAR_LIST4
3690 && var2.v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
3691 /* concatenate Lists */
3692 if (list_concat(rettv->vval.v_list, var2.vval.v_list,
3693 &var3) == FAIL0) {
3694 clear_tv(rettv);
3695 clear_tv(&var2);
3696 return FAIL0;
3697 }
3698 clear_tv(rettv);
3699 *rettv = var3;
3700 } else {
3701 int error = FALSE0;
3702
3703 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
3704 f1 = rettv->vval.v_float;
3705 n1 = 0;
3706 } else {
3707 n1 = get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error);
3708 if (error) {
3709 /* This can only happen for "list + non-list". For
3710 * "non-list + ..." or "something - ...", we returned
3711 * before evaluating the 2nd operand. */
3712 clear_tv(rettv);
3713 return FAIL0;
3714 }
3715 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
3716 f1 = n1;
3717 }
3718 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
3719 f2 = var2.vval.v_float;
3720 n2 = 0;
3721 } else {
3722 n2 = get_tv_number_chk(&var2, &error);
3723 if (error) {
3724 clear_tv(rettv);
3725 clear_tv(&var2);
3726 return FAIL0;
3727 }
3728 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
3729 f2 = n2;
3730 }
3731 clear_tv(rettv);
3732
3733 /* If there is a float on either side the result is a float. */
3734 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6 || var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
3735 if (op == '+')
3736 f1 = f1 + f2;
3737 else
3738 f1 = f1 - f2;
3739 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
3740 rettv->vval.v_float = f1;
3741 } else {
3742 if (op == '+')
3743 n1 = n1 + n2;
3744 else
3745 n1 = n1 - n2;
3746 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
3747 rettv->vval.v_number = n1;
3748 }
3749 }
3750 clear_tv(&var2);
3751 }
3752 }
3753 return OK1;
3754}
3755
3756/*
3757 * Handle fifth level expression:
3758 * * number multiplication
3759 * / number division
3760 * % number modulo
3761 *
3762 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3763 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3764 *
3765 * Return OK or FAIL.
3766 */
3767static int
3768eval6 (
3769 char_u **arg,
3770 typval_T *rettv,
3771 int evaluate,
3772 int want_string /* after "." operator */
3773)
3774{
3775 typval_T var2;
3776 int op;
3777 long n1, n2;
3778 int use_float = FALSE0;
3779 float_T f1 = 0, f2;
3780 int error = FALSE0;
3781
3782 /*
3783 * Get the first variable.
3784 */
3785 if (eval7(arg, rettv, evaluate, want_string) == FAIL0)
3786 return FAIL0;
3787
3788 /*
3789 * Repeat computing, until no '*', '/' or '%' is following.
3790 */
3791 for (;; ) {
3792 op = **arg;
3793 if (op != '*' && op != '/' && op != '%')
3794 break;
3795
3796 if (evaluate) {
3797 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
3798 f1 = rettv->vval.v_float;
3799 use_float = TRUE1;
3800 n1 = 0;
3801 } else
3802 n1 = get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error);
3803 clear_tv(rettv);
3804 if (error)
3805 return FAIL0;
3806 } else
3807 n1 = 0;
3808
3809 /*
3810 * Get the second variable.
3811 */
3812 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3813 if (eval7(arg, &var2, evaluate, FALSE0) == FAIL0)
3814 return FAIL0;
3815
3816 if (evaluate) {
3817 if (var2.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
3818 if (!use_float) {
3819 f1 = n1;
3820 use_float = TRUE1;
3821 }
3822 f2 = var2.vval.v_float;
3823 n2 = 0;
3824 } else {
3825 n2 = get_tv_number_chk(&var2, &error);
3826 clear_tv(&var2);
3827 if (error)
3828 return FAIL0;
3829 if (use_float)
3830 f2 = n2;
3831 }
3832
3833 /*
3834 * Compute the result.
3835 * When either side is a float the result is a float.
3836 */
3837 if (use_float) {
3838 if (op == '*')
3839 f1 = f1 * f2;
3840 else if (op == '/') {
3841 /* We rely on the floating point library to handle divide
3842 * by zero to result in "inf" and not a crash. */
3843 f1 = f2 != 0 ? f1 / f2 : INFINITY(__builtin_inff());
3844 } else {
3845 EMSG(_("E804: Cannot use '%' with Float"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E804: Cannot use '%' with Float"
))));
3846 return FAIL0;
3847 }
3848 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
3849 rettv->vval.v_float = f1;
3850 } else {
3851 if (op == '*')
3852 n1 = n1 * n2;
3853 else if (op == '/') {
3854 if (n2 == 0) { /* give an error message? */
3855 if (n1 == 0)
3856 n1 = -0x7fffffffL - 1L; /* similar to NaN */
3857 else if (n1 < 0)
3858 n1 = -0x7fffffffL;
3859 else
3860 n1 = 0x7fffffffL;
3861 } else
3862 n1 = n1 / n2;
3863 } else {
3864 if (n2 == 0) /* give an error message? */
3865 n1 = 0;
3866 else
3867 n1 = n1 % n2;
3868 }
3869 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
3870 rettv->vval.v_number = n1;
3871 }
3872 }
3873 }
3874
3875 return OK1;
3876}
3877
3878/*
3879 * Handle sixth level expression:
3880 * number number constant
3881 * "string" string constant
3882 * 'string' literal string constant
3883 * &option-name option value
3884 * @r register contents
3885 * identifier variable value
3886 * function() function call
3887 * $VAR environment variable
3888 * (expression) nested expression
3889 * [expr, expr] List
3890 * {key: val, key: val} Dictionary
3891 *
3892 * Also handle:
3893 * ! in front logical NOT
3894 * - in front unary minus
3895 * + in front unary plus (ignored)
3896 * trailing [] subscript in String or List
3897 * trailing .name entry in Dictionary
3898 *
3899 * "arg" must point to the first non-white of the expression.
3900 * "arg" is advanced to the next non-white after the recognized expression.
3901 *
3902 * Return OK or FAIL.
3903 */
3904static int
3905eval7 (
3906 char_u **arg,
3907 typval_T *rettv,
3908 int evaluate,
3909 int want_string /* after "." operator */
3910)
3911{
3912 long n;
3913 int len;
3914 char_u *s;
3915 char_u *start_leader, *end_leader;
3916 int ret = OK1;
3917 char_u *alias;
3918
3919 /*
3920 * Initialise variable so that clear_tv() can't mistake this for a
3921 * string and free a string that isn't there.
3922 */
3923 rettv->v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
3924
3925 /*
3926 * Skip '!' and '-' characters. They are handled later.
3927 */
3928 start_leader = *arg;
3929 while (**arg == '!' || **arg == '-' || **arg == '+')
3930 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
3931 end_leader = *arg;
3932
3933 switch (**arg) {
3934 /*
3935 * Number constant.
3936 */
3937 case '0':
3938 case '1':
3939 case '2':
3940 case '3':
3941 case '4':
3942 case '5':
3943 case '6':
3944 case '7':
3945 case '8':
3946 case '9':
3947 {
3948 char_u *p = skipdigits(*arg + 1);
3949 int get_float = FALSE0;
3950
3951 /* We accept a float when the format matches
3952 * "[0-9]\+\.[0-9]\+\([eE][+-]\?[0-9]\+\)\?". This is very
3953 * strict to avoid backwards compatibility problems.
3954 * Don't look for a float after the "." operator, so that
3955 * ":let vers = 1.2.3" doesn't fail. */
3956 if (!want_string && p[0] == '.' && vim_isdigit(p[1])) {
3957 get_float = TRUE1;
3958 p = skipdigits(p + 2);
3959 if (*p == 'e' || *p == 'E') {
3960 ++p;
3961 if (*p == '-' || *p == '+')
3962 ++p;
3963 if (!vim_isdigit(*p))
3964 get_float = FALSE0;
3965 else
3966 p = skipdigits(p + 1);
3967 }
3968 if (ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(*p) - 'a' <
26)) || *p == '.')
3969 get_float = FALSE0;
3970 }
3971 if (get_float) {
3972 float_T f;
3973
3974 *arg += string2float(*arg, &f);
3975 if (evaluate) {
3976 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
3977 rettv->vval.v_float = f;
3978 }
3979 } else {
3980 vim_str2nr(*arg, NULL((void*)0), &len, TRUE1, TRUE1, &n, NULL((void*)0));
3981 *arg += len;
3982 if (evaluate) {
3983 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
3984 rettv->vval.v_number = n;
3985 }
3986 }
3987 break;
3988 }
3989
3990 /*
3991 * String constant: "string".
3992 */
3993 case '"': ret = get_string_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
3994 break;
3995
3996 /*
3997 * Literal string constant: 'str''ing'.
3998 */
3999 case '\'': ret = get_lit_string_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4000 break;
4001
4002 /*
4003 * List: [expr, expr]
4004 */
4005 case '[': ret = get_list_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4006 break;
4007
4008 /*
4009 * Dictionary: {key: val, key: val}
4010 */
4011 case '{': ret = get_dict_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4012 break;
4013
4014 /*
4015 * Option value: &name
4016 */
4017 case '&': ret = get_option_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4018 break;
4019
4020 /*
4021 * Environment variable: $VAR.
4022 */
4023 case '$': ret = get_env_tv(arg, rettv, evaluate);
4024 break;
4025
4026 /*
4027 * Register contents: @r.
4028 */
4029 case '@': ++*arg;
4030 if (evaluate) {
4031 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4032 rettv->vval.v_string = get_reg_contents(**arg, TRUE1, TRUE1);
4033 }
4034 if (**arg != NUL'\000')
4035 ++*arg;
4036 break;
4037
4038 /*
4039 * nested expression: (expression).
4040 */
4041 case '(': *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4042 ret = eval1(arg, rettv, evaluate); /* recursive! */
4043 if (**arg == ')')
4044 ++*arg;
4045 else if (ret == OK1) {
4046 EMSG(_("E110: Missing ')'"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E110: Missing ')'"))));
4047 clear_tv(rettv);
4048 ret = FAIL0;
4049 }
4050 break;
4051
4052 default: ret = NOTDONE2;
4053 break;
4054 }
4055
4056 if (ret == NOTDONE2) {
4057 /*
4058 * Must be a variable or function name.
4059 * Can also be a curly-braces kind of name: {expr}.
4060 */
4061 s = *arg;
4062 len = get_name_len(arg, &alias, evaluate, TRUE1);
4063 if (alias != NULL((void*)0))
4064 s = alias;
4065
4066 if (len <= 0)
4067 ret = FAIL0;
4068 else {
4069 if (**arg == '(') { /* recursive! */
4070 /* If "s" is the name of a variable of type VAR_FUNC
4071 * use its contents. */
4072 s = deref_func_name(s, &len, !evaluate);
4073
4074 /* Invoke the function. */
4075 ret = get_func_tv(s, len, rettv, arg,
4076 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
4077 &len, evaluate, NULL((void*)0));
4078
4079 /* If evaluate is FALSE rettv->v_type was not set in
4080 * get_func_tv, but it's needed in handle_subscript() to parse
4081 * what follows. So set it here. */
4082 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0 && !evaluate && **arg == '(') {
4083 rettv->vval.v_string = (char_u *)"";
4084 rettv->v_type = VAR_FUNC3;
4085 }
4086
4087 /* Stop the expression evaluation when immediately
4088 * aborting on error, or when an interrupt occurred or
4089 * an exception was thrown but not caught. */
4090 if (aborting()) {
4091 if (ret == OK1)
4092 clear_tv(rettv);
4093 ret = FAIL0;
4094 }
4095 } else if (evaluate)
4096 ret = get_var_tv(s, len, rettv, TRUE1, FALSE0);
4097 else
4098 ret = OK1;
4099 }
4100 free(alias);
4101 }
4102
4103 *arg = skipwhite(*arg);
4104
4105 /* Handle following '[', '(' and '.' for expr[expr], expr.name,
4106 * expr(expr). */
4107 if (ret == OK1)
4108 ret = handle_subscript(arg, rettv, evaluate, TRUE1);
4109
4110 /*
4111 * Apply logical NOT and unary '-', from right to left, ignore '+'.
4112 */
4113 if (ret == OK1 && evaluate && end_leader > start_leader) {
4114 int error = FALSE0;
4115 int val = 0;
4116 float_T f = 0.0;
4117
4118 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
4119 f = rettv->vval.v_float;
4120 else
4121 val = get_tv_number_chk(rettv, &error);
4122 if (error) {
4123 clear_tv(rettv);
4124 ret = FAIL0;
4125 } else {
4126 while (end_leader > start_leader) {
4127 --end_leader;
4128 if (*end_leader == '!') {
4129 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
4130 f = !f;
4131 else
4132 val = !val;
4133 } else if (*end_leader == '-') {
4134 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
4135 f = -f;
4136 else
4137 val = -val;
4138 }
4139 }
4140 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
4141 clear_tv(rettv);
4142 rettv->vval.v_float = f;
4143 } else {
4144 clear_tv(rettv);
4145 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
4146 rettv->vval.v_number = val;
4147 }
4148 }
4149 }
4150
4151 return ret;
4152}
4153
4154/*
4155 * Evaluate an "[expr]" or "[expr:expr]" index. Also "dict.key".
4156 * "*arg" points to the '[' or '.'.
4157 * Returns FAIL or OK. "*arg" is advanced to after the ']'.
4158 */
4159static int
4160eval_index (
4161 char_u **arg,
4162 typval_T *rettv,
4163 int evaluate,
4164 int verbose /* give error messages */
4165)
4166{
4167 int empty1 = FALSE0, empty2 = FALSE0;
4168 typval_T var1, var2;
4169 long n1, n2 = 0;
4170 long len = -1;
4171 int range = FALSE0;
4172 char_u *s;
4173 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
4174
4175 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3) {
4176 if (verbose)
4177 EMSG(_("E695: Cannot index a Funcref"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E695: Cannot index a Funcref"
))));
4178 return FAIL0;
4179 } else if (rettv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6) {
4180 if (verbose)
4181 EMSG(_(e_float_as_string))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_float_as_string))));
4182 return FAIL0;
4183 }
4184
4185 if (**arg == '.') {
4186 /*
4187 * dict.name
4188 */
4189 key = *arg + 1;
4190 for (len = 0; ASCII_ISALNUM(key[len])((((unsigned)(key[len]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(key[len
]) - 'a' < 26)) || ((unsigned)(key[len]) - '0' < 10)) || key[len] == '_'; ++len)
4191 ;
4192 if (len == 0)
4193 return FAIL0;
4194 *arg = skipwhite(key + len);
4195 } else {
4196 /*
4197 * something[idx]
4198 *
4199 * Get the (first) variable from inside the [].
4200 */
4201 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4202 if (**arg == ':')
4203 empty1 = TRUE1;
4204 else if (eval1(arg, &var1, evaluate) == FAIL0) /* recursive! */
4205 return FAIL0;
4206 else if (evaluate && get_tv_string_chk(&var1) == NULL((void*)0)) {
4207 /* not a number or string */
4208 clear_tv(&var1);
4209 return FAIL0;
4210 }
4211
4212 /*
4213 * Get the second variable from inside the [:].
4214 */
4215 if (**arg == ':') {
4216 range = TRUE1;
4217 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4218 if (**arg == ']')
4219 empty2 = TRUE1;
4220 else if (eval1(arg, &var2, evaluate) == FAIL0) { /* recursive! */
4221 if (!empty1)
4222 clear_tv(&var1);
4223 return FAIL0;
4224 } else if (evaluate && get_tv_string_chk(&var2) == NULL((void*)0)) {
4225 /* not a number or string */
4226 if (!empty1)
4227 clear_tv(&var1);
4228 clear_tv(&var2);
4229 return FAIL0;
4230 }
4231 }
4232
4233 /* Check for the ']'. */
4234 if (**arg != ']') {
4235 if (verbose)
4236 EMSG(_(e_missbrac))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_missbrac))));
4237 clear_tv(&var1);
4238 if (range)
4239 clear_tv(&var2);
4240 return FAIL0;
4241 }
4242 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1); /* skip the ']' */
4243 }
4244
4245 if (evaluate) {
4246 n1 = 0;
4247 if (!empty1 && rettv->v_type != VAR_DICT5) {
4248 n1 = get_tv_number(&var1);
4249 clear_tv(&var1);
4250 }
4251 if (range) {
4252 if (empty2)
4253 n2 = -1;
4254 else {
4255 n2 = get_tv_number(&var2);
4256 clear_tv(&var2);
4257 }
4258 }
4259
4260 switch (rettv->v_type) {
4261 case VAR_NUMBER1:
4262 case VAR_STRING2:
4263 s = get_tv_string(rettv);
4264 len = (long)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
4265 if (range) {
4266 /* The resulting variable is a substring. If the indexes
4267 * are out of range the result is empty. */
4268 if (n1 < 0) {
4269 n1 = len + n1;
4270 if (n1 < 0)
4271 n1 = 0;
4272 }
4273 if (n2 < 0)
4274 n2 = len + n2;
4275 else if (n2 >= len)
4276 n2 = len;
4277 if (n1 >= len || n2 < 0 || n1 > n2)
4278 s = NULL((void*)0);
4279 else
4280 s = vim_strnsave(s + n1, (int)(n2 - n1 + 1));
4281 } else {
4282 /* The resulting variable is a string of a single
4283 * character. If the index is too big or negative the
4284 * result is empty. */
4285 if (n1 >= len || n1 < 0)
4286 s = NULL((void*)0);
4287 else
4288 s = vim_strnsave(s + n1, 1);
4289 }
4290 clear_tv(rettv);
4291 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4292 rettv->vval.v_string = s;
4293 break;
4294
4295 case VAR_LIST4:
4296 len = list_len(rettv->vval.v_list);
4297 if (n1 < 0)
4298 n1 = len + n1;
4299 if (!empty1 && (n1 < 0 || n1 >= len)) {
4300 /* For a range we allow invalid values and return an empty
4301 * list. A list index out of range is an error. */
4302 if (!range) {
4303 if (verbose)
4304 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), n1)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(n1)
);
4305 return FAIL0;
4306 }
4307 n1 = len;
4308 }
4309 if (range) {
4310 list_T *l;
4311 listitem_T *item;
4312
4313 if (n2 < 0)
4314 n2 = len + n2;
4315 else if (n2 >= len)
4316 n2 = len - 1;
4317 if (!empty2 && (n2 < 0 || n2 + 1 < n1))
4318 n2 = -1;
4319 l = list_alloc();
4320 item = list_find(rettv->vval.v_list, n1);
4321 while (n1++ <= n2) {
4322 list_append_tv(l, &item->li_tv);
4323 item = item->li_next;
4324 }
4325 clear_tv(rettv);
4326 rettv->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
4327 rettv->vval.v_list = l;
4328 ++l->lv_refcount;
4329 } else {
4330 copy_tv(&list_find(rettv->vval.v_list, n1)->li_tv, &var1);
4331 clear_tv(rettv);
4332 *rettv = var1;
4333 }
4334 break;
4335
4336 case VAR_DICT5:
4337 if (range) {
4338 if (verbose)
4339 EMSG(_(e_dictrange))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictrange))));
4340 if (len == -1)
4341 clear_tv(&var1);
4342 return FAIL0;
4343 }
4344 {
4345 dictitem_T *item;
4346
4347 if (len == -1) {
4348 key = get_tv_string(&var1);
4349 if (*key == NUL'\000') {
4350 if (verbose)
4351 EMSG(_(e_emptykey))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_emptykey))));
4352 clear_tv(&var1);
4353 return FAIL0;
4354 }
4355 }
4356
4357 item = dict_find(rettv->vval.v_dict, key, (int)len);
4358
4359 if (item == NULL((void*)0) && verbose)
4360 EMSG2(_(e_dictkey), key)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictkey))), (char_u *)(key
));
4361 if (len == -1)
4362 clear_tv(&var1);
4363 if (item == NULL((void*)0))
4364 return FAIL0;
4365
4366 copy_tv(&item->di_tv, &var1);
4367 clear_tv(rettv);
4368 *rettv = var1;
4369 }
4370 break;
4371 }
4372 }
4373
4374 return OK1;
4375}
4376
4377/*
4378 * Get an option value.
4379 * "arg" points to the '&' or '+' before the option name.
4380 * "arg" is advanced to character after the option name.
4381 * Return OK or FAIL.
4382 */
4383static int
4384get_option_tv (
4385 char_u **arg,
4386 typval_T *rettv, /* when NULL, only check if option exists */
4387 int evaluate
4388)
4389{
4390 char_u *option_end;
4391 long numval;
4392 char_u *stringval;
4393 int opt_type;
4394 int c;
4395 int working = (**arg == '+'); /* has("+option") */
4396 int ret = OK1;
4397 int opt_flags;
4398
4399 /*
4400 * Isolate the option name and find its value.
4401 */
4402 option_end = find_option_end(arg, &opt_flags);
4403 if (option_end == NULL((void*)0)) {
4404 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0))
4405 EMSG2(_("E112: Option name missing: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E112: Option name missing: %s"
))), (char_u *)(*arg));
4406 return FAIL0;
4407 }
4408
4409 if (!evaluate) {
4410 *arg = option_end;
4411 return OK1;
4412 }
4413
4414 c = *option_end;
4415 *option_end = NUL'\000';
4416 opt_type = get_option_value(*arg, &numval,
4417 rettv == NULL((void*)0) ? NULL((void*)0) : &stringval, opt_flags);
4418
4419 if (opt_type == -3) { /* invalid name */
4420 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0))
4421 EMSG2(_("E113: Unknown option: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E113: Unknown option: %s")
)), (char_u *)(*arg));
4422 ret = FAIL0;
4423 } else if (rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
4424 if (opt_type == -2) { /* hidden string option */
4425 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4426 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
4427 } else if (opt_type == -1) { /* hidden number option */
4428 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
4429 rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
4430 } else if (opt_type == 1) { /* number option */
4431 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
4432 rettv->vval.v_number = numval;
4433 } else { /* string option */
4434 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4435 rettv->vval.v_string = stringval;
4436 }
4437 } else if (working && (opt_type == -2 || opt_type == -1))
4438 ret = FAIL0;
4439
4440 *option_end = c; /* put back for error messages */
4441 *arg = option_end;
4442
4443 return ret;
4444}
4445
4446/*
4447 * Allocate a variable for a string constant.
4448 * Return OK or FAIL.
4449 */
4450static int get_string_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
4451{
4452 char_u *p;
4453 char_u *name;
4454 int extra = 0;
4455
4456 /*
4457 * Find the end of the string, skipping backslashed characters.
4458 */
4459 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1) {
4460 if (*p == '\\' && p[1] != NUL'\000') {
4461 ++p;
4462 /* A "\<x>" form occupies at least 4 characters, and produces up
4463 * to 6 characters: reserve space for 2 extra */
4464 if (*p == '<')
4465 extra += 2;
4466 }
4467 }
4468
4469 if (*p != '"') {
4470 EMSG2(_("E114: Missing quote: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E114: Missing quote: %s"))
), (char_u *)(*arg));
4471 return FAIL0;
4472 }
4473
4474 /* If only parsing, set *arg and return here */
4475 if (!evaluate) {
4476 *arg = p + 1;
4477 return OK1;
4478 }
4479
4480 /*
4481 * Copy the string into allocated memory, handling backslashed
4482 * characters.
4483 */
4484 name = xmalloc(p - *arg + extra);
4485 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4486 rettv->vval.v_string = name;
4487
4488 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"'; ) {
4489 if (*p == '\\') {
4490 switch (*++p) {
4491 case 'b': *name++ = BS'\010'; ++p; break;
4492 case 'e': *name++ = ESC'\033'; ++p; break;
4493 case 'f': *name++ = FF'\014'; ++p; break;
4494 case 'n': *name++ = NL'\012'; ++p; break;
4495 case 'r': *name++ = CAR'\015'; ++p; break;
4496 case 't': *name++ = TAB'\011'; ++p; break;
4497
4498 case 'X': /* hex: "\x1", "\x12" */
4499 case 'x':
4500 case 'u': /* Unicode: "\u0023" */
4501 case 'U':
4502 if (vim_isxdigit(p[1])) {
4503 int n, nr;
4504 int c = toupper(*p);
4505
4506 if (c == 'X')
4507 n = 2;
4508 else
4509 n = 4;
4510 nr = 0;
4511 while (--n >= 0 && vim_isxdigit(p[1])) {
4512 ++p;
4513 nr = (nr << 4) + hex2nr(*p);
4514 }
4515 ++p;
4516 /* For "\u" store the number according to
4517 * 'encoding'. */
4518 if (c != 'X')
4519 name += (*mb_char2bytes)(nr, name);
4520 else
4521 *name++ = nr;
4522 }
4523 break;
4524
4525 /* octal: "\1", "\12", "\123" */
4526 case '0':
4527 case '1':
4528 case '2':
4529 case '3':
4530 case '4':
4531 case '5':
4532 case '6':
4533 case '7': *name = *p++ - '0';
4534 if (*p >= '0' && *p <= '7') {
4535 *name = (*name << 3) + *p++ - '0';
4536 if (*p >= '0' && *p <= '7')
4537 *name = (*name << 3) + *p++ - '0';
4538 }
4539 ++name;
4540 break;
4541
4542 /* Special key, e.g.: "\<C-W>" */
4543 case '<': extra = trans_special(&p, name, TRUE1);
4544 if (extra != 0) {
4545 name += extra;
4546 break;
4547 }
4548 /* FALLTHROUGH */
4549
4550 default: MB_COPY_CHAR(p, name)if (has_mbyte) mb_copy_char(&p, &name); else *name++ =
*p++;
4551 break;
4552 }
4553 } else
4554 MB_COPY_CHAR(p, name)if (has_mbyte) mb_copy_char(&p, &name); else *name++ =
*p++;
4555
4556 }
4557 *name = NUL'\000';
4558 *arg = p + 1;
4559
4560 return OK1;
4561}
4562
4563/*
4564 * Allocate a variable for a 'str''ing' constant.
4565 * Return OK or FAIL.
4566 */
4567static int get_lit_string_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
4568{
4569 char_u *p;
4570 char_u *str;
4571 int reduce = 0;
4572
4573 /*
4574 * Find the end of the string, skipping ''.
4575 */
4576 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1) {
4577 if (*p == '\'') {
4578 if (p[1] != '\'')
4579 break;
4580 ++reduce;
4581 ++p;
4582 }
4583 }
4584
4585 if (*p != '\'') {
4586 EMSG2(_("E115: Missing quote: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E115: Missing quote: %s"))
), (char_u *)(*arg));
4587 return FAIL0;
4588 }
4589
4590 /* If only parsing return after setting "*arg" */
4591 if (!evaluate) {
4592 *arg = p + 1;
4593 return OK1;
4594 }
4595
4596 /*
4597 * Copy the string into allocated memory, handling '' to ' reduction.
4598 */
4599 str = xmalloc((p - *arg) - reduce);
4600 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
4601 rettv->vval.v_string = str;
4602
4603 for (p = *arg + 1; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
4604 if (*p == '\'') {
4605 if (p[1] != '\'')
4606 break;
4607 ++p;
4608 }
4609 MB_COPY_CHAR(p, str)if (has_mbyte) mb_copy_char(&p, &str); else *str++ = *
p++;
4610 }
4611 *str = NUL'\000';
4612 *arg = p + 1;
4613
4614 return OK1;
4615}
4616
4617/*
4618 * Allocate a variable for a List and fill it from "*arg".
4619 * Return OK or FAIL.
4620 */
4621static int get_list_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
4622{
4623 list_T *l = NULL((void*)0);
4624 typval_T tv;
4625 listitem_T *item;
4626
4627 if (evaluate) {
4628 l = list_alloc();
4629 }
4630
4631 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4632 while (**arg != ']' && **arg != NUL'\000') {
4633 if (eval1(arg, &tv, evaluate) == FAIL0) /* recursive! */
4634 goto failret;
4635 if (evaluate) {
4636 item = listitem_alloc();
4637 item->li_tv = tv;
4638 item->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
4639 list_append(l, item);
4640 }
4641
4642 if (**arg == ']')
4643 break;
4644 if (**arg != ',') {
4645 EMSG2(_("E696: Missing comma in List: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E696: Missing comma in List: %s"
))), (char_u *)(*arg));
4646 goto failret;
4647 }
4648 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4649 }
4650
4651 if (**arg != ']') {
4652 EMSG2(_("E697: Missing end of List ']': %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E697: Missing end of List ']': %s"
))), (char_u *)(*arg));
4653failret:
4654 if (evaluate)
4655 list_free(l, TRUE1);
4656 return FAIL0;
4657 }
4658
4659 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
4660 if (evaluate) {
4661 rettv->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
4662 rettv->vval.v_list = l;
4663 ++l->lv_refcount;
4664 }
4665
4666 return OK1;
4667}
4668
4669/*
4670 * Allocate an empty header for a list.
4671 * Caller should take care of the reference count.
4672 */
4673list_T *list_alloc(void) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
4674{
4675 list_T *list = xcalloc(1, sizeof(list_T));
4676
4677 /* Prepend the list to the list of lists for garbage collection. */
4678 if (first_list != NULL((void*)0))
4679 first_list->lv_used_prev = list;
4680 list->lv_used_prev = NULL((void*)0);
4681 list->lv_used_next = first_list;
4682 first_list = list;
4683 return list;
4684}
4685
4686/*
4687 * Allocate an empty list for a return value.
4688 */
4689static void rettv_list_alloc(typval_T *rettv)
4690{
4691 list_T *l = list_alloc();
4692 rettv->vval.v_list = l;
4693 rettv->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
4694 ++l->lv_refcount;
4695}
4696
4697/*
4698 * Unreference a list: decrement the reference count and free it when it
4699 * becomes zero.
4700 */
4701void list_unref(list_T *l)
4702{
4703 if (l != NULL((void*)0) && --l->lv_refcount <= 0)
4704 list_free(l, TRUE1);
4705}
4706
4707/*
4708 * Free a list, including all items it points to.
4709 * Ignores the reference count.
4710 */
4711void
4712list_free (
4713 list_T *l,
4714 int recurse /* Free Lists and Dictionaries recursively. */
4715)
4716{
4717 listitem_T *item;
4718
4719 /* Remove the list from the list of lists for garbage collection. */
4720 if (l->lv_used_prev == NULL((void*)0))
4721 first_list = l->lv_used_next;
4722 else
4723 l->lv_used_prev->lv_used_next = l->lv_used_next;
4724 if (l->lv_used_next != NULL((void*)0))
4725 l->lv_used_next->lv_used_prev = l->lv_used_prev;
4726
4727 for (item = l->lv_first; item != NULL((void*)0); item = l->lv_first) {
4728 /* Remove the item before deleting it. */
4729 l->lv_first = item->li_next;
4730 if (recurse || (item->li_tv.v_type != VAR_LIST4
4731 && item->li_tv.v_type != VAR_DICT5))
4732 clear_tv(&item->li_tv);
4733 free(item);
4734 }
4735 free(l);
4736}
4737
4738/*
4739 * Allocate a list item.
4740 */
4741listitem_T *listitem_alloc(void) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
4742{
4743 return xmalloc(sizeof(listitem_T));
4744}
4745
4746/*
4747 * Free a list item. Also clears the value. Does not notify watchers.
4748 */
4749void listitem_free(listitem_T *item)
4750{
4751 clear_tv(&item->li_tv);
4752 free(item);
4753}
4754
4755/*
4756 * Remove a list item from a List and free it. Also clears the value.
4757 */
4758void listitem_remove(list_T *l, listitem_T *item)
4759{
4760 vim_list_remove(l, item, item);
4761 listitem_free(item);
4762}
4763
4764/*
4765 * Get the number of items in a list.
4766 */
4767static long list_len(list_T *l)
4768{
4769 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
4770 return 0L;
4771 return l->lv_len;
4772}
4773
4774/*
4775 * Return TRUE when two lists have exactly the same values.
4776 */
4777static int
4778list_equal (
4779 list_T *l1,
4780 list_T *l2,
4781 int ic, /* ignore case for strings */
4782 int recursive /* TRUE when used recursively */
4783)
4784{
4785 listitem_T *item1, *item2;
4786
4787 if (l1 == NULL((void*)0) || l2 == NULL((void*)0))
4788 return FALSE0;
4789 if (l1 == l2)
4790 return TRUE1;
4791 if (list_len(l1) != list_len(l2))
4792 return FALSE0;
4793
4794 for (item1 = l1->lv_first, item2 = l2->lv_first;
4795 item1 != NULL((void*)0) && item2 != NULL((void*)0);
4796 item1 = item1->li_next, item2 = item2->li_next)
4797 if (!tv_equal(&item1->li_tv, &item2->li_tv, ic, recursive))
4798 return FALSE0;
4799 return item1 == NULL((void*)0) && item2 == NULL((void*)0);
4800}
4801
4802#if defined(PROTO)
4803/*
4804 * Return the dictitem that an entry in a hashtable points to.
4805 */
4806dictitem_T *dict_lookup(hashitem_T *hi)
4807{
4808 return HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
4809}
4810#endif
4811
4812dictitem_T * dict_lookup(hashitem_T *hi)
4813{
4814 return HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
4815}
4816
4817/*
4818 * Return TRUE when two dictionaries have exactly the same key/values.
4819 */
4820static int
4821dict_equal (
4822 dict_T *d1,
4823 dict_T *d2,
4824 int ic, /* ignore case for strings */
4825 int recursive /* TRUE when used recursively */
4826)
4827{
4828 hashitem_T *hi;
4829 dictitem_T *item2;
4830 int todo;
4831
4832 if (d1 == NULL((void*)0) || d2 == NULL((void*)0))
4833 return FALSE0;
4834 if (d1 == d2)
4835 return TRUE1;
4836 if (dict_len(d1) != dict_len(d2))
4837 return FALSE0;
4838
4839 todo = (int)d1->dv_hashtab.ht_used;
4840 for (hi = d1->dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
4841 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
4842 item2 = dict_find(d2, hi->hi_key, -1);
4843 if (item2 == NULL((void*)0))
4844 return FALSE0;
4845 if (!tv_equal(&HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)))->di_tv, &item2->di_tv, ic, recursive))
4846 return FALSE0;
4847 --todo;
4848 }
4849 }
4850 return TRUE1;
4851}
4852
4853static int tv_equal_recurse_limit;
4854
4855/*
4856 * Return TRUE if "tv1" and "tv2" have the same value.
4857 * Compares the items just like "==" would compare them, but strings and
4858 * numbers are different. Floats and numbers are also different.
4859 */
4860static int
4861tv_equal (
4862 typval_T *tv1,
4863 typval_T *tv2,
4864 int ic, /* ignore case */
4865 int recursive /* TRUE when used recursively */
4866)
4867{
4868 char_u buf1[NUMBUFLEN30], buf2[NUMBUFLEN30];
4869 char_u *s1, *s2;
4870 static int recursive_cnt = 0; /* catch recursive loops */
4871 int r;
4872
4873 if (tv1->v_type != tv2->v_type)
4874 return FALSE0;
4875
4876 /* Catch lists and dicts that have an endless loop by limiting
4877 * recursiveness to a limit. We guess they are equal then.
4878 * A fixed limit has the problem of still taking an awful long time.
4879 * Reduce the limit every time running into it. That should work fine for
4880 * deeply linked structures that are not recursively linked and catch
4881 * recursiveness quickly. */
4882 if (!recursive)
4883 tv_equal_recurse_limit = 1000;
4884 if (recursive_cnt >= tv_equal_recurse_limit) {
4885 --tv_equal_recurse_limit;
4886 return TRUE1;
4887 }
4888
4889 switch (tv1->v_type) {
4890 case VAR_LIST4:
4891 ++recursive_cnt;
4892 r = list_equal(tv1->vval.v_list, tv2->vval.v_list, ic, TRUE1);
4893 --recursive_cnt;
4894 return r;
4895
4896 case VAR_DICT5:
4897 ++recursive_cnt;
4898 r = dict_equal(tv1->vval.v_dict, tv2->vval.v_dict, ic, TRUE1);
4899 --recursive_cnt;
4900 return r;
4901
4902 case VAR_FUNC3:
4903 return tv1->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
4904 && tv2->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
4905 && STRCMP(tv1->vval.v_string, tv2->vval.v_string)strcmp((char *)(tv1->vval.v_string), (char *)(tv2->vval
.v_string)) == 0;
4906
4907 case VAR_NUMBER1:
4908 return tv1->vval.v_number == tv2->vval.v_number;
4909
4910 case VAR_FLOAT6:
4911 return tv1->vval.v_float == tv2->vval.v_float;
4912
4913 case VAR_STRING2:
4914 s1 = get_tv_string_buf(tv1, buf1);
4915 s2 = get_tv_string_buf(tv2, buf2);
4916 return (ic ? MB_STRICMP(s1, s2)mb_strnicmp((char_u *)(s1), (char_u *)(s2), (int)(0x7fffffffL
)) : STRCMP(s1, s2)strcmp((char *)(s1), (char *)(s2))) == 0;
4917 }
4918
4919 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "tv_equal()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("tv_equal()"
));
4920 return TRUE1;
4921}
4922
4923/*
4924 * Locate item with index "n" in list "l" and return it.
4925 * A negative index is counted from the end; -1 is the last item.
4926 * Returns NULL when "n" is out of range.
4927 */
4928listitem_T *list_find(list_T *l, long n)
4929{
4930 listitem_T *item;
4931 long idx;
4932
4933 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
4934 return NULL((void*)0);
4935
4936 /* Negative index is relative to the end. */
4937 if (n < 0)
4938 n = l->lv_len + n;
4939
4940 /* Check for index out of range. */
4941 if (n < 0 || n >= l->lv_len)
4942 return NULL((void*)0);
4943
4944 /* When there is a cached index may start search from there. */
4945 if (l->lv_idx_item != NULL((void*)0)) {
4946 if (n < l->lv_idx / 2) {
4947 /* closest to the start of the list */
4948 item = l->lv_first;
4949 idx = 0;
4950 } else if (n > (l->lv_idx + l->lv_len) / 2) {
4951 /* closest to the end of the list */
4952 item = l->lv_last;
4953 idx = l->lv_len - 1;
4954 } else {
4955 /* closest to the cached index */
4956 item = l->lv_idx_item;
4957 idx = l->lv_idx;
4958 }
4959 } else {
4960 if (n < l->lv_len / 2) {
4961 /* closest to the start of the list */
4962 item = l->lv_first;
4963 idx = 0;
4964 } else {
4965 /* closest to the end of the list */
4966 item = l->lv_last;
4967 idx = l->lv_len - 1;
4968 }
4969 }
4970
4971 while (n > idx) {
4972 /* search forward */
4973 item = item->li_next;
4974 ++idx;
4975 }
4976 while (n < idx) {
4977 /* search backward */
4978 item = item->li_prev;
4979 --idx;
4980 }
4981
4982 /* cache the used index */
4983 l->lv_idx = idx;
4984 l->lv_idx_item = item;
4985
4986 return item;
4987}
4988
4989/*
4990 * Get list item "l[idx]" as a number.
4991 */
4992static long
4993list_find_nr (
4994 list_T *l,
4995 long idx,
4996 int *errorp /* set to TRUE when something wrong */
4997)
4998{
4999 listitem_T *li;
5000
5001 li = list_find(l, idx);
5002 if (li == NULL((void*)0)) {
5003 if (errorp != NULL((void*)0))
5004 *errorp = TRUE1;
5005 return -1L;
5006 }
5007 return get_tv_number_chk(&li->li_tv, errorp);
5008}
5009
5010/*
5011 * Get list item "l[idx - 1]" as a string. Returns NULL for failure.
5012 */
5013char_u *list_find_str(list_T *l, long idx)
5014{
5015 listitem_T *li;
5016
5017 li = list_find(l, idx - 1);
5018 if (li == NULL((void*)0)) {
5019 EMSGN(_(e_listidx), idx)emsgn((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listidx))), (int64_t)(idx
));
5020 return NULL((void*)0);
5021 }
5022 return get_tv_string(&li->li_tv);
5023}
5024
5025/*
5026 * Locate "item" list "l" and return its index.
5027 * Returns -1 when "item" is not in the list.
5028 */
5029static long list_idx_of_item(list_T *l, listitem_T *item)
5030{
5031 long idx = 0;
5032 listitem_T *li;
5033
5034 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
5035 return -1;
5036 idx = 0;
5037 for (li = l->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0) && li != item; li = li->li_next)
5038 ++idx;
5039 if (li == NULL((void*)0))
5040 return -1;
5041 return idx;
5042}
5043
5044/*
5045 * Append item "item" to the end of list "l".
5046 */
5047void list_append(list_T *l, listitem_T *item)
5048{
5049 if (l->lv_last == NULL((void*)0)) {
5050 /* empty list */
5051 l->lv_first = item;
5052 l->lv_last = item;
5053 item->li_prev = NULL((void*)0);
5054 } else {
5055 l->lv_last->li_next = item;
5056 item->li_prev = l->lv_last;
5057 l->lv_last = item;
5058 }
5059 ++l->lv_len;
5060 item->li_next = NULL((void*)0);
5061}
5062
5063/*
5064 * Append typval_T "tv" to the end of list "l".
5065 */
5066void list_append_tv(list_T *l, typval_T *tv)
5067{
5068 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
5069 copy_tv(tv, &li->li_tv);
5070 list_append(l, li);
5071}
5072
5073/*
5074 * Add a dictionary to a list. Used by getqflist().
5075 */
5076void list_append_dict(list_T *list, dict_T *dict)
5077{
5078 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
5079
5080 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_DICT5;
5081 li->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
5082 li->li_tv.vval.v_dict = dict;
5083 list_append(list, li);
5084 ++dict->dv_refcount;
5085}
5086
5087/*
5088 * Make a copy of "str" and append it as an item to list "l".
5089 * When "len" >= 0 use "str[len]".
5090 */
5091void list_append_string(list_T *l, char_u *str, int len)
5092{
5093 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
5094
5095 list_append(l, li);
5096 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
5097 li->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
5098
5099 if (str == NULL((void*)0)) {
5100 li->li_tv.vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
5101 } else {
5102 li->li_tv.vval.v_string = (len >= 0) ? vim_strnsave(str, len)
5103 : vim_strsave(str);
5104 }
5105}
5106
5107/*
5108 * Append "n" to list "l".
5109 */
5110static void list_append_number(list_T *l, varnumber_T n)
5111{
5112 listitem_T *li = listitem_alloc();
5113 li->li_tv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
5114 li->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
5115 li->li_tv.vval.v_number = n;
5116 list_append(l, li);
5117}
5118
5119/*
5120 * Insert typval_T "tv" in list "l" before "item".
5121 * If "item" is NULL append at the end.
5122 */
5123void list_insert_tv(list_T *l, typval_T *tv, listitem_T *item)
5124{
5125 listitem_T *ni = listitem_alloc();
5126
5127 copy_tv(tv, &ni->li_tv);
5128 list_insert(l, ni, item);
5129}
5130
5131void list_insert(list_T *l, listitem_T *ni, listitem_T *item)
5132{
5133 if (item == NULL((void*)0))
5134 /* Append new item at end of list. */
5135 list_append(l, ni);
5136 else {
5137 /* Insert new item before existing item. */
5138 ni->li_prev = item->li_prev;
5139 ni->li_next = item;
5140 if (item->li_prev == NULL((void*)0)) {
5141 l->lv_first = ni;
5142 ++l->lv_idx;
5143 } else {
5144 item->li_prev->li_next = ni;
5145 l->lv_idx_item = NULL((void*)0);
5146 }
5147 item->li_prev = ni;
5148 ++l->lv_len;
5149 }
5150}
5151
5152/*
5153 * Extend "l1" with "l2".
5154 * If "bef" is NULL append at the end, otherwise insert before this item.
5155 */
5156static void list_extend(list_T *l1, list_T *l2, listitem_T *bef)
5157{
5158 listitem_T *item;
5159 int todo = l2->lv_len;
5160
5161 /* We also quit the loop when we have inserted the original item count of
5162 * the list, avoid a hang when we extend a list with itself. */
5163 for (item = l2->lv_first; item != NULL((void*)0) && --todo >= 0; item = item->li_next) {
5164 list_insert_tv(l1, &item->li_tv, bef);
5165 }
5166}
5167
5168/*
5169 * Concatenate lists "l1" and "l2" into a new list, stored in "tv".
5170 * Return FAIL on failure to copy.
5171 */
5172static int list_concat(list_T *l1, list_T *l2, typval_T *tv)
5173{
5174 list_T *l;
5175
5176 if (l1 == NULL((void*)0) || l2 == NULL((void*)0))
5177 return FAIL0;
5178
5179 /* make a copy of the first list. */
5180 l = list_copy(l1, FALSE0, 0);
5181 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
5182 return FAIL0;
5183 tv->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
5184 tv->vval.v_list = l;
5185
5186 /* append all items from the second list */
5187 list_extend(l, l2, NULL((void*)0));
5188 return OK1;
5189}
5190
5191/*
5192 * Make a copy of list "orig". Shallow if "deep" is FALSE.
5193 * The refcount of the new list is set to 1.
5194 * See item_copy() for "copyID".
5195 * Returns NULL if orig is NULL or some failure happens.
5196 */
5197static list_T *list_copy(list_T *orig, int deep, int copyID)
5198{
5199 listitem_T *item;
5200 listitem_T *ni;
5201
5202 if (orig == NULL((void*)0))
5203 return NULL((void*)0);
5204
5205 list_T *copy = list_alloc();
5206 if (copyID != 0) {
5207 /* Do this before adding the items, because one of the items may
5208 * refer back to this list. */
5209 orig->lv_copyID = copyID;
5210 orig->lv_copylist = copy;
5211 }
5212 for (item = orig->lv_first; item != NULL((void*)0) && !got_int;
5213 item = item->li_next) {
5214 ni = listitem_alloc();
5215 if (deep) {
5216 if (item_copy(&item->li_tv, &ni->li_tv, deep, copyID) == FAIL0) {
5217 free(ni);
5218 break;
5219 }
5220 } else
5221 copy_tv(&item->li_tv, &ni->li_tv);
5222 list_append(copy, ni);
5223 }
5224 ++copy->lv_refcount;
5225 if (item != NULL((void*)0)) {
5226 list_unref(copy);
5227 copy = NULL((void*)0);
5228 }
5229
5230 return copy;
5231}
5232
5233/// Remove items "item" to "item2" from list "l".
5234/// @warning Does not free the listitem or the value!
5235void vim_list_remove(list_T *l, listitem_T *item, listitem_T *item2)
5236{
5237 // notify watchers
5238 for (listitem_T *ip = item; ip != NULL((void*)0); ip = ip->li_next) {
5239 --l->lv_len;
5240 list_fix_watch(l, ip);
5241 if (ip == item2) {
5242 break;
5243 }
5244 }
5245
5246 if (item2->li_next == NULL((void*)0)) {
5247 l->lv_last = item->li_prev;
5248 } else {
5249 item2->li_next->li_prev = item->li_prev;
5250 }
5251 if (item->li_prev == NULL((void*)0)) {
5252 l->lv_first = item2->li_next;
5253 } else {
5254 item->li_prev->li_next = item2->li_next;
5255 }
5256 l->lv_idx_item = NULL((void*)0);
5257}
5258
5259/*
5260 * Return an allocated string with the string representation of a list.
5261 * May return NULL.
5262 */
5263static char_u *list2string(typval_T *tv, int copyID)
5264{
5265 garray_T ga;
5266
5267 if (tv->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))
5268 return NULL((void*)0);
5269 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char), 80);
5270 ga_append(&ga, '[');
5271 if (list_join(&ga, tv->vval.v_list, (char_u *)", ", FALSE0, copyID) == FAIL0) {
5272 free(ga.ga_data);
5273 return NULL((void*)0);
5274 }
5275 ga_append(&ga, ']');
5276 ga_append(&ga, NUL'\000');
5277 return (char_u *)ga.ga_data;
5278}
5279
5280typedef struct join_S {
5281 char_u *s;
5282 char_u *tofree;
5283} join_T;
5284
5285static int
5286list_join_inner (
5287 garray_T *gap, /* to store the result in */
5288 list_T *l,
5289 char_u *sep,
5290 int echo_style,
5291 int copyID,
5292 garray_T *join_gap /* to keep each list item string */
5293)
5294{
5295 join_T *p;
5296 int len;
5297 int sumlen = 0;
5298 int first = TRUE1;
5299 char_u *tofree;
5300 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
5301 listitem_T *item;
5302 char_u *s;
5303
5304 /* Stringify each item in the list. */
5305 for (item = l->lv_first; item != NULL((void*)0) && !got_int; item = item->li_next) {
5306 if (echo_style)
5307 s = echo_string(&item->li_tv, &tofree, numbuf, copyID);
5308 else
5309 s = tv2string(&item->li_tv, &tofree, numbuf, copyID);
5310 if (s == NULL((void*)0))
5311 return FAIL0;
5312
5313 len = (int)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
5314 sumlen += len;
5315
5316 p = GA_APPEND_VIA_PTR(join_T, join_gap)ga_append_via_ptr(join_gap, sizeof(join_T));
5317 if (tofree != NULL((void*)0) || s != numbuf) {
5318 p->s = s;
5319 p->tofree = tofree;
5320 } else {
5321 p->s = vim_strnsave(s, len);
5322 p->tofree = p->s;
5323 }
5324
5325 line_breakcheck();
5326 if (did_echo_string_emsg) { // recursion error, bail out
5327 break;
5328 }
5329 }
5330
5331 /* Allocate result buffer with its total size, avoid re-allocation and
5332 * multiple copy operations. Add 2 for a tailing ']' and NUL. */
5333 if (join_gap->ga_len >= 2)
5334 sumlen += (int)STRLEN(sep)strlen((char *)(sep)) * (join_gap->ga_len - 1);
5335 ga_grow(gap, sumlen + 2);
5336
5337 for (int i = 0; i < join_gap->ga_len && !got_int; ++i) {
5338 if (first)
5339 first = FALSE0;
5340 else
5341 ga_concat(gap, sep);
5342 p = ((join_T *)join_gap->ga_data) + i;
5343
5344 if (p->s != NULL((void*)0))
5345 ga_concat(gap, p->s);
5346 line_breakcheck();
5347 }
5348
5349 return OK1;
5350}
5351
5352/*
5353 * Join list "l" into a string in "*gap", using separator "sep".
5354 * When "echo_style" is TRUE use String as echoed, otherwise as inside a List.
5355 * Return FAIL or OK.
5356 */
5357static int list_join(garray_T *gap, list_T *l, char_u *sep, int echo_style, int copyID)
5358{
5359 garray_T join_ga;
5360 int retval;
5361 join_T *p;
5362
5363 ga_init(&join_ga, (int)sizeof(join_T), l->lv_len);
5364 retval = list_join_inner(gap, l, sep, echo_style, copyID, &join_ga);
5365
5366 /* Dispose each item in join_ga. */
5367 if (join_ga.ga_data != NULL((void*)0)) {
5368 p = (join_T *)join_ga.ga_data;
5369 for (int i = 0; i < join_ga.ga_len; ++i) {
5370 free(p->tofree);
5371 ++p;
5372 }
5373 ga_clear(&join_ga);
5374 }
5375
5376 return retval;
5377}
5378
5379/*
5380 * Garbage collection for lists and dictionaries.
5381 *
5382 * We use reference counts to be able to free most items right away when they
5383 * are no longer used. But for composite items it's possible that it becomes
5384 * unused while the reference count is > 0: When there is a recursive
5385 * reference. Example:
5386 * :let l = [1, 2, 3]
5387 * :let d = {9: l}
5388 * :let l[1] = d
5389 *
5390 * Since this is quite unusual we handle this with garbage collection: every
5391 * once in a while find out which lists and dicts are not referenced from any
5392 * variable.
5393 *
5394 * Here is a good reference text about garbage collection (refers to Python
5395 * but it applies to all reference-counting mechanisms):
5396 * http://python.ca/nas/python/gc/
5397 */
5398
5399/*
5400 * Do garbage collection for lists and dicts.
5401 * Return TRUE if some memory was freed.
5402 */
5403int garbage_collect(void)
5404{
5405 int copyID;
5406 win_T *wp;
5407 funccall_T *fc, **pfc;
5408 int did_free;
5409 int did_free_funccal = FALSE0;
5410 tabpage_T *tp;
5411
5412 /* Only do this once. */
5413 want_garbage_collect = FALSE0;
5414 may_garbage_collect = FALSE0;
5415 garbage_collect_at_exit = FALSE0;
5416
5417 /* We advance by two because we add one for items referenced through
5418 * previous_funccal. */
5419 current_copyID += COPYID_INC2;
5420 copyID = current_copyID;
5421
5422 /*
5423 * 1. Go through all accessible variables and mark all lists and dicts
5424 * with copyID.
5425 */
5426
5427 /* Don't free variables in the previous_funccal list unless they are only
5428 * referenced through previous_funccal. This must be first, because if
5429 * the item is referenced elsewhere the funccal must not be freed. */
5430 for (fc = previous_funccal; fc != NULL((void*)0); fc = fc->caller) {
5431 set_ref_in_ht(&fc->l_vars.dv_hashtab, copyID + 1);
5432 set_ref_in_ht(&fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab, copyID + 1);
5433 }
5434
5435 /* script-local variables */
5436 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i)
5437 set_ref_in_ht(&SCRIPT_VARS(i)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1])->sv_dict.
dv_hashtab), copyID);
5438
5439 /* buffer-local variables */
5440 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for (buf_T *buf = firstbuf; buf != ((void*)0); buf = buf->
b_next) {
5441 set_ref_in_item(&buf->b_bufvar.di_tv, copyID);
5442 }
5443
5444 /* window-local variables */
5445 FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp)for ((tp) = first_tabpage; (tp) != ((void*)0); (tp) = (tp)->
tp_next) for ((wp) = ((tp) == curtab) ? firstwin : (tp)->tp_firstwin
; (wp); (wp) = (wp)->w_next)
5446 set_ref_in_item(&wp->w_winvar.di_tv, copyID);
5447 if (aucmd_win != NULL((void*)0))
5448 set_ref_in_item(&aucmd_win->w_winvar.di_tv, copyID);
5449
5450 /* tabpage-local variables */
5451 for (tp = first_tabpage; tp != NULL((void*)0); tp = tp->tp_next)
5452 set_ref_in_item(&tp->tp_winvar.di_tv, copyID);
5453
5454 /* global variables */
5455 set_ref_in_ht(&globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab, copyID);
5456
5457 /* function-local variables */
5458 for (fc = current_funccal; fc != NULL((void*)0); fc = fc->caller) {
5459 set_ref_in_ht(&fc->l_vars.dv_hashtab, copyID);
5460 set_ref_in_ht(&fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab, copyID);
5461 }
5462
5463 /* v: vars */
5464 set_ref_in_ht(&vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab, copyID);
5465
5466 /*
5467 * 2. Free lists and dictionaries that are not referenced.
5468 */
5469 did_free = free_unref_items(copyID);
5470
5471 /*
5472 * 3. Check if any funccal can be freed now.
5473 */
5474 for (pfc = &previous_funccal; *pfc != NULL((void*)0); ) {
5475 if (can_free_funccal(*pfc, copyID)) {
5476 fc = *pfc;
5477 *pfc = fc->caller;
5478 free_funccal(fc, TRUE1);
5479 did_free = TRUE1;
5480 did_free_funccal = TRUE1;
5481 } else
5482 pfc = &(*pfc)->caller;
5483 }
5484 if (did_free_funccal)
5485 /* When a funccal was freed some more items might be garbage
5486 * collected, so run again. */
5487 (void)garbage_collect();
5488
5489 return did_free;
5490}
5491
5492/*
5493 * Free lists and dictionaries that are no longer referenced.
5494 */
5495static int free_unref_items(int copyID)
5496{
5497 dict_T *dd;
5498 list_T *ll;
5499 int did_free = FALSE0;
5500
5501 /*
5502 * Go through the list of dicts and free items without the copyID.
5503 */
5504 for (dd = first_dict; dd != NULL((void*)0); )
5505 if ((dd->dv_copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1)) != (copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1))) {
5506 /* Free the Dictionary and ordinary items it contains, but don't
5507 * recurse into Lists and Dictionaries, they will be in the list
5508 * of dicts or list of lists. */
5509 dict_free(dd, FALSE0);
5510 did_free = TRUE1;
5511
5512 /* restart, next dict may also have been freed */
5513 dd = first_dict;
5514 } else
5515 dd = dd->dv_used_next;
5516
5517 /*
5518 * Go through the list of lists and free items without the copyID.
5519 * But don't free a list that has a watcher (used in a for loop), these
5520 * are not referenced anywhere.
5521 */
5522 for (ll = first_list; ll != NULL((void*)0); )
5523 if ((ll->lv_copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1)) != (copyID & COPYID_MASK(~0x1))
5524 && ll->lv_watch == NULL((void*)0)) {
5525 /* Free the List and ordinary items it contains, but don't recurse
5526 * into Lists and Dictionaries, they will be in the list of dicts
5527 * or list of lists. */
5528 list_free(ll, FALSE0);
5529 did_free = TRUE1;
5530
5531 /* restart, next list may also have been freed */
5532 ll = first_list;
5533 } else
5534 ll = ll->lv_used_next;
5535
5536 return did_free;
5537}
5538
5539/*
5540 * Mark all lists and dicts referenced through hashtab "ht" with "copyID".
5541 */
5542void set_ref_in_ht(hashtab_T *ht, int copyID)
5543{
5544 int todo;
5545 hashitem_T *hi;
5546
5547 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
5548 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi)
5549 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
5550 --todo;
5551 set_ref_in_item(&HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)))->di_tv, copyID);
5552 }
5553}
5554
5555/*
5556 * Mark all lists and dicts referenced through list "l" with "copyID".
5557 */
5558void set_ref_in_list(list_T *l, int copyID)
5559{
5560 listitem_T *li;
5561
5562 for (li = l->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next)
5563 set_ref_in_item(&li->li_tv, copyID);
5564}
5565
5566/*
5567 * Mark all lists and dicts referenced through typval "tv" with "copyID".
5568 */
5569void set_ref_in_item(typval_T *tv, int copyID)
5570{
5571 dict_T *dd;
5572 list_T *ll;
5573
5574 switch (tv->v_type) {
5575 case VAR_DICT5:
5576 dd = tv->vval.v_dict;
5577 if (dd != NULL((void*)0) && dd->dv_copyID != copyID) {
5578 /* Didn't see this dict yet. */
5579 dd->dv_copyID = copyID;
5580 set_ref_in_ht(&dd->dv_hashtab, copyID);
5581 }
5582 break;
5583
5584 case VAR_LIST4:
5585 ll = tv->vval.v_list;
5586 if (ll != NULL((void*)0) && ll->lv_copyID != copyID) {
5587 /* Didn't see this list yet. */
5588 ll->lv_copyID = copyID;
5589 set_ref_in_list(ll, copyID);
5590 }
5591 break;
5592 }
5593 return;
5594}
5595
5596/*
5597 * Allocate an empty header for a dictionary.
5598 */
5599dict_T *dict_alloc(void) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
5600{
5601 dict_T *d = xmalloc(sizeof(dict_T));
5602
5603 /* Add the dict to the list of dicts for garbage collection. */
5604 if (first_dict != NULL((void*)0))
5605 first_dict->dv_used_prev = d;
5606 d->dv_used_next = first_dict;
5607 d->dv_used_prev = NULL((void*)0);
5608 first_dict = d;
5609
5610 hash_init(&d->dv_hashtab);
5611 d->dv_lock = 0;
5612 d->dv_scope = 0;
5613 d->dv_refcount = 0;
5614 d->dv_copyID = 0;
5615
5616 return d;
5617}
5618
5619/*
5620 * Allocate an empty dict for a return value.
5621 */
5622static void rettv_dict_alloc(typval_T *rettv)
5623{
5624 dict_T *d = dict_alloc();
5625
5626 rettv->vval.v_dict = d;
5627 rettv->v_type = VAR_DICT5;
5628 ++d->dv_refcount;
5629}
5630
5631
5632/*
5633 * Unreference a Dictionary: decrement the reference count and free it when it
5634 * becomes zero.
5635 */
5636void dict_unref(dict_T *d)
5637{
5638 if (d != NULL((void*)0) && --d->dv_refcount <= 0)
5639 dict_free(d, TRUE1);
5640}
5641
5642/*
