5643 * Free a Dictionary, including all items it contains.
5644 * Ignores the reference count.
5645 */
5646void
5647dict_free (
5648 dict_T *d,
5649 int recurse /* Free Lists and Dictionaries recursively. */
5650)
5651{
5652 int todo;
5653 hashitem_T *hi;
5654 dictitem_T *di;
5655
5656 /* Remove the dict from the list of dicts for garbage collection. */
5657 if (d->dv_used_prev == NULL((void*)0))
5658 first_dict = d->dv_used_next;
5659 else
5660 d->dv_used_prev->dv_used_next = d->dv_used_next;
5661 if (d->dv_used_next != NULL((void*)0))
5662 d->dv_used_next->dv_used_prev = d->dv_used_prev;
5663
5664 /* Lock the hashtab, we don't want it to resize while freeing items. */
5665 hash_lock(&d->dv_hashtab);
5666 todo = (int)d->dv_hashtab.ht_used;
5667 for (hi = d->dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
5668 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
5669 /* Remove the item before deleting it, just in case there is
5670 * something recursive causing trouble. */
5671 di = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
5672 hash_remove(&d->dv_hashtab, hi);
5673 if (recurse || (di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_LIST4
5674 && di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_DICT5))
5675 clear_tv(&di->di_tv);
5676 free(di);
5677 --todo;
5678 }
5679 }
5680 hash_clear(&d->dv_hashtab);
5681 free(d);
5682}
5683
5684/*
5685 * Allocate a Dictionary item.
5686 * The "key" is copied to the new item.
5687 * Note that the value of the item "di_tv" still needs to be initialized!
5688 */
5689dictitem_T *dictitem_alloc(char_u *key) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
5690{
5691 dictitem_T *di = xmalloc(sizeof(dictitem_T) + STRLEN(key)strlen((char *)(key)));
5692 STRCPY(di->di_key, key)strcpy((char *)(di->di_key), (char *)(key));
5693 di->di_flags = 0;
5694 return di;
5695}
5696
5697/*
5698 * Make a copy of a Dictionary item.
5699 */
5700static dictitem_T *dictitem_copy(dictitem_T *org) FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_RET
5701{
5702 dictitem_T *di = xmalloc(sizeof(dictitem_T) + STRLEN(org->di_key)strlen((char *)(org->di_key)));
5703
5704 STRCPY(di->di_key, org->di_key)strcpy((char *)(di->di_key), (char *)(org->di_key));
5705 di->di_flags = 0;
5706 copy_tv(&org->di_tv, &di->di_tv);
5707
5708 return di;
5709}
5710
5711/*
5712 * Remove item "item" from Dictionary "dict" and free it.
5713 */
5714static void dictitem_remove(dict_T *dict, dictitem_T *item)
5715{
5716 hashitem_T *hi;
5717
5718 hi = hash_find(&dict->dv_hashtab, item->di_key);
5719 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
5720 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "dictitem_remove()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("dictitem_remove()"
));
5721 else
5722 hash_remove(&dict->dv_hashtab, hi);
5723 dictitem_free(item);
5724}
5725
5726/*
5727 * Free a dict item. Also clears the value.
5728 */
5729void dictitem_free(dictitem_T *item)
5730{
5731 clear_tv(&item->di_tv);
5732 free(item);
5733}
5734
5735/*
5736 * Make a copy of dict "d". Shallow if "deep" is FALSE.
5737 * The refcount of the new dict is set to 1.
5738 * See item_copy() for "copyID".
5739 * Returns NULL if orig is NULL or some other failure.
5740 */
5741static dict_T *dict_copy(dict_T *orig, int deep, int copyID)
5742{
5743 dictitem_T *di;
5744 int todo;
5745 hashitem_T *hi;
5746
5747 if (orig == NULL((void*)0))
5748 return NULL((void*)0);
5749
5750 dict_T *copy = dict_alloc();
5751 {
5752 if (copyID != 0) {
5753 orig->dv_copyID = copyID;
5754 orig->dv_copydict = copy;
5755 }
5756 todo = (int)orig->dv_hashtab.ht_used;
5757 for (hi = orig->dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
5758 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
5759 --todo;
5760
5761 di = dictitem_alloc(hi->hi_key);
5762 if (deep) {
5763 if (item_copy(&HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)))->di_tv, &di->di_tv, deep,
5764 copyID) == FAIL0) {
5765 free(di);
5766 break;
5767 }
5768 } else
5769 copy_tv(&HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)))->di_tv, &di->di_tv);
5770 if (dict_add(copy, di) == FAIL0) {
5771 dictitem_free(di);
5772 break;
5773 }
5774 }
5775 }
5776
5777 ++copy->dv_refcount;
5778 if (todo > 0) {
5779 dict_unref(copy);
5780 copy = NULL((void*)0);
5781 }
5782 }
5783
5784 return copy;
5785}
5786
5787/*
5788 * Add item "item" to Dictionary "d".
5789 * Returns FAIL when key already exists.
5790 */
5791int dict_add(dict_T *d, dictitem_T *item)
5792{
5793 return hash_add(&d->dv_hashtab, item->di_key);
5794}
5795
5796/*
5797 * Add a number or string entry to dictionary "d".
5798 * When "str" is NULL use number "nr", otherwise use "str".
5799 * Returns FAIL when key already exists.
5800 */
5801int dict_add_nr_str(dict_T *d, char *key, long nr, char_u *str)
5802{
5803 dictitem_T *item;
5804
5805 item = dictitem_alloc((char_u *)key);
5806 item->di_tv.v_lock = 0;
5807 if (str == NULL((void*)0)) {
5808 item->di_tv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
5809 item->di_tv.vval.v_number = nr;
5810 } else {
5811 item->di_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
5812 item->di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(str);
5813 }
5814 if (dict_add(d, item) == FAIL0) {
5815 dictitem_free(item);
5816 return FAIL0;
5817 }
5818 return OK1;
5819}
5820
5821/*
5822 * Add a list entry to dictionary "d".
5823 * Returns FAIL when key already exists.
5824 */
5825int dict_add_list(dict_T *d, char *key, list_T *list)
5826{
5827 dictitem_T *item = dictitem_alloc((char_u *)key);
5828
5829 item->di_tv.v_lock = 0;
5830 item->di_tv.v_type = VAR_LIST4;
5831 item->di_tv.vval.v_list = list;
5832 if (dict_add(d, item) == FAIL0) {
5833 dictitem_free(item);
5834 return FAIL0;
5835 }
5836 ++list->lv_refcount;
5837 return OK1;
5838}
5839
5840/*
5841 * Get the number of items in a Dictionary.
5842 */
5843static long dict_len(dict_T *d)
5844{
5845 if (d == NULL((void*)0))
5846 return 0L;
5847 return (long)d->dv_hashtab.ht_used;
5848}
5849
5850/*
5851 * Find item "key[len]" in Dictionary "d".
5852 * If "len" is negative use strlen(key).
5853 * Returns NULL when not found.
5854 */
5855dictitem_T *dict_find(dict_T *d, char_u *key, int len)
5856{
5857#define AKEYLEN200 200
5858 char_u buf[AKEYLEN200];
5859 char_u *akey;
5860 char_u *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
5861 hashitem_T *hi;
5862
5863 if (len < 0)
5864 akey = key;
5865 else if (len >= AKEYLEN200) {
5866 tofree = akey = vim_strnsave(key, len);
5867 } else {
5868 /* Avoid a malloc/free by using buf[]. */
5869 STRLCPY(buf, key, len + 1)xstrlcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(key), (size_t)(len + 1));
5870 akey = buf;
5871 }
5872
5873 hi = hash_find(&d->dv_hashtab, akey);
5874 free(tofree);
5875 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
5876 return NULL((void*)0);
5877 return HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
5878}
5879
5880/*
5881 * Get a string item from a dictionary.
5882 * When "save" is TRUE allocate memory for it.
5883 * Returns NULL if the entry doesn't exist.
5884 */
5885char_u *get_dict_string(dict_T *d, char_u *key, int save)
5886{
5887 dictitem_T *di;
5888 char_u *s;
5889
5890 di = dict_find(d, key, -1);
5891 if (di == NULL((void*)0))
5892 return NULL((void*)0);
5893 s = get_tv_string(&di->di_tv);
5894 if (save) {
5895 s = vim_strsave(s);
5896 }
5897 return s;
5898}
5899
5900/*
5901 * Get a number item from a dictionary.
5902 * Returns 0 if the entry doesn't exist.
5903 */
5904long get_dict_number(dict_T *d, char_u *key)
5905{
5906 dictitem_T *di = dict_find(d, key, -1);
5907 if (di == NULL((void*)0))
5908 return 0;
5909 return get_tv_number(&di->di_tv);
5910}
5911
5912/*
5913 * Return an allocated string with the string representation of a Dictionary.
5914 * May return NULL.
5915 */
5916static char_u *dict2string(typval_T *tv, int copyID)
5917{
5918 garray_T ga;
5919 int first = TRUE1;
5920 char_u *tofree;
5921 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
5922 hashitem_T *hi;
5923 char_u *s;
5924 dict_T *d;
5925 int todo;
5926
5927 if ((d = tv->vval.v_dict) == NULL((void*)0))
5928 return NULL((void*)0);
5929 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char), 80);
5930 ga_append(&ga, '{');
5931
5932 todo = (int)d->dv_hashtab.ht_used;
5933 for (hi = d->dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
5934 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
5935 --todo;
5936
5937 if (first)
5938 first = FALSE0;
5939 else
5940 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)", ");
5941
5942 tofree = string_quote(hi->hi_key, FALSE0);
5943 if (tofree != NULL((void*)0)) {
5944 ga_concat(&ga, tofree);
5945 free(tofree);
5946 }
5947 ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)": ");
5948 s = tv2string(&HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)))->di_tv, &tofree, numbuf, copyID);
5949 if (s != NULL((void*)0))
5950 ga_concat(&ga, s);
5951 free(tofree);
5952 if (s == NULL((void*)0) || did_echo_string_emsg) {
5953 break;
5954 }
5955 line_breakcheck();
5956 }
5957 }
5958 if (todo > 0) {
5959 free(ga.ga_data);
5960 return NULL((void*)0);
5961 }
5962
5963 ga_append(&ga, '}');
5964 ga_append(&ga, NUL'\000');
5965 return (char_u *)ga.ga_data;
5966}
5967
5968/*
5969 * Allocate a variable for a Dictionary and fill it from "*arg".
5970 * Return OK or FAIL. Returns NOTDONE for {expr}.
5971 */
5972static int get_dict_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
5973{
5974 dict_T *d = NULL((void*)0);
5975 typval_T tvkey;
5976 typval_T tv;
5977 char_u *key = NULL((void*)0);
5978 dictitem_T *item;
5979 char_u *start = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
5980 char_u buf[NUMBUFLEN30];
5981
5982 /*
5983 * First check if it's not a curly-braces thing: {expr}.
5984 * Must do this without evaluating, otherwise a function may be called
5985 * twice. Unfortunately this means we need to call eval1() twice for the
5986 * first item.
5987 * But {} is an empty Dictionary.
5988 */
5989 if (*start != '}') {
5990 if (eval1(&start, &tv, FALSE0) == FAIL0) /* recursive! */
5991 return FAIL0;
5992 if (*start == '}')
5993 return NOTDONE2;
5994 }
5995
5996 if (evaluate) {
5997 d = dict_alloc();
5998 }
5999 tvkey.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
6000 tv.v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
6001
6002 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
6003 while (**arg != '}' && **arg != NUL'\000') {
6004 if (eval1(arg, &tvkey, evaluate) == FAIL0) /* recursive! */
6005 goto failret;
6006 if (**arg != ':') {
6007 EMSG2(_("E720: Missing colon in Dictionary: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E720: Missing colon in Dictionary: %s"
))), (char_u *)(*arg));
6008 clear_tv(&tvkey);
6009 goto failret;
6010 }
6011 if (evaluate) {
6012 key = get_tv_string_buf_chk(&tvkey, buf);
6013 if (key == NULL((void*)0) || *key == NUL'\000') {
6014 /* "key" is NULL when get_tv_string_buf_chk() gave an errmsg */
6015 if (key != NULL((void*)0))
6016 EMSG(_(e_emptykey))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_emptykey))));
6017 clear_tv(&tvkey);
6018 goto failret;
6019 }
6020 }
6021
6022 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
6023 if (eval1(arg, &tv, evaluate) == FAIL0) { /* recursive! */
6024 if (evaluate)
6025 clear_tv(&tvkey);
6026 goto failret;
6027 }
6028 if (evaluate) {
6029 item = dict_find(d, key, -1);
6030 if (item != NULL((void*)0)) {
6031 EMSG2(_("E721: Duplicate key in Dictionary: \"%s\""), key)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E721: Duplicate key in Dictionary: \"%s\""
))), (char_u *)(key));
6032 clear_tv(&tvkey);
6033 clear_tv(&tv);
6034 goto failret;
6035 }
6036 item = dictitem_alloc(key);
6037 clear_tv(&tvkey);
6038 item->di_tv = tv;
6039 item->di_tv.v_lock = 0;
6040 if (dict_add(d, item) == FAIL0) {
6041 dictitem_free(item);
6042 }
6043 }
6044
6045 if (**arg == '}')
6046 break;
6047 if (**arg != ',') {
6048 EMSG2(_("E722: Missing comma in Dictionary: %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E722: Missing comma in Dictionary: %s"
))), (char_u *)(*arg));
6049 goto failret;
6050 }
6051 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
6052 }
6053
6054 if (**arg != '}') {
6055 EMSG2(_("E723: Missing end of Dictionary '}': %s"), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E723: Missing end of Dictionary '}': %s"
))), (char_u *)(*arg));
6056failret:
6057 if (evaluate)
6058 dict_free(d, TRUE1);
6059 return FAIL0;
6060 }
6061
6062 *arg = skipwhite(*arg + 1);
6063 if (evaluate) {
6064 rettv->v_type = VAR_DICT5;
6065 rettv->vval.v_dict = d;
6066 ++d->dv_refcount;
6067 }
6068
6069 return OK1;
6070}
6071
6072/*
6073 * Return a string with the string representation of a variable.
6074 * If the memory is allocated "tofree" is set to it, otherwise NULL.
6075 * "numbuf" is used for a number.
6076 * Does not put quotes around strings, as ":echo" displays values.
6077 * When "copyID" is not NULL replace recursive lists and dicts with "...".
6078 * May return NULL.
6079 */
6080static char_u *echo_string(typval_T *tv, char_u **tofree, char_u *numbuf, int copyID)
6081{
6082 static int recurse = 0;
6083 char_u *r = NULL((void*)0);
6084
6085 if (recurse >= DICT_MAXNEST100) {
6086 if (!did_echo_string_emsg) {
6087 // Only give this message once for a recursive call to avoid
6088 // flooding the user with errors. And stop iterating over lists
6089 // and dicts.
6090 did_echo_string_emsg = true1;
6091 EMSG(_("E724: variable nested too deep for displaying"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E724: variable nested too deep for displaying"
))));
6092 }
6093 *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
6094 return (char_u *)"{E724}";
6095 }
6096 ++recurse;
6097
6098 switch (tv->v_type) {
6099 case VAR_FUNC3:
6100 *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
6101 r = tv->vval.v_string;
6102 break;
6103
6104 case VAR_LIST4:
6105 if (tv->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0)) {
6106 *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
6107 r = NULL((void*)0);
6108 } else if (copyID != 0 && tv->vval.v_list->lv_copyID == copyID) {
6109 *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
6110 r = (char_u *)"[...]";
6111 } else {
6112 tv->vval.v_list->lv_copyID = copyID;
6113 *tofree = list2string(tv, copyID);
6114 r = *tofree;
6115 }
6116 break;
6117
6118 case VAR_DICT5:
6119 if (tv->vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0)) {
6120 *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
6121 r = NULL((void*)0);
6122 } else if (copyID != 0 && tv->vval.v_dict->dv_copyID == copyID) {
6123 *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
6124 r = (char_u *)"{...}";
6125 } else {
6126 tv->vval.v_dict->dv_copyID = copyID;
6127 *tofree = dict2string(tv, copyID);
6128 r = *tofree;
6129 }
6130 break;
6131
6132 case VAR_STRING2:
6133 case VAR_NUMBER1:
6134 *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
6135 r = get_tv_string_buf(tv, numbuf);
6136 break;
6137
6138 case VAR_FLOAT6:
6139 *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
6140 vim_snprintf((char *)numbuf, NUMBUFLEN30, "%g", tv->vval.v_float);
6141 r = numbuf;
6142 break;
6143
6144 default:
6145 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "echo_string()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("echo_string()"
));
6146 *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
6147 }
6148
6149 if (--recurse == 0) {
6150 did_echo_string_emsg = false0;
6151 }
6152 return r;
6153}
6154
6155/*
6156 * Return a string with the string representation of a variable.
6157 * If the memory is allocated "tofree" is set to it, otherwise NULL.
6158 * "numbuf" is used for a number.
6159 * Puts quotes around strings, so that they can be parsed back by eval().
6160 * May return NULL.
6161 */
6162static char_u *tv2string(typval_T *tv, char_u **tofree, char_u *numbuf, int copyID)
6163{
6164 switch (tv->v_type) {
6165 case VAR_FUNC3:
6166 *tofree = string_quote(tv->vval.v_string, TRUE1);
6167 return *tofree;
6168 case VAR_STRING2:
6169 *tofree = string_quote(tv->vval.v_string, FALSE0);
6170 return *tofree;
6171 case VAR_FLOAT6:
6172 *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
6173 vim_snprintf((char *)numbuf, NUMBUFLEN30 - 1, "%g", tv->vval.v_float);
6174 return numbuf;
6175 case VAR_NUMBER1:
6176 case VAR_LIST4:
6177 case VAR_DICT5:
6178 break;
6179 default:
6180 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "tv2string()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("tv2string()"
));
6181 }
6182 return echo_string(tv, tofree, numbuf, copyID);
6183}
6184
6185/*
6186 * Return string "str" in ' quotes, doubling ' characters.
6187 * If "str" is NULL an empty string is assumed.
6188 * If "function" is TRUE make it function('string').
6189 */
6190static char_u *string_quote(char_u *str, int function)
6191{
6192 char_u *p, *r, *s;
6193
6194 size_t len = (function ? 13 : 3);
6195 if (str != NULL((void*)0)) {
6196 len += STRLEN(str)strlen((char *)(str));
6197 for (p = str; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
6198 if (*p == '\'')
6199 ++len;
6200 }
6201 s = r = xmalloc(len);
6202
6203 if (function) {
6204 STRCPY(r, "function('")strcpy((char *)(r), (char *)("function('"));
6205 r += 10;
6206 } else
6207 *r++ = '\'';
6208 if (str != NULL((void*)0))
6209 for (p = str; *p != NUL'\000'; ) {
6210 if (*p == '\'')
6211 *r++ = '\'';
6212 MB_COPY_CHAR(p, r)if (has_mbyte) mb_copy_char(&p, &r); else *r++ = *p++;
6213 }
6214 *r++ = '\'';
6215 if (function)
6216 *r++ = ')';
6217 *r++ = NUL'\000';
6218
6219 return s;
6220}
6221
6222/*
6223 * Convert the string "text" to a floating point number.
6224 * This uses strtod(). setlocale(LC_NUMERIC, "C") has been used to make sure
6225 * this always uses a decimal point.
6226 * Returns the length of the text that was consumed.
6227 */
6228static int
6229string2float (
6230 char_u *text,
6231 float_T *value /* result stored here */
6232)
6233{
6234 char *s = (char *)text;
6235 float_T f;
6236
6237 f = strtod(s, &s);
6238 *value = f;
6239 return (int)((char_u *)s - text);
6240}
6241
6242/// Get the value of an environment variable.
6243///
6244/// If the environment variable was not set, silently assume it is empty.
6245///
6246/// @param arg Points to the '$'. It is advanced to after the name.
6247/// @return FAIL if the name is invalid.
6248///
6249static int get_env_tv(char_u **arg, typval_T *rettv, int evaluate)
6250{
6251 char_u *name;
6252 char_u *string = NULL((void*)0);
6253 int mustfree = FALSE0;
6254 int len;
6255 int cc;
6256
6257 ++*arg;
6258 name = *arg;
6259 len = get_env_len(arg);
6260
6261 if (evaluate) {
6262 if (len == 0) {
6263 return FAIL0; // Can't be an environment variable.
6264 }
6265 cc = name[len];
6266 name[len] = NUL'\000';
6267 // First try vim_getenv(), fast for normal environment vars.
6268 string = vim_getenv(name, &mustfree);
6269 if (string != NULL((void*)0) && *string != NUL'\000') {
6270 if (!mustfree) {
6271 string = vim_strsave(string);
6272 }
6273 } else {
6274 if (mustfree) {
6275 free(string);
6276 }
6277
6278 // Next try expanding things like $VIM and ${HOME}.
6279 string = expand_env_save(name - 1);
6280 if (string != NULL((void*)0) && *string == '$') {
6281 free(string);
6282 string = NULL((void*)0);
6283 }
6284 }
6285 name[len] = cc;
6286 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
6287 rettv->vval.v_string = string;
6288 }
6289
6290 return OK1;
6291}
6292
6293/*
6294 * Array with names and number of arguments of all internal functions
6295 * MUST BE KEPT SORTED IN strcmp() ORDER FOR BINARY SEARCH!
6296 */
6297static struct fst {
6298 char *f_name; /* function name */
6299 char f_min_argc; /* minimal number of arguments */
6300 char f_max_argc; /* maximal number of arguments */
6301 void (*f_func)(typval_T *args, typval_T *rvar);
6302 /* implementation of function */
