14491/*
14492 * "test(list)" function: Just checking the walls...
14493 */
14494static void f_test(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14495{
14496 /* Used for unit testing. Change the code below to your liking. */
14497}
14498
14499/*
14500 * "tan()" function
14501 */
14502static void f_tan(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14503{
14504 float_T f;
14505
14506 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
14507 if (get_float_arg(argvars, &f) == OK1)
14508 rettv->vval.v_float = tan(f);
14509 else
14510 rettv->vval.v_float = 0.0;
14511}
14512
14513/*
14514 * "tanh()" function
14515 */
14516static void f_tanh(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14517{
14518 float_T f;
14519
14520 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
14521 if (get_float_arg(argvars, &f) == OK1)
14522 rettv->vval.v_float = tanh(f);
14523 else
14524 rettv->vval.v_float = 0.0;
14525}
14526
14527/*
14528 * "tolower(string)" function
14529 */
14530static void f_tolower(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14531{
14532 char_u *p = vim_strsave(get_tv_string(&argvars[0]));
14533 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
14534 rettv->vval.v_string = p;
14535
14536 while (*p != NUL'\000') {
14537 int l;
14538
14539 if (enc_utf8) {
14540 int c, lc;
14541
14542 c = utf_ptr2char(p);
14543 lc = utf_tolower(c);
14544 l = utf_ptr2len(p);
14545 /* TODO: reallocate string when byte count changes. */
14546 if (utf_char2len(lc) == l)
14547 utf_char2bytes(lc, p);
14548 p += l;
14549 } else if (has_mbyte && (l = (*mb_ptr2len)(p)) > 1)
14550 p += l; /* skip multi-byte character */
14551 else {
14552 *p = TOLOWER_LOCtolower(*p); /* note that tolower() can be a macro */
14553 ++p;
14554 }
14555 }
14556}
14557
14558/*
14559 * "toupper(string)" function
14560 */
14561static void f_toupper(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14562{
14563 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
14564 rettv->vval.v_string = strup_save(get_tv_string(&argvars[0]));
14565}
14566
14567/*
14568 * "tr(string, fromstr, tostr)" function
14569 */
14570static void f_tr(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14571{
14572 char_u *in_str;
14573 char_u *fromstr;
14574 char_u *tostr;
14575 char_u *p;
14576 int inlen;
14577 int fromlen;
14578 int tolen;
14579 int idx;
14580 char_u *cpstr;
14581 int cplen;
14582 int first = TRUE1;
14583 char_u buf[NUMBUFLEN30];
14584 char_u buf2[NUMBUFLEN30];
14585 garray_T ga;
14586
14587 in_str = get_tv_string(&argvars[0]);
14588 fromstr = get_tv_string_buf_chk(&argvars[1], buf);
14589 tostr = get_tv_string_buf_chk(&argvars[2], buf2);
14590
14591 /* Default return value: empty string. */
14592 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
14593 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
14594 if (fromstr == NULL((void*)0) || tostr == NULL((void*)0))
14595 return; /* type error; errmsg already given */
14596 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char), 80);
14597
14598 if (!has_mbyte)
14599 /* not multi-byte: fromstr and tostr must be the same length */
14600 if (STRLEN(fromstr)strlen((char *)(fromstr)) != STRLEN(tostr)strlen((char *)(tostr))) {
14601error:
14602 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), fromstr)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(fromstr
));
14603 ga_clear(&ga);
14604 return;
14605 }
14606
14607 /* fromstr and tostr have to contain the same number of chars */
14608 while (*in_str != NUL'\000') {
14609 if (has_mbyte) {
14610 inlen = (*mb_ptr2len)(in_str);
14611 cpstr = in_str;
14612 cplen = inlen;
14613 idx = 0;
14614 for (p = fromstr; *p != NUL'\000'; p += fromlen) {
14615 fromlen = (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
14616 if (fromlen == inlen && STRNCMP(in_str, p, inlen)strncmp((char *)(in_str), (char *)(p), (size_t)(inlen)) == 0) {
14617 for (p = tostr; *p != NUL'\000'; p += tolen) {
14618 tolen = (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
14619 if (idx-- == 0) {
14620 cplen = tolen;
14621 cpstr = p;
14622 break;
14623 }
14624 }
14625 if (*p == NUL'\000') /* tostr is shorter than fromstr */
14626 goto error;
14627 break;
14628 }
14629 ++idx;
14630 }
14631
14632 if (first && cpstr == in_str) {
14633 /* Check that fromstr and tostr have the same number of
14634 * (multi-byte) characters. Done only once when a character
14635 * of in_str doesn't appear in fromstr. */
14636 first = FALSE0;
14637 for (p = tostr; *p != NUL'\000'; p += tolen) {
14638 tolen = (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
14639 --idx;
14640 }
14641 if (idx != 0)
14642 goto error;
14643 }
14644
14645 ga_grow(&ga, cplen);
14646 memmove((char *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len, cpstr, (size_t)cplen);
14647 ga.ga_len += cplen;
14648
14649 in_str += inlen;
14650 } else {
14651 /* When not using multi-byte chars we can do it faster. */
14652 p = vim_strchr(fromstr, *in_str);
14653 if (p != NULL((void*)0))
14654 ga_append(&ga, tostr[p - fromstr]);
14655 else
14656 ga_append(&ga, *in_str);
14657 ++in_str;
14658 }
14659 }
14660
14661 // add a terminating NUL
14662 ga_append(&ga, NUL'\000');
14663
14664 rettv->vval.v_string = ga.ga_data;
14665}
14666
14667/*
14668 * "trunc({float})" function
14669 */
14670static void f_trunc(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14671{
14672 float_T f;
14673
14674 rettv->v_type = VAR_FLOAT6;
14675 if (get_float_arg(argvars, &f) == OK1)
14676 /* trunc() is not in C90, use floor() or ceil() instead. */
14677 rettv->vval.v_float = f > 0 ? floor(f) : ceil(f);
14678 else
14679 rettv->vval.v_float = 0.0;
14680}
14681
14682/*
14683 * "type(expr)" function
14684 */
14685static void f_type(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14686{
14687 int n;
14688
14689 switch (argvars[0].v_type) {
14690 case VAR_NUMBER1: n = 0; break;
14691 case VAR_STRING2: n = 1; break;
14692 case VAR_FUNC3: n = 2; break;
14693 case VAR_LIST4: n = 3; break;
14694 case VAR_DICT5: n = 4; break;
14695 case VAR_FLOAT6: n = 5; break;
14696 default: EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "f_type()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("f_type()"
)); n = 0; break;
14697 }
14698 rettv->vval.v_number = n;
14699}
14700
14701/*
14702 * "undofile(name)" function
14703 */
14704static void f_undofile(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14705{
14706 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
14707 {
14708 char_u *fname = get_tv_string(&argvars[0]);
14709
14710 if (*fname == NUL'\000') {
14711 /* If there is no file name there will be no undo file. */
14712 rettv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
14713 } else {
14714 char_u *ffname = FullName_save(fname, FALSE0);
14715
14716 if (ffname != NULL((void*)0))
14717 rettv->vval.v_string = u_get_undo_file_name(ffname, FALSE0);
14718 free(ffname);
14719 }
14720 }
14721}
14722
14723/*
14724 * "undotree()" function
14725 */
14726static void f_undotree(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14727{
14728 rettv_dict_alloc(rettv);
14729
14730 dict_T *dict = rettv->vval.v_dict;
14731 list_T *list;
14732
14733 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "synced", (long)curbuf->b_u_synced, NULL((void*)0));
14734 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "seq_last", curbuf->b_u_seq_last, NULL((void*)0));
14735 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "save_last",
14736 (long)curbuf->b_u_save_nr_last, NULL((void*)0));
14737 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "seq_cur", curbuf->b_u_seq_cur, NULL((void*)0));
14738 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "time_cur", (long)curbuf->b_u_time_cur, NULL((void*)0));
14739 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "save_cur", (long)curbuf->b_u_save_nr_cur, NULL((void*)0));
14740
14741 list = list_alloc();
14742 u_eval_tree(curbuf->b_u_oldhead, list);
14743 dict_add_list(dict, "entries", list);
14744}
14745
14746/*
14747 * "values(dict)" function
14748 */
14749static void f_values(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14750{
14751 dict_list(argvars, rettv, 1);
14752}

14754/*
14755 * "virtcol(string)" function
14756 */
14757static void f_virtcol(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14758{
14759 colnr_T vcol = 0;
14760 pos_T *fp;
14761 int fnum = curbuf->b_fnum;
14762
14763 fp = var2fpos(&argvars[0], FALSE0, &fnum);
14764 if (fp != NULL((void*)0) && fp->lnum <= curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count
14765 && fnum == curbuf->b_fnum) {
14766 getvvcol(curwin, fp, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), &vcol);
14767 ++vcol;
14768 }
14769
14770 rettv->vval.v_number = vcol;
14771}
14772
14773/*
14774 * "visualmode()" function
14775 */
14776static void f_visualmode(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14777{
14778 char_u str[2];
14779
14780 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
14781 str[0] = curbuf->b_visual_mode_eval;
14782 str[1] = NUL'\000';
14783 rettv->vval.v_string = vim_strsave(str);
14784
14785 /* A non-zero number or non-empty string argument: reset mode. */
14786 if (non_zero_arg(&argvars[0]))
14787 curbuf->b_visual_mode_eval = NUL'\000';
14788}

14807 if (wp == NULL((void*)0))
14808 rettv->vval.v_number = -1;
14809 else
14810 rettv->vval.v_number = wp->w_buffer->b_fnum;
14811}

14844
14845/*
14846 * "winnr()" function
14847 */
14848static void f_winnr(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14849{
14850 int nr = 1;
14851
14852 nr = get_winnr(curtab, &argvars[0]);
14853 rettv->vval.v_number = nr;
14854}
14855
14856/*
14857 * "winrestcmd()" function
14858 */
14859static void f_winrestcmd(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14860{
14861 int winnr = 1;
14862 garray_T ga;
14863 char_u buf[50];
14864
14865 ga_init(&ga, (int)sizeof(char), 70);
14866 FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)for (win_T *wp = firstwin; wp != ((void*)0); wp = wp->w_next
) {
14867 sprintf((char *)buf, "%dresize %d|", winnr, wp->w_height);
14868 ga_concat(&ga, buf);
14869 sprintf((char *)buf, "vert %dresize %d|", winnr, wp->w_width);
14870 ga_concat(&ga, buf);
14871 ++winnr;
14872 }
14873 ga_append(&ga, NUL'\000');
14874
14875 rettv->vval.v_string = ga.ga_data;
14876 rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING2;
14877}
14878
14879/*
14880 * "winrestview()" function
14881 */
14882static void f_winrestview(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14883{
14884 dict_T *dict;
14885
14886 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_DICT5
14887 || (dict = argvars[0].vval.v_dict) == NULL((void*)0))
14888 EMSG(_(e_invarg))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg))));
14889 else {
14890 curwin->w_cursor.lnum = get_dict_number(dict, (char_u *)"lnum");
14891 curwin->w_cursor.col = get_dict_number(dict, (char_u *)"col");
14892 curwin->w_cursor.coladd = get_dict_number(dict, (char_u *)"coladd");
14893 curwin->w_curswant = get_dict_number(dict, (char_u *)"curswant");
14894 curwin->w_set_curswant = FALSE0;
14895
14896 set_topline(curwin, get_dict_number(dict, (char_u *)"topline"));
14897 curwin->w_topfill = get_dict_number(dict, (char_u *)"topfill");
14898 curwin->w_leftcol = get_dict_number(dict, (char_u *)"leftcol");
14899 curwin->w_skipcol = get_dict_number(dict, (char_u *)"skipcol");
14900
14901 check_cursor();
14902 win_new_height(curwin, curwin->w_height);
14903 win_new_width(curwin, curwin->w_width);
14904 changed_window_setting();
14905
14906 if (curwin->w_topline == 0)
14907 curwin->w_topline = 1;
14908 if (curwin->w_topline > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
14909 curwin->w_topline = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
14910 check_topfill(curwin, true1);
14911 }
14912}
14913
14914/*
14915 * "winsaveview()" function
14916 */
14917static void f_winsaveview(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14918{
14919 dict_T *dict;
14920
14921 rettv_dict_alloc(rettv);
14922 dict = rettv->vval.v_dict;
14923
14924 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "lnum", (long)curwin->w_cursor.lnum, NULL((void*)0));
14925 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "col", (long)curwin->w_cursor.col, NULL((void*)0));
14926 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "coladd", (long)curwin->w_cursor.coladd, NULL((void*)0));
14927 update_curswant();
14928 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "curswant", (long)curwin->w_curswant, NULL((void*)0));
14929
14930 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "topline", (long)curwin->w_topline, NULL((void*)0));
14931 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "topfill", (long)curwin->w_topfill, NULL((void*)0));
14932 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "leftcol", (long)curwin->w_leftcol, NULL((void*)0));
14933 dict_add_nr_str(dict, "skipcol", (long)curwin->w_skipcol, NULL((void*)0));
14934}
14935
14936/*
14937 * "winwidth(nr)" function
14938 */
14939static void f_winwidth(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14940{
14941 win_T *wp;
14942
14943 wp = find_win_by_nr(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0));
14944 if (wp == NULL((void*)0))
14945 rettv->vval.v_number = -1;
14946 else
14947 rettv->vval.v_number = wp->w_width;
14948}
14949
14950/*
14951 * "writefile()" function
14952 */
14953static void f_writefile(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
14954{
14955 int binary = FALSE0;
14956 char_u *fname;
14957 FILE *fd;
14958 listitem_T *li;
14959 char_u *s;
14960 int ret = 0;
14961 int c;
14962
14963 if (check_restricted() || check_secure())
14964 return;
14965
14966 if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_LIST4) {
14967 EMSG2(_(e_listarg), "writefile()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_listarg))), (char_u *)("writefile()"
));
14968 return;
14969 }
14970 if (argvars[0].vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))
14971 return;
14972
14973 if (argvars[2].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN0
14974 && STRCMP(get_tv_string(&argvars[2]), "b")strcmp((char *)(get_tv_string(&argvars[2])), (char *)("b"
)) == 0)
14975 binary = TRUE1;
14976
14977 /* Always open the file in binary mode, library functions have a mind of
14978 * their own about CR-LF conversion. */
14979 fname = get_tv_string(&argvars[1]);
14980 if (*fname == NUL'\000' || (fd = mch_fopen((char *)fname, WRITEBIN)fopen(((char *)fname), ("w"))) == NULL((void*)0)) {
14981 EMSG2(_(e_notcreate), *fname == NUL ? (char_u *)_("<empty>") : fname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_notcreate))), (char_u *)(
*fname == '\000' ? (char_u *)gettext((char *)("<empty>"
)) : fname));
14982 ret = -1;
14983 } else {
14984 for (li = argvars[0].vval.v_list->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0);
14985 li = li->li_next) {
14986 for (s = get_tv_string(&li->li_tv); *s != NUL'\000'; ++s) {
14987 if (*s == '\n')
14988 c = putc(NUL, fd)_IO_putc ('\000', fd);
14989 else
14990 c = putc(*s, fd)_IO_putc (*s, fd);
14991 if (c == EOF(-1)) {
14992 ret = -1;
14993 break;
14994 }
14995 }
14996 if (!binary || li->li_next != NULL((void*)0))
14997 if (putc('\n', fd)_IO_putc ('\n', fd) == EOF(-1)) {
14998 ret = -1;
14999 break;
15000 }
15001 if (ret < 0) {
15002 EMSG(_(e_write))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_write))));
15003 break;
15004 }
15005 }
15006 fclose(fd);
15007 }
15008
15009 rettv->vval.v_number = ret;
15010}
15011
15012/*
15013 * "xor(expr, expr)" function
15014 */
15015static void f_xor(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
15016{
15017 rettv->vval.v_number = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0))
15018 ^ get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[1], NULL((void*)0));
15019}
15020
15021
15022/*
15023 * Translate a String variable into a position.
15024 * Returns NULL when there is an error.
15025 */
15026static pos_T *
15027var2fpos (
15028 typval_T *varp,
15029 int dollar_lnum, /* TRUE when $ is last line */
15030 int *fnum /* set to fnum for '0, 'A, etc. */
15031)
15032{
15033 char_u *name;
15034 static pos_T pos;
15035 pos_T *pp;
15036
15037 /* Argument can be [lnum, col, coladd]. */
15038 if (varp->v_type == VAR_LIST4) {
15039 list_T *l;
15040 int len;
15041 int error = FALSE0;
15042 listitem_T *li;
15043
15044 l = varp->vval.v_list;
15045 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
15046 return NULL((void*)0);
15047
15048 /* Get the line number */
15049 pos.lnum = list_find_nr(l, 0L, &error);
15050 if (error || pos.lnum <= 0 || pos.lnum > curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
15051 return NULL((void*)0); /* invalid line number */
15052
15053 /* Get the column number */
15054 pos.col = list_find_nr(l, 1L, &error);
15055 if (error)
15056 return NULL((void*)0);
15057 len = (long)STRLEN(ml_get(pos.lnum))strlen((char *)(ml_get(pos.lnum)));
15058
15059 /* We accept "$" for the column number: last column. */
15060 li = list_find(l, 1L);
15061 if (li != NULL((void*)0) && li->li_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2
15062 && li->li_tv.vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
15063 && STRCMP(li->li_tv.vval.v_string, "$")strcmp((char *)(li->li_tv.vval.v_string), (char *)("$")) == 0)
15064 pos.col = len + 1;
15065
15066 /* Accept a position up to the NUL after the line. */
15067 if (pos.col == 0 || (int)pos.col > len + 1)
15068 return NULL((void*)0); /* invalid column number */
15069 --pos.col;
15070
15071 /* Get the virtual offset. Defaults to zero. */
15072 pos.coladd = list_find_nr(l, 2L, &error);
15073 if (error)
15074 pos.coladd = 0;
15075
15076 return &pos;
15077 }
15078
15079 name = get_tv_string_chk(varp);
15080 if (name == NULL((void*)0))
15081 return NULL((void*)0);
15082 if (name[0] == '.') /* cursor */
15083 return &curwin->w_cursor;
15084 if (name[0] == 'v' && name[1] == NUL'\000') { /* Visual start */
15085 if (VIsual_active)
15086 return &VIsual;
15087 return &curwin->w_cursor;
15088 }
15089 if (name[0] == '\'') { /* mark */
15090 pp = getmark_buf_fnum(curbuf, name[1], FALSE0, fnum);
15091 if (pp == NULL((void*)0) || pp == (pos_T *)-1 || pp->lnum <= 0)
15092 return NULL((void*)0);
15093 return pp;
15094 }
15095
15096 pos.coladd = 0;
15097
15098 if (name[0] == 'w' && dollar_lnum) {
15099 pos.col = 0;
15100 if (name[1] == '0') { /* "w0": first visible line */
15101 update_topline();
15102 pos.lnum = curwin->w_topline;
15103 return &pos;
15104 } else if (name[1] == '$') { /* "w$": last visible line */
15105 validate_botline();
15106 pos.lnum = curwin->w_botline - 1;
15107 return &pos;
15108 }
15109 } else if (name[0] == '$') { /* last column or line */
15110 if (dollar_lnum) {
15111 pos.lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
15112 pos.col = 0;
15113 } else {
15114 pos.lnum = curwin->w_cursor.lnum;
15115 pos.col = (colnr_T)STRLEN(get_cursor_line_ptr())strlen((char *)(get_cursor_line_ptr()));
15116 }
15117 return &pos;
15118 }
15119 return NULL((void*)0);
15120}
15121
15122/*
15123 * Convert list in "arg" into a position and optional file number.
15124 * When "fnump" is NULL there is no file number, only 3 items.
15125 * Note that the column is passed on as-is, the caller may want to decrement
15126 * it to use 1 for the first column.
15127 * Return FAIL when conversion is not possible, doesn't check the position for
15128 * validity.
15129 */
15130static int list2fpos(typval_T *arg, pos_T *posp, int *fnump)
15131{
15132 list_T *l = arg->vval.v_list;
15133 long i = 0;
15134 long n;
15135
15136 /* List must be: [fnum, lnum, col, coladd], where "fnum" is only there
15137 * when "fnump" isn't NULL and "coladd" is optional. */
15138 if (arg->v_type != VAR_LIST4
15139 || l == NULL((void*)0)
15140 || l->lv_len < (fnump == NULL((void*)0) ? 2 : 3)
15141 || l->lv_len > (fnump == NULL((void*)0) ? 3 : 4))
15142 return FAIL0;
15143
15144 if (fnump != NULL((void*)0)) {
15145 n = list_find_nr(l, i++, NULL((void*)0)); /* fnum */
15146 if (n < 0)
15147 return FAIL0;
15148 if (n == 0)
15149 n = curbuf->b_fnum; /* current buffer */
15150 *fnump = n;
15151 }
15152
15153 n = list_find_nr(l, i++, NULL((void*)0)); /* lnum */
15154 if (n < 0)
15155 return FAIL0;
15156 posp->lnum = n;
15157
15158 n = list_find_nr(l, i++, NULL((void*)0)); /* col */
15159 if (n < 0)
15160 return FAIL0;
15161 posp->col = n;
15162
15163 n = list_find_nr(l, i, NULL((void*)0));
15164 if (n < 0)
15165 posp->coladd = 0;
15166 else
15167 posp->coladd = n;
15168
15169 return OK1;
15170}
15171
15172/*
15173 * Get the length of an environment variable name.
15174 * Advance "arg" to the first character after the name.
15175 * Return 0 for error.
15176 */
15177static int get_env_len(char_u **arg)
15178{
15179 char_u *p;
15180 int len;
15181
15182 for (p = *arg; vim_isIDc(*p); ++p)
15183 ;
15184 if (p == *arg) /* no name found */
15185 return 0;
15186
15187 len = (int)(p - *arg);
15188 *arg = p;
15189 return len;
15190}
15191
15192/*
15193 * Get the length of the name of a function or internal variable.
15194 * "arg" is advanced to the first non-white character after the name.
15195 * Return 0 if something is wrong.
15196 */
15197static int get_id_len(char_u **arg)
15198{
15199 char_u *p;
15200 int len;
15201
15202 /* Find the end of the name. */
15203 for (p = *arg; eval_isnamec(*p); ++p)
15204 ;
15205 if (p == *arg) /* no name found */
15206 return 0;
15207
15208 len = (int)(p - *arg);
15209 *arg = skipwhite(p);
15210
15211 return len;
15212}
15213
15214/*
15215 * Get the length of the name of a variable or function.
15216 * Only the name is recognized, does not handle ".key" or "[idx]".
15217 * "arg" is advanced to the first non-white character after the name.
15218 * Return -1 if curly braces expansion failed.
15219 * Return 0 if something else is wrong.
15220 * If the name contains 'magic' {}'s, expand them and return the
15221 * expanded name in an allocated string via 'alias' - caller must free.
15222 */
15223static int get_name_len(char_u **arg, char_u **alias, int evaluate, int verbose)
15224{
15225 int len;
15226 char_u *p;
15227 char_u *expr_start;
15228 char_u *expr_end;
15229
15230 *alias = NULL((void*)0); /* default to no alias */
15231
15232 if ((*arg)[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80) && (*arg)[1] == KS_EXTRA253
15233 && (*arg)[2] == (int)KE_SNR) {
15234 /* hard coded <SNR>, already translated */
15235 *arg += 3;
15236 return get_id_len(arg) + 3;
15237 }
15238 len = eval_fname_script(*arg);
15239 if (len > 0) {
15240 /* literal "<SID>", "s:" or "<SNR>" */
15241 *arg += len;
15242 }
15243
15244 /*
15245 * Find the end of the name; check for {} construction.
15246 */
15247 p = find_name_end(*arg, &expr_start, &expr_end,
15248 len > 0 ? 0 : FNE_CHECK_START2);
15249 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
15250 char_u *temp_string;
15251
15252 if (!evaluate) {
15253 len += (int)(p - *arg);
15254 *arg = skipwhite(p);
15255 return len;
15256 }
15257
15258 /*
15259 * Include any <SID> etc in the expanded string:
15260 * Thus the -len here.
15261 */
15262 temp_string = make_expanded_name(*arg - len, expr_start, expr_end, p);
15263 if (temp_string == NULL((void*)0))
15264 return -1;
15265 *alias = temp_string;
15266 *arg = skipwhite(p);
15267 return (int)STRLEN(temp_string)strlen((char *)(temp_string));
15268 }
15269
15270 len += get_id_len(arg);
15271 if (len == 0 && verbose)
15272 EMSG2(_(e_invexpr2), *arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2))), (char_u *)(*
arg));
15273
15274 return len;
15275}
15276
15277/*
15278 * Find the end of a variable or function name, taking care of magic braces.
15279 * If "expr_start" is not NULL then "expr_start" and "expr_end" are set to the
15280 * start and end of the first magic braces item.
15281 * "flags" can have FNE_INCL_BR and FNE_CHECK_START.
15282 * Return a pointer to just after the name. Equal to "arg" if there is no
15283 * valid name.
15284 */
15285static char_u *find_name_end(char_u *arg, char_u **expr_start, char_u **expr_end, int flags)
15286{
15287 int mb_nest = 0;
15288 int br_nest = 0;
15289 char_u *p;
15290
15291 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
15292 *expr_start = NULL((void*)0);
15293 *expr_end = NULL((void*)0);
15294 }
15295
15296 /* Quick check for valid starting character. */
15297 if ((flags & FNE_CHECK_START2) && !eval_isnamec1(*arg) && *arg != '{')
15298 return arg;
15299
15300 for (p = arg; *p != NUL'\000'
15301 && (eval_isnamec(*p)
15302 || *p == '{'
15303 || ((flags & FNE_INCL_BR1) && (*p == '[' || *p == '.'))
15304 || mb_nest != 0
15305 || br_nest != 0); mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1) {
15306 if (*p == '\'') {
15307 /* skip over 'string' to avoid counting [ and ] inside it. */
15308 for (p = p + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '\''; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
15309 ;
15310 if (*p == NUL'\000')
15311 break;
15312 } else if (*p == '"') {
15313 /* skip over "str\"ing" to avoid counting [ and ] inside it. */
15314 for (p = p + 1; *p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1)
15315 if (*p == '\\' && p[1] != NUL'\000')
15316 ++p;
15317 if (*p == NUL'\000')
15318 break;
15319 }
15320
15321 if (mb_nest == 0) {
15322 if (*p == '[')
15323 ++br_nest;
15324 else if (*p == ']')
15325 --br_nest;
15326 }
15327
15328 if (br_nest == 0) {
15329 if (*p == '{') {
15330 mb_nest++;
15331 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0) && *expr_start == NULL((void*)0))
15332 *expr_start = p;
15333 } else if (*p == '}') {
15334 mb_nest--;
15335 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0) && mb_nest == 0 && *expr_end == NULL((void*)0))
15336 *expr_end = p;
15337 }
15338 }
15339 }
15340
15341 return p;
15342}
15343
15344/*
15345 * Expands out the 'magic' {}'s in a variable/function name.
15346 * Note that this can call itself recursively, to deal with
15347 * constructs like foo{bar}{baz}{bam}
15348 * The four pointer arguments point to "foo{expre}ss{ion}bar"
15349 * "in_start" ^
15350 * "expr_start" ^
15351 * "expr_end" ^
15352 * "in_end" ^
15353 *
15354 * Returns a new allocated string, which the caller must free.
15355 * Returns NULL for failure.
15356 */
15357static char_u *make_expanded_name(char_u *in_start, char_u *expr_start, char_u *expr_end, char_u *in_end)
15358{
15359 char_u c1;
15360 char_u *retval = NULL((void*)0);
15361 char_u *temp_result;
15362 char_u *nextcmd = NULL((void*)0);
15363
15364 if (expr_end == NULL((void*)0) || in_end == NULL((void*)0))
15365 return NULL((void*)0);
15366 *expr_start = NUL'\000';
15367 *expr_end = NUL'\000';
15368 c1 = *in_end;
15369 *in_end = NUL'\000';
15370
15371 temp_result = eval_to_string(expr_start + 1, &nextcmd, FALSE0);
15372 if (temp_result != NULL((void*)0) && nextcmd == NULL((void*)0)) {
15373 retval = xmalloc(STRLEN(temp_result)strlen((char *)(temp_result)) + (expr_start - in_start)
15374 + (in_end - expr_end) + 1);
15375 STRCPY(retval, in_start)strcpy((char *)(retval), (char *)(in_start));
15376 STRCAT(retval, temp_result)strcat((char *)(retval), (char *)(temp_result));
15377 STRCAT(retval, expr_end + 1)strcat((char *)(retval), (char *)(expr_end + 1));
15378 }
15379 free(temp_result);
15380
15381 *in_end = c1; /* put char back for error messages */
15382 *expr_start = '{';
15383 *expr_end = '}';
15384
15385 if (retval != NULL((void*)0)) {
15386 temp_result = find_name_end(retval, &expr_start, &expr_end, 0);
15387 if (expr_start != NULL((void*)0)) {
15388 /* Further expansion! */
15389 temp_result = make_expanded_name(retval, expr_start,
15390 expr_end, temp_result);
15391 free(retval);
15392 retval = temp_result;
15393 }
15394 }
15395
15396 return retval;
15397}
15398
15399/*
15400 * Return TRUE if character "c" can be used in a variable or function name.
15401 * Does not include '{' or '}' for magic braces.
15402 */
15403static int eval_isnamec(int c)
15404{
15405 return ASCII_ISALNUM(c)((((unsigned)(c) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(c) - 'a' < 26
)) || ((unsigned)(c) - '0' < 10)) || c == '_' || c == ':' || c == AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#';
15406}
15407
15408/*
15409 * Return TRUE if character "c" can be used as the first character in a
15410 * variable or function name (excluding '{' and '}').
15411 */
15412static int eval_isnamec1(int c)
15413{
15414 return ASCII_ISALPHA(c)(((unsigned)(c) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(c) - 'a' < 26
)) || c == '_';
15415}
15416
15417/*
15418 * Set number v: variable to "val".
15419 */
15420void set_vim_var_nr(int idx, long val)
15421{
15422 vimvars[idx].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = val;
15423}
15424
15425/*
15426 * Get number v: variable value.
15427 */
15428long get_vim_var_nr(int idx)
15429{
15430 return vimvars[idx].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number;
15431}
15432
15433/*
15434 * Get string v: variable value. Uses a static buffer, can only be used once.
15435 */
15436char_u *get_vim_var_str(int idx)
15437{
15438 return get_tv_string(&vimvars[idx].vv_tvvv_di.di_tv);
15439}
15440
15441/*
15442 * Get List v: variable value. Caller must take care of reference count when
15443 * needed.
15444 */
15445list_T *get_vim_var_list(int idx)
15446{
15447 return vimvars[idx].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list;
15448}
15449
15450/*
15451 * Set v:char to character "c".
15452 */
15453void set_vim_var_char(int c)
15454{
15455 char_u buf[MB_MAXBYTES21 + 1];
15456
15457 if (has_mbyte)
15458 buf[(*mb_char2bytes)(c, buf)] = NUL'\000';
15459 else {
15460 buf[0] = c;
15461 buf[1] = NUL'\000';
15462 }
15463 set_vim_var_string(VV_CHAR, buf, -1);
15464}
15465
15466/*
15467 * Set v:count to "count" and v:count1 to "count1".
15468 * When "set_prevcount" is TRUE first set v:prevcount from v:count.
15469 */
15470void set_vcount(long count, long count1, int set_prevcount)
15471{
15472 if (set_prevcount)
15473 vimvars[VV_PREVCOUNT].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = vimvars[VV_COUNT].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number;
15474 vimvars[VV_COUNT].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = count;
15475 vimvars[VV_COUNT1].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = count1;
15476}
15477
15478/*
15479 * Set string v: variable to a copy of "val".
15480 */
15481void
15482set_vim_var_string (
15483 int idx,
15484 char_u *val,
15485 int len /* length of "val" to use or -1 (whole string) */
15486)
15487{
15488 /* Need to do this (at least) once, since we can't initialize a union.
15489 * Will always be invoked when "v:progname" is set. */
15490 vimvars[VV_VERSION].vv_nrvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_number = VIM_VERSION_100(7 * 100 + 4);
15491
15492 free(vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string);
15493 if (val == NULL((void*)0))
15494 vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
15495 else if (len == -1)
15496 vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(val);
15497 else
15498 vimvars[idx].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strnsave(val, len);
15499}
15500
15501/*
15502 * Set List v: variable to "val".
15503 */
15504void set_vim_var_list(int idx, list_T *val)
15505{
15506 list_unref(vimvars[idx].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list);
15507 vimvars[idx].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list = val;
15508 if (val != NULL((void*)0))
15509 ++val->lv_refcount;
15510}
15511
15512/*
15513 * Set v:register if needed.
15514 */
15515void set_reg_var(int c)
15516{
15517 char_u regname;
15518
15519 if (c == 0 || c == ' ')
15520 regname = '"';
15521 else
15522 regname = c;
15523 /* Avoid free/alloc when the value is already right. */
15524 if (vimvars[VV_REG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0) || vimvars[VV_REG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string[0] != c)
15525 set_vim_var_string(VV_REG, &regname, 1);
15526}
15527
15528/*
15529 * Get or set v:exception. If "oldval" == NULL, return the current value.
15530 * Otherwise, restore the value to "oldval" and return NULL.
15531 * Must always be called in pairs to save and restore v:exception! Does not
15532 * take care of memory allocations.
15533 */
15534char_u *v_exception(char_u *oldval)
15535{
15536 if (oldval == NULL((void*)0))
15537 return vimvars[VV_EXCEPTION].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string;
15538
15539 vimvars[VV_EXCEPTION].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = oldval;
15540 return NULL((void*)0);
15541}
15542
15543/*
15544 * Get or set v:throwpoint. If "oldval" == NULL, return the current value.
15545 * Otherwise, restore the value to "oldval" and return NULL.
15546 * Must always be called in pairs to save and restore v:throwpoint! Does not
15547 * take care of memory allocations.
15548 */
15549char_u *v_throwpoint(char_u *oldval)
15550{
15551 if (oldval == NULL((void*)0))
15552 return vimvars[VV_THROWPOINT].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string;
15553
15554 vimvars[VV_THROWPOINT].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = oldval;
15555 return NULL((void*)0);
15556}
15557
15558/*
15559 * Set v:cmdarg.
15560 * If "eap" != NULL, use "eap" to generate the value and return the old value.
15561 * If "oldarg" != NULL, restore the value to "oldarg" and return NULL.
15562 * Must always be called in pairs!
15563 */
15564char_u *set_cmdarg(exarg_T *eap, char_u *oldarg)
15565{
15566 char_u *oldval;
15567 char_u *newval;
15568
15569 oldval = vimvars[VV_CMDARG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string;
15570 if (eap == NULL((void*)0)) {
15571 free(oldval);
15572 vimvars[VV_CMDARG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = oldarg;
15573 return NULL((void*)0);
15574 }
15575
15576 size_t len = 0;
15577 if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_BIN1)
15578 len = 6;
15579 else if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_NOBIN2)
15580 len = 8;
15581
15582 if (eap->read_edit)
15583 len += 7;
15584
15585 if (eap->force_ff != 0)
15586 len += STRLEN(eap->cmd + eap->force_ff)strlen((char *)(eap->cmd + eap->force_ff)) + 6;
15587 if (eap->force_enc != 0)
15588 len += STRLEN(eap->cmd + eap->force_enc)strlen((char *)(eap->cmd + eap->force_enc)) + 7;
15589 if (eap->bad_char != 0)
15590 len += 7 + 4; /* " ++bad=" + "keep" or "drop" */
15591
15592 newval = xmalloc(len + 1);
15593
15594 if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_BIN1)
15595 sprintf((char *)newval, " ++bin");
15596 else if (eap->force_bin == FORCE_NOBIN2)
15597 sprintf((char *)newval, " ++nobin");
15598 else
15599 *newval = NUL'\000';
15600
15601 if (eap->read_edit)
15602 STRCAT(newval, " ++edit")strcat((char *)(newval), (char *)(" ++edit"));
15603
15604 if (eap->force_ff != 0)
15605 sprintf((char *)newval + STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval)), " ++ff=%s",
15606 eap->cmd + eap->force_ff);
15607 if (eap->force_enc != 0)
15608 sprintf((char *)newval + STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval)), " ++enc=%s",
15609 eap->cmd + eap->force_enc);
15610 if (eap->bad_char == BAD_KEEP-1)
15611 STRCPY(newval + STRLEN(newval), " ++bad=keep")strcpy((char *)(newval + strlen((char *)(newval))), (char *)(
" ++bad=keep"));
15612 else if (eap->bad_char == BAD_DROP-2)
15613 STRCPY(newval + STRLEN(newval), " ++bad=drop")strcpy((char *)(newval + strlen((char *)(newval))), (char *)(
" ++bad=drop"));
15614 else if (eap->bad_char != 0)
15615 sprintf((char *)newval + STRLEN(newval)strlen((char *)(newval)), " ++bad=%c", eap->bad_char);
15616 vimvars[VV_CMDARG].vv_strvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_string = newval;
15617 return oldval;
15618}
15619
15620/*
15621 * Get the value of internal variable "name".
15622 * Return OK or FAIL.
15623 */
15624static int
15625get_var_tv (
15626 char_u *name,
15627 int len, /* length of "name" */
15628 typval_T *rettv, /* NULL when only checking existence */
15629 int verbose, /* may give error message */
15630 int no_autoload /* do not use script autoloading */
15631)
15632{
15633 int ret = OK1;
15634 typval_T *tv = NULL((void*)0);
15635 typval_T atv;
15636 dictitem_T *v;
15637 int cc;
15638
15639 /* truncate the name, so that we can use strcmp() */
15640 cc = name[len];
15641 name[len] = NUL'\000';
15642
15643 /*
15644 * Check for "b:changedtick".
15645 */
15646 if (STRCMP(name, "b:changedtick")strcmp((char *)(name), (char *)("b:changedtick")) == 0) {
15647 atv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
15648 atv.vval.v_number = curbuf->b_changedtick;
15649 tv = &atv;
15650 }
15651 /*
15652 * Check for user-defined variables.
15653 */
15654 else {
15655 v = find_var(name, NULL((void*)0), no_autoload);
15656 if (v != NULL((void*)0))
15657 tv = &v->di_tv;
15658 }
15659
15660 if (tv == NULL((void*)0)) {
15661 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0) && verbose)
15662 EMSG2(_(e_undefvar), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_undefvar))), (char_u *)(name
));
15663 ret = FAIL0;
15664 } else if (rettv != NULL((void*)0))
15665 copy_tv(tv, rettv);
15666
15667 name[len] = cc;
15668
15669 return ret;
15670}
15671
15672/*
15673 * Handle expr[expr], expr[expr:expr] subscript and .name lookup.
15674 * Also handle function call with Funcref variable: func(expr)
15675 * Can all be combined: dict.func(expr)[idx]['func'](expr)
15676 */
15677static int
15678handle_subscript (
15679 char_u **arg,
15680 typval_T *rettv,
15681 int evaluate, /* do more than finding the end */
15682 int verbose /* give error messages */
15683)
15684{
15685 int ret = OK1;
15686 dict_T *selfdict = NULL((void*)0);
15687 char_u *s;
15688 int len;
15689 typval_T functv;
15690
15691 while (ret == OK1
15692 && (**arg == '['
15693 || (**arg == '.' && rettv->v_type == VAR_DICT5)
15694 || (**arg == '(' && (!evaluate || rettv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3)))
15695 && !vim_iswhite(*(*arg - 1))((*(*arg - 1)) == ' ' || (*(*arg - 1)) == '\t')) {
15696 if (**arg == '(') {
15697 /* need to copy the funcref so that we can clear rettv */
15698 if (evaluate) {
15699 functv = *rettv;
15700 rettv->v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN0;
15701
15702 /* Invoke the function. Recursive! */
15703 s = functv.vval.v_string;
15704 } else
15705 s = (char_u *)"";
15706 ret = get_func_tv(s, (int)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s)), rettv, arg,
15707 curwin->w_cursor.lnum, curwin->w_cursor.lnum,
15708 &len, evaluate, selfdict);
15709
15710 /* Clear the funcref afterwards, so that deleting it while
15711 * evaluating the arguments is possible (see test55). */
15712 if (evaluate)
15713 clear_tv(&functv);
15714
15715 /* Stop the expression evaluation when immediately aborting on
15716 * error, or when an interrupt occurred or an exception was thrown
15717 * but not caught. */
15718 if (aborting()) {
15719 if (ret == OK1)
15720 clear_tv(rettv);
15721 ret = FAIL0;
15722 }
15723 dict_unref(selfdict);
15724 selfdict = NULL((void*)0);
15725 } else { /* **arg == '[' || **arg == '.' */
15726 dict_unref(selfdict);
15727 if (rettv->v_type == VAR_DICT5) {
15728 selfdict = rettv->vval.v_dict;
15729 if (selfdict != NULL((void*)0))
15730 ++selfdict->dv_refcount;
15731 } else
15732 selfdict = NULL((void*)0);
15733 if (eval_index(arg, rettv, evaluate, verbose) == FAIL0) {
15734 clear_tv(rettv);
15735 ret = FAIL0;
15736 }
15737 }
15738 }
15739 dict_unref(selfdict);
15740 return ret;
15741}
15742
15743/*
15744 * Free the memory for a variable type-value.
15745 */
15746void free_tv(typval_T *varp)
15747{
15748 if (varp != NULL((void*)0)) {
15749 switch (varp->v_type) {
15750 case VAR_FUNC3:
15751 func_unref(varp->vval.v_string);
15752 /*FALLTHROUGH*/
15753 case VAR_STRING2:
15754 free(varp->vval.v_string);
15755 break;
15756 case VAR_LIST4:
15757 list_unref(varp->vval.v_list);
15758 break;
15759 case VAR_DICT5:
15760 dict_unref(varp->vval.v_dict);
15761 break;
15762 case VAR_NUMBER1:
15763 case VAR_FLOAT6:
15764 case VAR_UNKNOWN0:
15765 break;
15766 default:
15767 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "free_tv()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("free_tv()"
));
15768 break;
15769 }
15770 free(varp);
15771 }
15772}
15773
15774/*
15775 * Free the memory for a variable value and set the value to NULL or 0.
15776 */
15777void clear_tv(typval_T *varp)
15778{
15779 if (varp != NULL((void*)0)) {
15780 switch (varp->v_type) {
15781 case VAR_FUNC3:
15782 func_unref(varp->vval.v_string);
15783 /*FALLTHROUGH*/
15784 case VAR_STRING2:
15785 free(varp->vval.v_string);
15786 varp->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
15787 break;
15788 case VAR_LIST4:
15789 list_unref(varp->vval.v_list);
15790 varp->vval.v_list = NULL((void*)0);
15791 break;
15792 case VAR_DICT5:
15793 dict_unref(varp->vval.v_dict);
15794 varp->vval.v_dict = NULL((void*)0);
15795 break;
15796 case VAR_NUMBER1:
15797 varp->vval.v_number = 0;
15798 break;
15799 case VAR_FLOAT6:
15800 varp->vval.v_float = 0.0;
15801 break;
15802 case VAR_UNKNOWN0:
15803 break;
15804 default:
15805 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "clear_tv()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("clear_tv()"
));
15806 }
15807 varp->v_lock = 0;
15808 }
15809}
15810
15811/*
15812 * Set the value of a variable to NULL without freeing items.
15813 */
15814static void init_tv(typval_T *varp)
15815{
15816 if (varp != NULL((void*)0))
15817 memset(varp, 0, sizeof(typval_T));
15818}
15819
15820/*
15821 * Get the number value of a variable.
15822 * If it is a String variable, uses vim_str2nr().
15823 * For incompatible types, return 0.
15824 * get_tv_number_chk() is similar to get_tv_number(), but informs the
15825 * caller of incompatible types: it sets *denote to TRUE if "denote"
15826 * is not NULL or returns -1 otherwise.
15827 */
15828static long get_tv_number(typval_T *varp)
15829{
15830 int error = FALSE0;
15831
15832 return get_tv_number_chk(varp, &error); /* return 0L on error */
15833}
15834
15835long get_tv_number_chk(typval_T *varp, int *denote)
15836{
15837 long n = 0L;
15838
15839 switch (varp->v_type) {
15840 case VAR_NUMBER1:
15841 return (long)(varp->vval.v_number);
15842 case VAR_FLOAT6:
15843 EMSG(_("E805: Using a Float as a Number"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E805: Using a Float as a Number"
))));
15844 break;
15845 case VAR_FUNC3:
15846 EMSG(_("E703: Using a Funcref as a Number"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E703: Using a Funcref as a Number"
))));
15847 break;
15848 case VAR_STRING2:
15849 if (varp->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0))
15850 vim_str2nr(varp->vval.v_string, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0),
15851 TRUE1, TRUE1, &n, NULL((void*)0));
15852 return n;
15853 case VAR_LIST4:
15854 EMSG(_("E745: Using a List as a Number"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E745: Using a List as a Number"
))));
15855 break;
15856 case VAR_DICT5:
15857 EMSG(_("E728: Using a Dictionary as a Number"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E728: Using a Dictionary as a Number"
))));
15858 break;
15859 default:
15860 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "get_tv_number()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("get_tv_number()"
));
15861 break;
15862 }
15863 if (denote == NULL((void*)0)) /* useful for values that must be unsigned */
15864 n = -1;
15865 else
15866 *denote = TRUE1;
15867 return n;
15868}
15869
15870/*
15871 * Get the lnum from the first argument.
15872 * Also accepts ".", "$", etc., but that only works for the current buffer.
15873 * Returns -1 on error.
15874 */
15875static linenr_T get_tv_lnum(typval_T *argvars)
15876{
15877 typval_T rettv;
15878 linenr_T lnum;
15879
15880 lnum = get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0));
15881 if (lnum == 0) { /* no valid number, try using line() */
15882 rettv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
15883 f_line(argvars, &rettv);
15884 lnum = rettv.vval.v_number;
15885 clear_tv(&rettv);
15886 }
15887 return lnum;
15888}
15889
15890/*
15891 * Get the lnum from the first argument.
15892 * Also accepts "$", then "buf" is used.
15893 * Returns 0 on error.
15894 */
15895static linenr_T get_tv_lnum_buf(typval_T *argvars, buf_T *buf)
15896{
15897 if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_STRING2
15898 && argvars[0].vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)
15899 && argvars[0].vval.v_string[0] == '$'
15900 && buf != NULL((void*)0))
15901 return buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
15902 return get_tv_number_chk(&argvars[0], NULL((void*)0));
15903}
15904
15905/*
15906 * Get the string value of a variable.
15907 * If it is a Number variable, the number is converted into a string.
15908 * get_tv_string() uses a single, static buffer. YOU CAN ONLY USE IT ONCE!
15909 * get_tv_string_buf() uses a given buffer.
15910 * If the String variable has never been set, return an empty string.
15911 * Never returns NULL;
15912 * get_tv_string_chk() and get_tv_string_buf_chk() are similar, but return
15913 * NULL on error.
15914 */
15915static char_u *get_tv_string(typval_T *varp)
15916{
15917 static char_u mybuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
15918
15919 return get_tv_string_buf(varp, mybuf);
15920}
15921
15922static char_u *get_tv_string_buf(typval_T *varp, char_u *buf)
15923{
15924 char_u *res = get_tv_string_buf_chk(varp, buf);
15925
15926 return res != NULL((void*)0) ? res : (char_u *)"";
15927}
15928
15929char_u *get_tv_string_chk(typval_T *varp)
15930{
15931 static char_u mybuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
15932
15933 return get_tv_string_buf_chk(varp, mybuf);
15934}
15935
15936static char_u *get_tv_string_buf_chk(typval_T *varp, char_u *buf)
15937{
15938 switch (varp->v_type) {
15939 case VAR_NUMBER1:
15940 sprintf((char *)buf, "%" PRId64"l" "d", (int64_t)varp->vval.v_number);
15941 return buf;
15942 case VAR_FUNC3:
15943 EMSG(_("E729: using Funcref as a String"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E729: using Funcref as a String"
))));
15944 break;
15945 case VAR_LIST4:
15946 EMSG(_("E730: using List as a String"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E730: using List as a String"
))));
15947 break;
15948 case VAR_DICT5:
15949 EMSG(_("E731: using Dictionary as a String"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E731: using Dictionary as a String"
))));
15950 break;
15951 case VAR_FLOAT6:
15952 EMSG(_(e_float_as_string))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_float_as_string))));
15953 break;
15954 case VAR_STRING2:
15955 if (varp->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0))
15956 return varp->vval.v_string;
15957 return (char_u *)"";
15958 default:
15959 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "get_tv_string_buf()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("get_tv_string_buf()"
));
15960 break;
15961 }
15962 return NULL((void*)0);
15963}
15964
15965/*
15966 * Find variable "name" in the list of variables.
15967 * Return a pointer to it if found, NULL if not found.
15968 * Careful: "a:0" variables don't have a name.
15969 * When "htp" is not NULL we are writing to the variable, set "htp" to the
15970 * hashtab_T used.
15971 */
15972static dictitem_T *find_var(char_u *name, hashtab_T **htp, int no_autoload)
15973{
15974 char_u *varname;
15975 hashtab_T *ht;
15976
15977 ht = find_var_ht(name, &varname);
15978 if (htp != NULL((void*)0))
15979 *htp = ht;
15980 if (ht == NULL((void*)0))
15981 return NULL((void*)0);
15982 return find_var_in_ht(ht, *name, varname, no_autoload || htp != NULL((void*)0));
15983}
15984
15985/*
15986 * Find variable "varname" in hashtab "ht" with name "htname".
15987 * Returns NULL if not found.
15988 */
15989static dictitem_T *find_var_in_ht(hashtab_T *ht, int htname, char_u *varname, int no_autoload)
15990{
15991 hashitem_T *hi;
15992
15993 if (*varname == NUL'\000') {
15994 /* Must be something like "s:", otherwise "ht" would be NULL. */
15995 switch (htname) {
15996 case 's': return &SCRIPT_SV(current_SID)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(current_SID) - 1])->sv_var;
15997 case 'g': return &globvars_var;
15998 case 'v': return &vimvars_var;
15999 case 'b': return &curbuf->b_bufvar;
16000 case 'w': return &curwin->w_winvar;
16001 case 't': return &curtab->tp_winvar;
16002 case 'l': return current_funccal == NULL((void*)0)
16003 ? NULL((void*)0) : &current_funccal->l_vars_var;
16004 case 'a': return current_funccal == NULL((void*)0)
16005 ? NULL((void*)0) : &current_funccal->l_avars_var;
16006 }
16007 return NULL((void*)0);
16008 }
16009
16010 hi = hash_find(ht, varname);
16011 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
16012 /* For global variables we may try auto-loading the script. If it
16013 * worked find the variable again. Don't auto-load a script if it was
16014 * loaded already, otherwise it would be loaded every time when
16015 * checking if a function name is a Funcref variable. */
16016 if (ht == &globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab && !no_autoload) {
16017 /* Note: script_autoload() may make "hi" invalid. It must either
16018 * be obtained again or not used. */
16019 if (!script_autoload(varname, FALSE0) || aborting())
16020 return NULL((void*)0);
16021 hi = hash_find(ht, varname);
16022 }
16023 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
16024 return NULL((void*)0);
16025 }
16026 return HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
16027}
16028
16029/*
16030 * Find the hashtab used for a variable name.
16031 * Set "varname" to the start of name without ':'.
16032 */
16033static hashtab_T *find_var_ht(char_u *name, char_u **varname)
16034{
16035 hashitem_T *hi;
16036
16037 if (name[1] != ':') {
16038 /* The name must not start with a colon or #. */
16039 if (name[0] == ':' || name[0] == AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#')
16040 return NULL((void*)0);
16041 *varname = name;
16042
16043 /* "version" is "v:version" in all scopes */
16044 hi = hash_find(&compat_hashtab, name);
16045 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
16046 return &compat_hashtab;
16047
16048 if (current_funccal == NULL((void*)0))
16049 return &globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab; /* global variable */
16050 return &current_funccal->l_vars.dv_hashtab; /* l: variable */
16051 }
16052 *varname = name + 2;
16053 if (*name == 'g') /* global variable */
16054 return &globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab;
16055 /* There must be no ':' or '#' in the rest of the name, unless g: is used
16056 */
16057 if (vim_strchr(name + 2, ':') != NULL((void*)0)
16058 || vim_strchr(name + 2, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') != NULL((void*)0))
16059 return NULL((void*)0);
16060 if (*name == 'b') /* buffer variable */
16061 return &curbuf->b_vars->dv_hashtab;
16062 if (*name == 'w') /* window variable */
16063 return &curwin->w_vars->dv_hashtab;
16064 if (*name == 't') /* tab page variable */
16065 return &curtab->tp_vars->dv_hashtab;
16066 if (*name == 'v') /* v: variable */
16067 return &vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab;
16068 if (*name == 'a' && current_funccal != NULL((void*)0)) /* function argument */
16069 return &current_funccal->l_avars.dv_hashtab;
16070 if (*name == 'l' && current_funccal != NULL((void*)0)) /* local function variable */
16071 return &current_funccal->l_vars.dv_hashtab;
16072 if (*name == 's' /* script variable */
16073 && current_SID > 0 && current_SID <= ga_scripts.ga_len)
16074 return &SCRIPT_VARS(current_SID)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(current_SID) - 1])->
sv_dict.dv_hashtab);
16075 return NULL((void*)0);
16076}
16077
16078/*
16079 * Get the string value of a (global/local) variable.
16080 * Note: see get_tv_string() for how long the pointer remains valid.
16081 * Returns NULL when it doesn't exist.
16082 */
16083char_u *get_var_value(char_u *name)
16084{
16085 dictitem_T *v;
16086
16087 v = find_var(name, NULL((void*)0), FALSE0);
16088 if (v == NULL((void*)0))
16089 return NULL((void*)0);
16090 return get_tv_string(&v->di_tv);
16091}
16092
16093/*
16094 * Allocate a new hashtab for a sourced script. It will be used while
16095 * sourcing this script and when executing functions defined in the script.
16096 */
16097void new_script_vars(scid_T id)
16098{
16099 hashtab_T *ht;
16100 scriptvar_T *sv;
16101
16102 ga_grow(&ga_scripts, (int)(id - ga_scripts.ga_len));
16103 {
16104 /* Re-allocating ga_data means that an ht_array pointing to
16105 * ht_smallarray becomes invalid. We can recognize this: ht_mask is
16106 * at its init value. Also reset "v_dict", it's always the same. */
16107 for (int i = 1; i <= ga_scripts.ga_len; ++i) {
16108 ht = &SCRIPT_VARS(i)((((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1])->sv_dict.
dv_hashtab);
16109 if (ht->ht_mask == HT_INIT_SIZE16 - 1)
16110 ht->ht_array = ht->ht_smallarray;
16111 sv = SCRIPT_SV(i)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(i) - 1]);
16112 sv->sv_var.di_tv.vval.v_dict = &sv->sv_dict;
16113 }
16114
16115 while (ga_scripts.ga_len < id) {
16116 sv = SCRIPT_SV(ga_scripts.ga_len + 1)(((scriptvar_T **)ga_scripts.ga_data)[(ga_scripts.ga_len + 1)
- 1]) = xcalloc(1, sizeof(scriptvar_T));
16117 init_var_dict(&sv->sv_dict, &sv->sv_var, VAR_SCOPE1);
16118 ++ga_scripts.ga_len;
16119 }
16120 }
16121}
16122
16123/*
16124 * Initialize dictionary "dict" as a scope and set variable "dict_var" to
16125 * point to it.
16126 */
16127void init_var_dict(dict_T *dict, dictitem_T *dict_var, int scope)
16128{
16129 hash_init(&dict->dv_hashtab);
16130 dict->dv_lock = 0;
16131 dict->dv_scope = scope;
16132 dict->dv_refcount = DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999;
16133 dict->dv_copyID = 0;
16134 dict_var->di_tv.vval.v_dict = dict;
16135 dict_var->di_tv.v_type = VAR_DICT5;
16136 dict_var->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
16137 dict_var->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
16138 dict_var->di_key[0] = NUL'\000';
16139}
16140
16141/*
16142 * Unreference a dictionary initialized by init_var_dict().
16143 */
16144void unref_var_dict(dict_T *dict)
16145{
16146 /* Now the dict needs to be freed if no one else is using it, go back to
16147 * normal reference counting. */
16148 dict->dv_refcount -= DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999 - 1;
16149 dict_unref(dict);
16150}
16151
16152/*
16153 * Clean up a list of internal variables.
16154 * Frees all allocated variables and the value they contain.
16155 * Clears hashtab "ht", does not free it.
16156 */
16157void vars_clear(hashtab_T *ht)
16158{
16159 vars_clear_ext(ht, TRUE1);
16160}
16161
16162/*
16163 * Like vars_clear(), but only free the value if "free_val" is TRUE.
16164 */
16165static void vars_clear_ext(hashtab_T *ht, int free_val)
16166{
16167 int todo;
16168 hashitem_T *hi;
16169 dictitem_T *v;
16170
16171 hash_lock(ht);
16172 todo = (int)ht->ht_used;
16173 for (hi = ht->ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
16174 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
16175 --todo;
16176
16177 /* Free the variable. Don't remove it from the hashtab,
16178 * ht_array might change then. hash_clear() takes care of it
16179 * later. */
16180 v = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
16181 if (free_val)
16182 clear_tv(&v->di_tv);
16183 if ((v->di_flags & DI_FLAGS_FIX4) == 0)
16184 free(v);
16185 }
16186 }
16187 hash_clear(ht);
16188 ht->ht_used = 0;
16189}
16190
16191/*
16192 * Delete a variable from hashtab "ht" at item "hi".
16193 * Clear the variable value and free the dictitem.
16194 */
16195static void delete_var(hashtab_T *ht, hashitem_T *hi)
16196{
16197 dictitem_T *di = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
16198
16199 hash_remove(ht, hi);
16200 clear_tv(&di->di_tv);
16201 free(di);
16202}
16203
16204/*
16205 * List the value of one internal variable.
16206 */
16207static void list_one_var(dictitem_T *v, char_u *prefix, int *first)
16208{
16209 char_u *tofree;
16210 char_u *s;
16211 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
16212
16213 current_copyID += COPYID_INC2;
16214 s = echo_string(&v->di_tv, &tofree, numbuf, current_copyID);
16215 list_one_var_a(prefix, v->di_key, v->di_tv.v_type,
16216 s == NULL((void*)0) ? (char_u *)"" : s, first);
16217 free(tofree);
16218}
16219
16220static void
16221list_one_var_a (
16222 char_u *prefix,
16223 char_u *name,
16224 int type,
16225 char_u *string,
16226 int *first /* when TRUE clear rest of screen and set to FALSE */
16227)
16228{
16229 /* don't use msg() or msg_attr() to avoid overwriting "v:statusmsg" */
16230 msg_start();
16231 msg_puts(prefix);
16232 if (name != NULL((void*)0)) /* "a:" vars don't have a name stored */
16233 msg_puts(name);
16234 msg_putchar(' ');
16235 msg_advance(22);
16236 if (type == VAR_NUMBER1)
16237 msg_putchar('#');
16238 else if (type == VAR_FUNC3)
16239 msg_putchar('*');
16240 else if (type == VAR_LIST4) {
16241 msg_putchar('[');
16242 if (*string == '[')
16243 ++string;
16244 } else if (type == VAR_DICT5) {
16245 msg_putchar('{');
16246 if (*string == '{')
16247 ++string;
16248 } else
16249 msg_putchar(' ');
16250
16251 msg_outtrans(string);
16252
16253 if (type == VAR_FUNC3)
16254 msg_puts((char_u *)"()");
16255 if (*first) {
16256 msg_clr_eos();
16257 *first = FALSE0;
16258 }
16259}
16260
16261/*
16262 * Set variable "name" to value in "tv".
16263 * If the variable already exists, the value is updated.
16264 * Otherwise the variable is created.
16265 */
16266static void
16267set_var (
16268 char_u *name,
16269 typval_T *tv,
16270 int copy /* make copy of value in "tv" */
16271)
16272{
16273 dictitem_T *v;
16274 char_u *varname;
16275 hashtab_T *ht;
16276
16277 ht = find_var_ht(name, &varname);
16278 if (ht == NULL((void*)0) || *varname == NUL'\000') {
16279 EMSG2(_(e_illvar), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_illvar))), (char_u *)(name
));
16280 return;
16281 }
16282 v = find_var_in_ht(ht, 0, varname, TRUE1);
16283
16284 if (tv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3 && var_check_func_name(name, v == NULL((void*)0)))
16285 return;
16286
16287 if (v != NULL((void*)0)) {
16288 /* existing variable, need to clear the value */
16289 if (var_check_ro(v->di_flags, name)
16290 || tv_check_lock(v->di_tv.v_lock, name))
16291 return;
16292 if (v->di_tv.v_type != tv->v_type
16293 && !((v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2
16294 || v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1)
16295 && (tv->v_type == VAR_STRING2
16296 || tv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER1))
16297 && !((v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1
16298 || v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
16299 && (tv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER1
16300 || tv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6))
16301 ) {
16302 EMSG2(_("E706: Variable type mismatch for: %s"), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E706: Variable type mismatch for: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
16303 return;
16304 }
16305
16306 /*
16307 * Handle setting internal v: variables separately: we don't change
16308 * the type.
16309 */
16310 if (ht == &vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab) {
16311 if (v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2) {
16312 free(v->di_tv.vval.v_string);
16313 if (copy || tv->v_type != VAR_STRING2)
16314 v->di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(get_tv_string(tv));
16315 else {
16316 /* Take over the string to avoid an extra alloc/free. */
16317 v->di_tv.vval.v_string = tv->vval.v_string;
16318 tv->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
16319 }
16320 } else if (v->di_tv.v_type != VAR_NUMBER1)
16321 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "set_var()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("set_var()"
));
16322 else {
16323 v->di_tv.vval.v_number = get_tv_number(tv);
16324 if (STRCMP(varname, "searchforward")strcmp((char *)(varname), (char *)("searchforward")) == 0)
16325 set_search_direction(v->di_tv.vval.v_number ? '/' : '?');
16326 else if (STRCMP(varname, "hlsearch")strcmp((char *)(varname), (char *)("hlsearch")) == 0) {
16327 no_hlsearch = !v->di_tv.vval.v_number;
16328 redraw_all_later(SOME_VALID35);
16329 }
16330 }
16331 return;
16332 }
16333
16334 clear_tv(&v->di_tv);
16335 } else { /* add a new variable */
16336 /* Can't add "v:" variable. */
16337 if (ht == &vimvarhtvimvardict.dv_hashtab) {
16338 EMSG2(_(e_illvar), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_illvar))), (char_u *)(name
));
16339 return;
16340 }
16341
16342 /* Make sure the variable name is valid. */
16343 if (!valid_varname(varname))
16344 return;
16345
16346 v = xmalloc(sizeof(dictitem_T) + STRLEN(varname)strlen((char *)(varname)));
16347 STRCPY(v->di_key, varname)strcpy((char *)(v->di_key), (char *)(varname));
16348 if (hash_add(ht, DI2HIKEY(v)((v)->di_key)) == FAIL0) {
16349 free(v);
16350 return;
16351 }
16352 v->di_flags = 0;
16353 }
16354
16355 if (copy || tv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER1 || tv->v_type == VAR_FLOAT6)
16356 copy_tv(tv, &v->di_tv);
16357 else {
16358 v->di_tv = *tv;
16359 v->di_tv.v_lock = 0;
16360 init_tv(tv);
16361 }
16362}
16363
16364/*
16365 * Return TRUE if di_flags "flags" indicates variable "name" is read-only.
16366 * Also give an error message.
16367 */
16368static int var_check_ro(int flags, char_u *name)
16369{
16370 if (flags & DI_FLAGS_RO1) {
16371 EMSG2(_(e_readonlyvar), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_readonlyvar))), (char_u *
)(name));
16372 return TRUE1;
16373 }
16374 if ((flags & DI_FLAGS_RO_SBX2) && sandbox) {
16375 EMSG2(_(e_readonlysbx), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_readonlysbx))), (char_u *
)(name));
16376 return TRUE1;
16377 }
16378 return FALSE0;
16379}
16380
16381/*
16382 * Return TRUE if di_flags "flags" indicates variable "name" is fixed.
16383 * Also give an error message.
16384 */
16385static int var_check_fixed(int flags, char_u *name)
16386{
16387 if (flags & DI_FLAGS_FIX4) {
16388 EMSG2(_("E795: Cannot delete variable %s"), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E795: Cannot delete variable %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
16389 return TRUE1;
16390 }
16391 return FALSE0;
16392}
16393
16394/*
16395 * Check if a funcref is assigned to a valid variable name.
16396 * Return TRUE and give an error if not.
16397 */
16398static int
16399var_check_func_name (
16400 char_u *name, /* points to start of variable name */
16401 int new_var /* TRUE when creating the variable */
16402)
16403{
16404 // Allow for w: b: s: and t:.
16405 if (!(vim_strchr((char_u *)"wbst", name[0]) != NULL((void*)0) && name[1] == ':')
16406 && !ASCII_ISUPPER((name[0] != NUL && name[1] == ':') ? name[2]((unsigned)((name[0] != '\000' && name[1] == ':') ? name
[2] : name[0]) - 'A' < 26)
16407 : name[0])((unsigned)((name[0] != '\000' && name[1] == ':') ? name
[2] : name[0]) - 'A' < 26)) {
16408 EMSG2(_("E704: Funcref variable name must start with a capital: %s"), name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E704: Funcref variable name must start with a capital: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
16409 return TRUE1;
16410 }
16411 /* Don't allow hiding a function. When "v" is not NULL we might be
16412 * assigning another function to the same var, the type is checked
16413 * below. */
16414 if (new_var && function_exists(name)) {
16415 EMSG2(_("E705: Variable name conflicts with existing function: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E705: Variable name conflicts with existing function: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name))
16416 name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E705: Variable name conflicts with existing function: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
16417 return TRUE1;
16418 }
16419 return FALSE0;
16420}
16421
16422/*
16423 * Check if a variable name is valid.
16424 * Return FALSE and give an error if not.
16425 */
16426static int valid_varname(char_u *varname)
16427{
16428 char_u *p;
16429
16430 for (p = varname; *p != NUL'\000'; ++p)
16431 if (!eval_isnamec1(*p) && (p == varname || !VIM_ISDIGIT(*p)((unsigned)(*p) - '0' < 10))
16432 && *p != AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') {
16433 EMSG2(_(e_illvar), varname)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_illvar))), (char_u *)(varname
));
16434 return FALSE0;
16435 }
16436 return TRUE1;
16437}
16438
16439/*
16440 * Return TRUE if typeval "tv" is set to be locked (immutable).
16441 * Also give an error message, using "name".
16442 */
16443static int tv_check_lock(int lock, char_u *name)
16444{
16445 if (lock & VAR_LOCKED1) {
16446 EMSG2(_("E741: Value is locked: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E741: Value is locked: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : name))
16447 name == NULL ? (char_u *)_("Unknown") : name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E741: Value is locked: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : name));
16448 return TRUE1;
16449 }
16450 if (lock & VAR_FIXED2) {
16451 EMSG2(_("E742: Cannot change value of %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E742: Cannot change value of %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : name))
16452 name == NULL ? (char_u *)_("Unknown") : name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E742: Cannot change value of %s"
))), (char_u *)(name == ((void*)0) ? (char_u *)gettext((char *
)("Unknown")) : name));
16453 return TRUE1;
16454 }
16455 return FALSE0;
16456}
16457
16458/*
16459 * Copy the values from typval_T "from" to typval_T "to".
16460 * When needed allocates string or increases reference count.
16461 * Does not make a copy of a list or dict but copies the reference!
16462 * It is OK for "from" and "to" to point to the same item. This is used to
16463 * make a copy later.
16464 */
16465void copy_tv(typval_T *from, typval_T *to)
16466{
16467 to->v_type = from->v_type;
16468 to->v_lock = 0;
16469 switch (from->v_type) {
16470 case VAR_NUMBER1:
16471 to->vval.v_number = from->vval.v_number;
16472 break;
16473 case VAR_FLOAT6:
16474 to->vval.v_float = from->vval.v_float;
16475 break;
16476 case VAR_STRING2:
16477 case VAR_FUNC3:
16478 if (from->vval.v_string == NULL((void*)0))
16479 to->vval.v_string = NULL((void*)0);
16480 else {
16481 to->vval.v_string = vim_strsave(from->vval.v_string);
16482 if (from->v_type == VAR_FUNC3)
16483 func_ref(to->vval.v_string);
16484 }
16485 break;
16486 case VAR_LIST4:
16487 if (from->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))
16488 to->vval.v_list = NULL((void*)0);
16489 else {
16490 to->vval.v_list = from->vval.v_list;
16491 ++to->vval.v_list->lv_refcount;
16492 }
16493 break;
16494 case VAR_DICT5:
16495 if (from->vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0))
16496 to->vval.v_dict = NULL((void*)0);
16497 else {
16498 to->vval.v_dict = from->vval.v_dict;
16499 ++to->vval.v_dict->dv_refcount;
16500 }
16501 break;
16502 default:
16503 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "copy_tv()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("copy_tv()"
));
16504 break;
16505 }
16506}
16507
16508/*
16509 * Make a copy of an item.
16510 * Lists and Dictionaries are also copied. A deep copy if "deep" is set.
16511 * For deepcopy() "copyID" is zero for a full copy or the ID for when a
16512 * reference to an already copied list/dict can be used.
16513 * Returns FAIL or OK.
16514 */
16515static int item_copy(typval_T *from, typval_T *to, int deep, int copyID)
16516{
16517 static int recurse = 0;
16518 int ret = OK1;
16519
16520 if (recurse >= DICT_MAXNEST100) {
16521 EMSG(_("E698: variable nested too deep for making a copy"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E698: variable nested too deep for making a copy"
))));
16522 return FAIL0;
16523 }
16524 ++recurse;
16525
16526 switch (from->v_type) {
16527 case VAR_NUMBER1:
16528 case VAR_FLOAT6:
16529 case VAR_STRING2:
16530 case VAR_FUNC3:
16531 copy_tv(from, to);
16532 break;
16533 case VAR_LIST4:
16534 to->v_type = VAR_LIST4;
16535 to->v_lock = 0;
16536 if (from->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))
16537 to->vval.v_list = NULL((void*)0);
16538 else if (copyID != 0 && from->vval.v_list->lv_copyID == copyID) {
16539 /* use the copy made earlier */
16540 to->vval.v_list = from->vval.v_list->lv_copylist;
16541 ++to->vval.v_list->lv_refcount;
16542 } else
16543 to->vval.v_list = list_copy(from->vval.v_list, deep, copyID);
16544 if (to->vval.v_list == NULL((void*)0))
16545 ret = FAIL0;
16546 break;
16547 case VAR_DICT5:
16548 to->v_type = VAR_DICT5;
16549 to->v_lock = 0;
16550 if (from->vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0))
16551 to->vval.v_dict = NULL((void*)0);
16552 else if (copyID != 0 && from->vval.v_dict->dv_copyID == copyID) {
16553 /* use the copy made earlier */
16554 to->vval.v_dict = from->vval.v_dict->dv_copydict;
16555 ++to->vval.v_dict->dv_refcount;
16556 } else
16557 to->vval.v_dict = dict_copy(from->vval.v_dict, deep, copyID);
16558 if (to->vval.v_dict == NULL((void*)0))
16559 ret = FAIL0;
16560 break;
16561 default:
16562 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "item_copy()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("item_copy()"
));
16563 ret = FAIL0;
16564 }
16565 --recurse;
16566 return ret;
16567}
16568
16569/*
16570 * ":echo expr1 ..." print each argument separated with a space, add a
16571 * newline at the end.
16572 * ":echon expr1 ..." print each argument plain.
16573 */
16574void ex_echo(exarg_T *eap)
16575{
16576 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
16577 typval_T rettv;
16578 char_u *tofree;
16579 char_u *p;
16580 int needclr = TRUE1;
16581 int atstart = TRUE1;
16582 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
16583
16584 if (eap->skip)
16585 ++emsg_skip;
16586 while (*arg != NUL'\000' && *arg != '|' && *arg != '\n' && !got_int) {
16587 /* If eval1() causes an error message the text from the command may
16588 * still need to be cleared. E.g., "echo 22,44". */
16589 need_clr_eos = needclr;
16590
16591 p = arg;
16592 if (eval1(&arg, &rettv, !eap->skip) == FAIL0) {
16593 /*
16594 * Report the invalid expression unless the expression evaluation
16595 * has been cancelled due to an aborting error, an interrupt, or an
16596 * exception.
16597 */
16598 if (!aborting())
16599 EMSG2(_(e_invexpr2), p)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2))), (char_u *)(p
));
16600 need_clr_eos = FALSE0;
16601 break;
16602 }
16603 need_clr_eos = FALSE0;
16604
16605 if (!eap->skip) {
16606 if (atstart) {
16607 atstart = FALSE0;
16608 /* Call msg_start() after eval1(), evaluating the expression
16609 * may cause a message to appear. */
16610 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echo) {
16611 /* Mark the saved text as finishing the line, so that what
16612 * follows is displayed on a new line when scrolling back
16613 * at the more prompt. */
16614 msg_sb_eol();
16615 msg_start();
16616 }
16617 } else if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echo)
16618 msg_puts_attr((char_u *)" ", echo_attr);
16619 current_copyID += COPYID_INC2;
16620 p = echo_string(&rettv, &tofree, numbuf, current_copyID);
16621 if (p != NULL((void*)0))
16622 for (; *p != NUL'\000' && !got_int; ++p) {
16623 if (*p == '\n' || *p == '\r' || *p == TAB'\011') {
16624 if (*p != TAB'\011' && needclr) {
16625 /* remove any text still there from the command */
16626 msg_clr_eos();
16627 needclr = FALSE0;
16628 }
16629 msg_putchar_attr(*p, echo_attr);
16630 } else {
16631 if (has_mbyte) {
16632 int i = (*mb_ptr2len)(p);
16633
16634 (void)msg_outtrans_len_attr(p, i, echo_attr);
16635 p += i - 1;
16636 } else
16637 (void)msg_outtrans_len_attr(p, 1, echo_attr);
16638 }
16639 }
16640 free(tofree);
16641 }
16642 clear_tv(&rettv);
16643 arg = skipwhite(arg);
16644 }
16645 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
16646
16647 if (eap->skip)
16648 --emsg_skip;
16649 else {
16650 /* remove text that may still be there from the command */
16651 if (needclr)
16652 msg_clr_eos();
16653 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echo)
16654 msg_end();
16655 }
16656}
16657
16658/*
16659 * ":echohl {name}".
16660 */
16661void ex_echohl(exarg_T *eap)
16662{
16663 int id;
16664
16665 id = syn_name2id(eap->arg);
16666 if (id == 0)
16667 echo_attr = 0;
16668 else
16669 echo_attr = syn_id2attr(id);
16670}
16671
16672/*
16673 * ":execute expr1 ..." execute the result of an expression.
16674 * ":echomsg expr1 ..." Print a message
16675 * ":echoerr expr1 ..." Print an error
16676 * Each gets spaces around each argument and a newline at the end for
16677 * echo commands
16678 */
16679void ex_execute(exarg_T *eap)
16680{
16681 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
16682 typval_T rettv;
16683 int ret = OK1;
16684 char_u *p;
16685 garray_T ga;
16686 int len;
16687 int save_did_emsg;
16688
16689 ga_init(&ga, 1, 80);
16690
16691 if (eap->skip)
16692 ++emsg_skip;
16693 while (*arg != NUL'\000' && *arg != '|' && *arg != '\n') {
16694 p = arg;
16695 if (eval1(&arg, &rettv, !eap->skip) == FAIL0) {
16696 /*
16697 * Report the invalid expression unless the expression evaluation
16698 * has been cancelled due to an aborting error, an interrupt, or an
16699 * exception.
16700 */
16701 if (!aborting())
16702 EMSG2(_(e_invexpr2), p)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invexpr2))), (char_u *)(p
));
16703 ret = FAIL0;
16704 break;
16705 }
16706
16707 if (!eap->skip) {
16708 p = get_tv_string(&rettv);
16709 len = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
16710 ga_grow(&ga, len + 2);
16711 if (!GA_EMPTY(&ga)((&ga)->ga_len <= 0))
16712 ((char_u *)(ga.ga_data))[ga.ga_len++] = ' ';
16713 STRCPY((char_u *)(ga.ga_data) + ga.ga_len, p)strcpy((char *)((char_u *)(ga.ga_data) + ga.ga_len), (char *)
(p));
16714 ga.ga_len += len;
16715 }
16716
16717 clear_tv(&rettv);
16718 arg = skipwhite(arg);
16719 }
16720
16721 if (ret != FAIL0 && ga.ga_data != NULL((void*)0)) {
16722 if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echomsg) {
16723 MSG_ATTR(ga.ga_data, echo_attr)msg_attr((char_u *)(ga.ga_data), (echo_attr));
16724 out_flush();
16725 } else if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_echoerr) {
16726 /* We don't want to abort following commands, restore did_emsg. */
16727 save_did_emsg = did_emsg;
16728 EMSG((char_u *)ga.ga_data)emsg((char_u *)((char_u *)ga.ga_data));
16729 if (!force_abort)
16730 did_emsg = save_did_emsg;
16731 } else if (eap->cmdidx == CMD_execute)
16732 do_cmdline((char_u *)ga.ga_data,
16733 eap->getline, eap->cookie, DOCMD_NOWAIT0x02|DOCMD_VERBOSE0x01);
16734 }
16735
16736 ga_clear(&ga);
16737
16738 if (eap->skip)
16739 --emsg_skip;
16740
16741 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
16742}
16743
16744/*
16745 * Skip over the name of an option: "&option", "&g:option" or "&l:option".
16746 * "arg" points to the "&" or '+' when called, to "option" when returning.
16747 * Returns NULL when no option name found. Otherwise pointer to the char
16748 * after the option name.
16749 */
16750static char_u *find_option_end(char_u **arg, int *opt_flags)
16751{
16752 char_u *p = *arg;
16753
16754 ++p;
16755 if (*p == 'g' && p[1] == ':') {
16756 *opt_flags = OPT_GLOBAL2;
16757 p += 2;
16758 } else if (*p == 'l' && p[1] == ':') {
16759 *opt_flags = OPT_LOCAL4;
16760 p += 2;
16761 } else
16762 *opt_flags = 0;
16763
16764 if (!ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(*p) - 'a' <
26)))
16765 return NULL((void*)0);
16766 *arg = p;
16767
16768 if (p[0] == 't' && p[1] == '_' && p[2] != NUL'\000' && p[3] != NUL'\000')
16769 p += 4; /* termcap option */
16770 else
16771 while (ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(*p) - 'a' <
26)))
16772 ++p;
16773 return p;
16774}
16775
16776/*
16777 * ":function"
16778 */
16779void ex_function(exarg_T *eap)
16780{
16781 char_u *theline;
16782 int c;
16783 int saved_did_emsg;
16784 int saved_wait_return = need_wait_return;
16785 char_u *name = NULL((void*)0);
16786 char_u *p;
16787 char_u *arg;
16788 char_u *line_arg = NULL((void*)0);
16789 garray_T newargs;
16790 garray_T newlines;
16791 int varargs = FALSE0;
16792 int mustend = FALSE0;
16793 int flags = 0;
16794 ufunc_T *fp;
16795 int indent;
16796 int nesting;
16797 char_u *skip_until = NULL((void*)0);
16798 dictitem_T *v;
16799 funcdict_T fudi;
16800 static int func_nr = 0; /* number for nameless function */
16801 int paren;
16802 hashtab_T *ht;
16803 int todo;
16804 hashitem_T *hi;
16805 int sourcing_lnum_off;
16806
16807 /*
16808 * ":function" without argument: list functions.
16809 */
16810 if (ends_excmd(*eap->arg)) {
16811 if (!eap->skip) {
16812 todo = (int)func_hashtab.ht_used;
16813 for (hi = func_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
16814 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
16815 --todo;
16816 fp = HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)));
16817 if (!isdigit(*fp->uf_name)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*fp->uf_name))] & (unsigned
short int) _ISdigit))
16818 list_func_head(fp, FALSE0);
16819 }
16820 }
16821 }
16822 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(eap->arg);
16823 return;
16824 }
16825
16826 /*
16827 * ":function /pat": list functions matching pattern.
16828 */
16829 if (*eap->arg == '/') {
16830 p = skip_regexp(eap->arg + 1, '/', TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
16831 if (!eap->skip) {
16832 regmatch_T regmatch;
16833
16834 c = *p;
16835 *p = NUL'\000';
16836 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(eap->arg + 1, RE_MAGIC1);
16837 *p = c;
16838 if (regmatch.regprog != NULL((void*)0)) {
16839 regmatch.rm_ic = p_ic;
16840
16841 todo = (int)func_hashtab.ht_used;
16842 for (hi = func_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0 && !got_int; ++hi) {
16843 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
16844 --todo;
16845 fp = HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)));
16846 if (!isdigit(*fp->uf_name)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*fp->uf_name))] & (unsigned
short int) _ISdigit)
16847 && vim_regexec(&regmatch, fp->uf_name, 0))
16848 list_func_head(fp, FALSE0);
16849 }
16850 }
16851 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
16852 }
16853 }
16854 if (*p == '/')
16855 ++p;
16856 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(p);
16857 return;
16858 }
16859
16860 // Get the function name. There are these situations:
16861 // func function name
16862 // "name" == func, "fudi.fd_dict" == NULL
16863 // dict.func new dictionary entry
16864 // "name" == NULL, "fudi.fd_dict" set,
16865 // "fudi.fd_di" == NULL, "fudi.fd_newkey" == func
16866 // dict.func existing dict entry with a Funcref
16867 // "name" == func, "fudi.fd_dict" set,
16868 // "fudi.fd_di" set, "fudi.fd_newkey" == NULL
16869 // dict.func existing dict entry that's not a Funcref
16870 // "name" == NULL, "fudi.fd_dict" set,
16871 // "fudi.fd_di" set, "fudi.fd_newkey" == NULL
16872 // s:func script-local function name
16873 // g:func global function name, same as "func"
16874 p = eap->arg;
16875 name = trans_function_name(&p, eap->skip, 0, &fudi);
16876 paren = (vim_strchr(p, '(') != NULL((void*)0));
16877 if (name == NULL((void*)0) && (fudi.fd_dict == NULL((void*)0) || !paren) && !eap->skip) {
16878 /*
16879 * Return on an invalid expression in braces, unless the expression
16880 * evaluation has been cancelled due to an aborting error, an
16881 * interrupt, or an exception.
16882 */
16883 if (!aborting()) {
16884 if (!eap->skip && fudi.fd_newkey != NULL((void*)0))
16885 EMSG2(_(e_dictkey), fudi.fd_newkey)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_dictkey))), (char_u *)(fudi
.fd_newkey));
16886 free(fudi.fd_newkey);
16887 return;
16888 } else
16889 eap->skip = TRUE1;
16890 }
16891
16892 /* An error in a function call during evaluation of an expression in magic
16893 * braces should not cause the function not to be defined. */
16894 saved_did_emsg = did_emsg;
16895 did_emsg = FALSE0;
16896
16897 /*
16898 * ":function func" with only function name: list function.
16899 */
16900 if (!paren) {
16901 if (!ends_excmd(*skipwhite(p))) {
16902 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
16903 goto ret_free;
16904 }
16905 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(p);
16906 if (eap->nextcmd != NULL((void*)0))
16907 *p = NUL'\000';
16908 if (!eap->skip && !got_int) {
16909 fp = find_func(name);
16910 if (fp != NULL((void*)0)) {
16911 list_func_head(fp, TRUE1);
16912 for (int j = 0; j < fp->uf_lines.ga_len && !got_int; ++j) {
16913 if (FUNCLINE(fp, j)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[j] == NULL((void*)0))
16914 continue;
16915 msg_putchar('\n');
16916 msg_outnum((long)(j + 1));
16917 if (j < 9)
16918 msg_putchar(' ');
16919 if (j < 99)
16920 msg_putchar(' ');
16921 msg_prt_line(FUNCLINE(fp, j)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[j], FALSE0);
16922 out_flush(); /* show a line at a time */
16923 ui_breakcheck();
16924 }
16925 if (!got_int) {
16926 msg_putchar('\n');
16927 msg_puts((char_u *)" endfunction");
16928 }
16929 } else
16930 emsg_funcname(N_("E123: Undefined function: %s")"E123: Undefined function: %s", name);
16931 }
16932 goto ret_free;
16933 }
16934
16935 /*
16936 * ":function name(arg1, arg2)" Define function.
16937 */
16938 p = skipwhite(p);
16939 if (*p != '(') {
16940 if (!eap->skip) {
16941 EMSG2(_("E124: Missing '(': %s"), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E124: Missing '(': %s"))),
(char_u *)(eap->arg));
16942 goto ret_free;
16943 }
16944 /* attempt to continue by skipping some text */
16945 if (vim_strchr(p, '(') != NULL((void*)0))
16946 p = vim_strchr(p, '(');
16947 }
16948 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
16949
16950 ga_init(&newargs, (int)sizeof(char_u *), 3);
16951 ga_init(&newlines, (int)sizeof(char_u *), 3);
16952
16953 if (!eap->skip) {
16954 /* Check the name of the function. Unless it's a dictionary function
16955 * (that we are overwriting). */
16956 if (name != NULL((void*)0))
16957 arg = name;
16958 else
16959 arg = fudi.fd_newkey;
16960 if (arg != NULL((void*)0) && (fudi.fd_di == NULL((void*)0)
16961 || fudi.fd_di->di_tv.v_type != VAR_FUNC3)) {
16962 int j = (*arg == K_SPECIAL(0x80)) ? 3 : 0;
16963 while (arg[j] != NUL'\000' && (j == 0 ? eval_isnamec1(arg[j])
16964 : eval_isnamec(arg[j])))
16965 ++j;
16966 if (arg[j] != NUL'\000')
16967 emsg_funcname((char *)e_invarg2, arg);
16968 }
16969 /* Disallow using the g: dict. */
16970 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0) && fudi.fd_dict->dv_scope == VAR_DEF_SCOPE2)
16971 EMSG(_("E862: Cannot use g: here"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E862: Cannot use g: here"))
));
16972 }
16973
16974 /*
16975 * Isolate the arguments: "arg1, arg2, ...)"
16976 */
16977 while (*p != ')') {
16978 if (p[0] == '.' && p[1] == '.' && p[2] == '.') {
16979 varargs = TRUE1;
16980 p += 3;
16981 mustend = TRUE1;
16982 } else {
16983 arg = p;
16984 while (ASCII_ISALNUM(*p)((((unsigned)(*p) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(*p) - 'a' <
26)) || ((unsigned)(*p) - '0' < 10)) || *p == '_')
16985 ++p;
16986 if (arg == p || isdigit(*arg)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*arg))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISdigit)
16987 || (p - arg == 9 && STRNCMP(arg, "firstline", 9)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("firstline"), (size_t)(9)) == 0)
16988 || (p - arg == 8 && STRNCMP(arg, "lastline", 8)strncmp((char *)(arg), (char *)("lastline"), (size_t)(8)) == 0)) {
16989 if (!eap->skip)
16990 EMSG2(_("E125: Illegal argument: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E125: Illegal argument: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
16991 break;
16992 }
16993 ga_grow(&newargs, 1);
16994 c = *p;
16995 *p = NUL'\000';
16996 arg = vim_strsave(arg);
16997
16998 /* Check for duplicate argument name. */
16999 for (int i = 0; i < newargs.ga_len; ++i)
17000 if (STRCMP(((char_u **)(newargs.ga_data))[i], arg)strcmp((char *)(((char_u **)(newargs.ga_data))[i]), (char *)(
arg)) == 0) {
17001 EMSG2(_("E853: Duplicate argument name: %s"), arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E853: Duplicate argument name: %s"
))), (char_u *)(arg));
17002 free(arg);
17003 goto erret;
17004 }
17005
17006 ((char_u **)(newargs.ga_data))[newargs.ga_len] = arg;
17007 *p = c;
17008 newargs.ga_len++;
17009 if (*p == ',')
17010 ++p;
17011 else
