17012 mustend = TRUE1;
17013 }
17014 p = skipwhite(p);
17015 if (mustend && *p != ')') {
17016 if (!eap->skip)
17017 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(eap
->arg));
17018 break;
17019 }
17020 }
17021 ++p; /* skip the ')' */
17022
17023 /* find extra arguments "range", "dict" and "abort" */
17024 for (;; ) {
17025 p = skipwhite(p);
17026 if (STRNCMP(p, "range", 5)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("range"), (size_t)(5)) == 0) {
17027 flags |= FC_RANGE2;
17028 p += 5;
17029 } else if (STRNCMP(p, "dict", 4)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("dict"), (size_t)(4)) == 0) {
17030 flags |= FC_DICT4;
17031 p += 4;
17032 } else if (STRNCMP(p, "abort", 5)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("abort"), (size_t)(5)) == 0) {
17033 flags |= FC_ABORT1;
17034 p += 5;
17035 } else
17036 break;
17037 }
17038
17039 /* When there is a line break use what follows for the function body.
17040 * Makes 'exe "func Test()\n...\nendfunc"' work. */
17041 if (*p == '\n')
17042 line_arg = p + 1;
17043 else if (*p != NUL'\000' && *p != '"' && !eap->skip && !did_emsg)
17044 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
17045
17046 /*
17047 * Read the body of the function, until ":endfunction" is found.
17048 */
17049 if (KeyTyped) {
17050 /* Check if the function already exists, don't let the user type the
17051 * whole function before telling him it doesn't work! For a script we
17052 * need to skip the body to be able to find what follows. */
17053 if (!eap->skip && !eap->forceit) {
17054 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0) && fudi.fd_newkey == NULL((void*)0))
17055 EMSG(_(e_funcdict))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_funcdict))));
17056 else if (name != NULL((void*)0) && find_func(name) != NULL((void*)0))
17057 emsg_funcname(e_funcexts, name);
17058 }
17059
17060 if (!eap->skip && did_emsg)
17061 goto erret;
17062
17063 msg_putchar('\n'); /* don't overwrite the function name */
17064 cmdline_row = msg_row;
17065 }
17066
17067 indent = 2;
17068 nesting = 0;
17069 for (;; ) {
17070 if (KeyTyped) {
17071 msg_scroll = TRUE1;
17072 saved_wait_return = FALSE0;
17073 }
17074 need_wait_return = FALSE0;
17075 sourcing_lnum_off = sourcing_lnum;
17076
17077 if (line_arg != NULL((void*)0)) {
17078 /* Use eap->arg, split up in parts by line breaks. */
17079 theline = line_arg;
17080 p = vim_strchr(theline, '\n');
17081 if (p == NULL((void*)0))
17082 line_arg += STRLEN(line_arg)strlen((char *)(line_arg));
17083 else {
17084 *p = NUL'\000';
17085 line_arg = p + 1;
17086 }
17087 } else if (eap->getline == NULL((void*)0))
17088 theline = getcmdline(':', 0L, indent);
17089 else
17090 theline = eap->getline(':', eap->cookie, indent);
17091 if (KeyTyped)
17092 lines_left = Rows - 1;
17093 if (theline == NULL((void*)0)) {
17094 EMSG(_("E126: Missing :endfunction"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E126: Missing :endfunction"
))));
17095 goto erret;
17096 }
17097
17098 /* Detect line continuation: sourcing_lnum increased more than one. */
17099 if (sourcing_lnum > sourcing_lnum_off + 1)
17100 sourcing_lnum_off = sourcing_lnum - sourcing_lnum_off - 1;
17101 else
17102 sourcing_lnum_off = 0;
17103
17104 if (skip_until != NULL((void*)0)) {
17105 /* between ":append" and "." and between ":python <<EOF" and "EOF"
17106 * don't check for ":endfunc". */
17107 if (STRCMP(theline, skip_until)strcmp((char *)(theline), (char *)(skip_until)) == 0) {
17108 free(skip_until);
17109 skip_until = NULL((void*)0);
17110 }
17111 } else {
17112 /* skip ':' and blanks*/
17113 for (p = theline; vim_iswhite(*p)((*p) == ' ' || (*p) == '\t') || *p == ':'; ++p)
17114 ;
17115
17116 /* Check for "endfunction". */
17117 if (checkforcmd(&p, "endfunction", 4) && nesting-- == 0) {
17118 if (line_arg == NULL((void*)0))
17119 free(theline);
17120 break;
17121 }
17122
17123 /* Increase indent inside "if", "while", "for" and "try", decrease
17124 * at "end". */
17125 if (indent > 2 && STRNCMP(p, "end", 3)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("end"), (size_t)(3)) == 0)
17126 indent -= 2;
17127 else if (STRNCMP(p, "if", 2)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("if"), (size_t)(2)) == 0
17128 || STRNCMP(p, "wh", 2)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("wh"), (size_t)(2)) == 0
17129 || STRNCMP(p, "for", 3)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("for"), (size_t)(3)) == 0
17130 || STRNCMP(p, "try", 3)strncmp((char *)(p), (char *)("try"), (size_t)(3)) == 0)
17131 indent += 2;
17132
17133 /* Check for defining a function inside this function. */
17134 if (checkforcmd(&p, "function", 2)) {
17135 if (*p == '!')
17136 p = skipwhite(p + 1);
17137 p += eval_fname_script(p);
17138 if (ASCII_ISALPHA(*p)(((unsigned)(*p) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(*p) - 'a' <
26))) {
17139 free(trans_function_name(&p, TRUE1, 0, NULL((void*)0)));
17140 if (*skipwhite(p) == '(') {
17141 ++nesting;
17142 indent += 2;
17143 }
17144 }
17145 }
17146
17147 /* Check for ":append" or ":insert". */
17148 p = skip_range(p, NULL((void*)0));
17149 if ((p[0] == 'a' && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[1])(((unsigned)(p[1]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[1]) - 'a' <
26)) || p[1] == 'p'))
17150 || (p[0] == 'i'
17151 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[1])(((unsigned)(p[1]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[1]) - 'a' <
26)) || (p[1] == 'n'
17152 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'a' <
26)) ||
17153 (p[2] == 's'))))))
17154 skip_until = vim_strsave((char_u *)".");
17155
17156 /* Check for ":python <<EOF", ":tcl <<EOF", etc. */
17157 arg = skipwhite(skiptowhite(p));
17158 if (arg[0] == '<' && arg[1] =='<'
17159 && ((p[0] == 'p' && p[1] == 'y'
17160 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'a' <
26)) || p[2] == 't'))
17161 || (p[0] == 'p' && p[1] == 'e'
17162 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'a' <
26)) || p[2] == 'r'))
17163 || (p[0] == 't' && p[1] == 'c'
17164 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'a' <
26)) || p[2] == 'l'))
17165 || (p[0] == 'l' && p[1] == 'u' && p[2] == 'a'
17166 && !ASCII_ISALPHA(p[3])(((unsigned)(p[3]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[3]) - 'a' <
26)))
17167 || (p[0] == 'r' && p[1] == 'u' && p[2] == 'b'
17168 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[3])(((unsigned)(p[3]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[3]) - 'a' <
26)) || p[3] == 'y'))
17169 || (p[0] == 'm' && p[1] == 'z'
17170 && (!ASCII_ISALPHA(p[2])(((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'A' < 26) || ((unsigned)(p[2]) - 'a' <
26)) || p[2] == 's'))
17171 )) {
17172 /* ":python <<" continues until a dot, like ":append" */
17173 p = skipwhite(arg + 2);
17174 if (*p == NUL'\000')
17175 skip_until = vim_strsave((char_u *)".");
17176 else
17177 skip_until = vim_strsave(p);
17178 }
17179 }
17180
17181 /* Add the line to the function. */
17182 ga_grow(&newlines, 1 + sourcing_lnum_off);
17183
17184 /* Copy the line to newly allocated memory. get_one_sourceline()
17185 * allocates 250 bytes per line, this saves 80% on average. The cost
17186 * is an extra alloc/free. */
17187 p = vim_strsave(theline);
17188 if (line_arg == NULL((void*)0))
17189 free(theline);
17190 theline = p;
17191
17192 ((char_u **)(newlines.ga_data))[newlines.ga_len++] = theline;
17193
17194 /* Add NULL lines for continuation lines, so that the line count is
17195 * equal to the index in the growarray. */
17196 while (sourcing_lnum_off-- > 0)
17197 ((char_u **)(newlines.ga_data))[newlines.ga_len++] = NULL((void*)0);
17198
17199 /* Check for end of eap->arg. */
17200 if (line_arg != NULL((void*)0) && *line_arg == NUL'\000')
17201 line_arg = NULL((void*)0);
17202 }
17203
17204 /* Don't define the function when skipping commands or when an error was
17205 * detected. */
17206 if (eap->skip || did_emsg)
17207 goto erret;
17208
17209 /*
17210 * If there are no errors, add the function
17211 */
17212 if (fudi.fd_dict == NULL((void*)0)) {
17213 v = find_var(name, &ht, FALSE0);
17214 if (v != NULL((void*)0) && v->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FUNC3) {
17215 emsg_funcname(N_("E707: Function name conflicts with variable: %s")"E707: Function name conflicts with variable: %s",
17216 name);
17217 goto erret;
17218 }
17219
17220 fp = find_func(name);
17221 if (fp != NULL((void*)0)) {
17222 if (!eap->forceit) {
17223 emsg_funcname(e_funcexts, name);
17224 goto erret;
17225 }
17226 if (fp->uf_calls > 0) {
17227 emsg_funcname(N_("E127: Cannot redefine function %s: It is in use")"E127: Cannot redefine function %s: It is in use",
17228 name);
17229 goto erret;
17230 }
17231 /* redefine existing function */
17232 ga_clear_strings(&(fp->uf_args));
17233 ga_clear_strings(&(fp->uf_lines));
17234 free(name);
17235 name = NULL((void*)0);
17236 }
17237 } else {
17238 char numbuf[20];
17239
17240 fp = NULL((void*)0);
17241 if (fudi.fd_newkey == NULL((void*)0) && !eap->forceit) {
17242 EMSG(_(e_funcdict))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_funcdict))));
17243 goto erret;
17244 }
17245 if (fudi.fd_di == NULL((void*)0)) {
17246 /* Can't add a function to a locked dictionary */
17247 if (tv_check_lock(fudi.fd_dict->dv_lock, eap->arg))
17248 goto erret;
17249 }
17250 /* Can't change an existing function if it is locked */
17251 else if (tv_check_lock(fudi.fd_di->di_tv.v_lock, eap->arg))
17252 goto erret;
17253
17254 /* Give the function a sequential number. Can only be used with a
17255 * Funcref! */
17256 free(name);
17257 sprintf(numbuf, "%d", ++func_nr);
17258 name = vim_strsave((char_u *)numbuf);
17259 }
17260
17261 if (fp == NULL((void*)0)) {
17262 if (fudi.fd_dict == NULL((void*)0) && vim_strchr(name, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') != NULL((void*)0)) {
17263 int slen, plen;
17264 char_u *scriptname;
17265
17266 /* Check that the autoload name matches the script name. */
17267 int j = FAIL0;
17268 if (sourcing_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
17269 scriptname = autoload_name(name);
17270 p = vim_strchr(scriptname, '/');
17271 plen = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
17272 slen = (int)STRLEN(sourcing_name)strlen((char *)(sourcing_name));
17273 if (slen > plen && fnamecmp(p,vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)(sourcing_name + slen -
plen))
17274 sourcing_name + slen - plen)vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(p), (char_u *)(sourcing_name + slen -
plen)) == 0)
17275 j = OK1;
17276 free(scriptname);
17277 }
17278 if (j == FAIL0) {
17279 EMSG2(_(emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E746: Function name does not match script file name: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name))
17280 "E746: Function name does not match script file name: %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E746: Function name does not match script file name: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name))
17281 name)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E746: Function name does not match script file name: %s"
))), (char_u *)(name));
17282 goto erret;
17283 }
17284 }
17285
17286 fp = xmalloc(sizeof(ufunc_T) + STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)));
17287
17288 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
17289 if (fudi.fd_di == NULL((void*)0)) {
17290 /* add new dict entry */
17291 fudi.fd_di = dictitem_alloc(fudi.fd_newkey);
17292 if (dict_add(fudi.fd_dict, fudi.fd_di) == FAIL0) {
17293 free(fudi.fd_di);
17294 free(fp);
17295 goto erret;
17296 }
17297 } else
17298 /* overwrite existing dict entry */
17299 clear_tv(&fudi.fd_di->di_tv);
17300 fudi.fd_di->di_tv.v_type = VAR_FUNC3;
17301 fudi.fd_di->di_tv.v_lock = 0;
17302 fudi.fd_di->di_tv.vval.v_string = vim_strsave(name);
17303 fp->uf_refcount = 1;
17304
17305 /* behave like "dict" was used */
17306 flags |= FC_DICT4;
17307 }
17308
17309 /* insert the new function in the function list */
17310 STRCPY(fp->uf_name, name)strcpy((char *)(fp->uf_name), (char *)(name));
17311 hash_add(&func_hashtab, UF2HIKEY(fp)((fp)->uf_name));
17312 }
17313 fp->uf_args = newargs;
17314 fp->uf_lines = newlines;
17315 fp->uf_tml_count = NULL((void*)0);
17316 fp->uf_tml_total = NULL((void*)0);
17317 fp->uf_tml_self = NULL((void*)0);
17318 fp->uf_profiling = FALSE0;
17319 if (prof_def_func())
17320 func_do_profile(fp);
17321 fp->uf_varargs = varargs;
17322 fp->uf_flags = flags;
17323 fp->uf_calls = 0;
17324 fp->uf_script_ID = current_SID;
17325 goto ret_free;
17326
17327erret:
17328 ga_clear_strings(&newargs);
17329 ga_clear_strings(&newlines);
17330ret_free:
17331 free(skip_until);
17332 free(fudi.fd_newkey);
17333 free(name);
17334 did_emsg |= saved_did_emsg;
17335 need_wait_return |= saved_wait_return;
17336}
17337
17338/*
17339 * Get a function name, translating "<SID>" and "<SNR>".
17340 * Also handles a Funcref in a List or Dictionary.
17341 * Returns the function name in allocated memory, or NULL for failure.
17342 * flags:
17343 * TFN_INT: internal function name OK
17344 * TFN_QUIET: be quiet
17345 * TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD: do not use script autoloading
17346 * Advances "pp" to just after the function name (if no error).
17347 */
17348static char_u *
17349trans_function_name (
17350 char_u **pp,
17351 int skip, /* only find the end, don't evaluate */
17352 int flags,
17353 funcdict_T *fdp /* return: info about dictionary used */
17354)
17355{
17356 char_u *name = NULL((void*)0);
17357 char_u *start;
17358 char_u *end;
17359 int lead;
17360 char_u sid_buf[20];
17361 int len;
17362 lval_T lv;
17363
17364 if (fdp != NULL((void*)0))
17365 memset(fdp, 0, sizeof(funcdict_T));
17366 start = *pp;
17367
17368 /* Check for hard coded <SNR>: already translated function ID (from a user
17369 * command). */
17370 if ((*pp)[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80) && (*pp)[1] == KS_EXTRA253
17371 && (*pp)[2] == (int)KE_SNR) {
17372 *pp += 3;
17373 len = get_id_len(pp) + 3;
17374 return vim_strnsave(start, len);
17375 }
17376
17377 /* A name starting with "<SID>" or "<SNR>" is local to a script. But
17378 * don't skip over "s:", get_lval() needs it for "s:dict.func". */
17379 lead = eval_fname_script(start);
17380 if (lead > 2)
17381 start += lead;
17382
17383 /* Note that TFN_ flags use the same values as GLV_ flags. */
17384 end = get_lval(start, NULL((void*)0), &lv, FALSE0, skip, flags,
17385 lead > 2 ? 0 : FNE_CHECK_START2);
17386 if (end == start) {
17387 if (!skip)
17388 EMSG(_("E129: Function name required"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E129: Function name required"
))));
17389 goto theend;
17390 }
17391 if (end == NULL((void*)0) || (lv.ll_tv != NULL((void*)0) && (lead > 2 || lv.ll_range))) {
17392 /*
17393 * Report an invalid expression in braces, unless the expression
17394 * evaluation has been cancelled due to an aborting error, an
17395 * interrupt, or an exception.
17396 */
17397 if (!aborting()) {
17398 if (end != NULL((void*)0))
17399 EMSG2(_(e_invarg2), start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_invarg2))), (char_u *)(start
));
17400 } else
17401 *pp = find_name_end(start, NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), FNE_INCL_BR1);
17402 goto theend;
17403 }
17404
17405 if (lv.ll_tv != NULL((void*)0)) {
17406 if (fdp != NULL((void*)0)) {
17407 fdp->fd_dict = lv.ll_dict;
17408 fdp->fd_newkey = lv.ll_newkey;
17409 lv.ll_newkey = NULL((void*)0);
17410 fdp->fd_di = lv.ll_di;
17411 }
17412 if (lv.ll_tv->v_type == VAR_FUNC3 && lv.ll_tv->vval.v_string != NULL((void*)0)) {
17413 name = vim_strsave(lv.ll_tv->vval.v_string);
17414 *pp = end;
17415 } else {
17416 if (!skip && !(flags & TFN_QUIET2) && (fdp == NULL((void*)0)
17417 || lv.ll_dict == NULL((void*)0) ||
17418 fdp->fd_newkey == NULL((void*)0)))
17419 EMSG(_(e_funcref))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_funcref))));
17420 else
17421 *pp = end;
17422 name = NULL((void*)0);
17423 }
17424 goto theend;
17425 }
17426
17427 if (lv.ll_name == NULL((void*)0)) {
17428 /* Error found, but continue after the function name. */
17429 *pp = end;
17430 goto theend;
17431 }
17432
17433 /* Check if the name is a Funcref. If so, use the value. */
17434 if (lv.ll_exp_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
17435 len = (int)STRLEN(lv.ll_exp_name)strlen((char *)(lv.ll_exp_name));
17436 name = deref_func_name(lv.ll_exp_name, &len, flags & TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD4);
17437 if (name == lv.ll_exp_name)
17438 name = NULL((void*)0);
17439 } else {
17440 len = (int)(end - *pp);
17441 name = deref_func_name(*pp, &len, flags & TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD4);
17442 if (name == *pp)
17443 name = NULL((void*)0);
17444 }
17445 if (name != NULL((void*)0)) {
17446 name = vim_strsave(name);
17447 *pp = end;
17448 if (strncmp((char *)name, "<SNR>", 5) == 0) {
17449 // Change "<SNR>" to the byte sequence.
17450 name[0] = K_SPECIAL(0x80);
17451 name[1] = KS_EXTRA253;
17452 name[2] = (int)KE_SNR;
17453 memmove(name + 3, name + 5, strlen((char *)name + 5) + 1);
17454 }
17455 goto theend;
17456 }
17457
17458 if (lv.ll_exp_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
17459 len = (int)STRLEN(lv.ll_exp_name)strlen((char *)(lv.ll_exp_name));
17460 if (lead <= 2 && lv.ll_name == lv.ll_exp_name
17461 && STRNCMP(lv.ll_name, "s:", 2)strncmp((char *)(lv.ll_name), (char *)("s:"), (size_t)(2)) == 0) {
17462 /* When there was "s:" already or the name expanded to get a
17463 * leading "s:" then remove it. */
17464 lv.ll_name += 2;
17465 len -= 2;
17466 lead = 2;
17467 }
17468 } else {
17469 // Skip over "s:" and "g:".
17470 if (lead == 2 || (lv.ll_name[0] == 'g' && lv.ll_name[1] == ':')) {
17471 lv.ll_name += 2;
17472 }
17473 len = (int)(end - lv.ll_name);
17474 }
17475
17476 /*
17477 * Copy the function name to allocated memory.
17478 * Accept <SID>name() inside a script, translate into <SNR>123_name().
17479 * Accept <SNR>123_name() outside a script.
17480 */
17481 if (skip)
17482 lead = 0; /* do nothing */
17483 else if (lead > 0) {
17484 lead = 3;
17485 if ((lv.ll_exp_name != NULL((void*)0) && eval_fname_sid(lv.ll_exp_name))
17486 || eval_fname_sid(*pp)) {
17487 /* It's "s:" or "<SID>" */
17488 if (current_SID <= 0) {
17489 EMSG(_(e_usingsid))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_usingsid))));
17490 goto theend;
17491 }
17492 sprintf((char *)sid_buf, "%" PRId64"l" "d" "_", (int64_t)current_SID);
17493 lead += (int)STRLEN(sid_buf)strlen((char *)(sid_buf));
17494 }
17495 } else if (!(flags & TFN_INT1) && builtin_function(lv.ll_name, len)) {
17496 EMSG2(_("E128: Function name must start with a capital or \"s:\": %s"),emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E128: Function name must start with a capital or \"s:\": %s"
))), (char_u *)(start))
17497 start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E128: Function name must start with a capital or \"s:\": %s"
))), (char_u *)(start));
17498 goto theend;
17499 }
17500
17501 if (!skip && !(flags & TFN_QUIET2)) {
17502 char_u *cp = vim_strchr(lv.ll_name, ':');
17503
17504 if (cp != NULL((void*)0) && cp < end) {
17505 EMSG2(_("E884: Function name cannot contain a colon: %s"), start)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E884: Function name cannot contain a colon: %s"
))), (char_u *)(start));
17506 goto theend;
17507 }
17508 }
17509
17510 name = xmalloc(len + lead + 1);
17511 if (lead > 0){
17512 name[0] = K_SPECIAL(0x80);
17513 name[1] = KS_EXTRA253;
17514 name[2] = (int)KE_SNR;
17515 if (lead > 3) /* If it's "<SID>" */
17516 STRCPY(name + 3, sid_buf)strcpy((char *)(name + 3), (char *)(sid_buf));
17517 }
17518 memmove(name + lead, lv.ll_name, (size_t)len);
17519 name[lead + len] = NUL'\000';
17520 *pp = end;
17521
17522theend:
17523 clear_lval(&lv);
17524 return name;
17525}
17526
17527/*
17528 * Return 5 if "p" starts with "<SID>" or "<SNR>" (ignoring case).
17529 * Return 2 if "p" starts with "s:".
17530 * Return 0 otherwise.
17531 */
17532static int eval_fname_script(char_u *p)
17533{
17534 if (p[0] == '<' && (STRNICMP(p + 1, "SID>", 4)strncasecmp((char *)(p + 1), (char *)("SID>"), (size_t)(4)
) == 0
17535 || STRNICMP(p + 1, "SNR>", 4)strncasecmp((char *)(p + 1), (char *)("SNR>"), (size_t)(4)
) == 0))
17536 return 5;
17537 if (p[0] == 's' && p[1] == ':')
17538 return 2;
17539 return 0;
17540}
17541
17542/*
17543 * Return TRUE if "p" starts with "<SID>" or "s:".
17544 * Only works if eval_fname_script() returned non-zero for "p"!
17545 */
17546static int eval_fname_sid(char_u *p)
17547{
17548 return *p == 's' || TOUPPER_ASC(p[2])(((p[2]) < 'a' || (p[2]) > 'z') ? (p[2]) : (p[2]) - ('a'
- 'A')) == 'I';
17549}
17550
17551/*
17552 * List the head of the function: "name(arg1, arg2)".
17553 */
17554static void list_func_head(ufunc_T *fp, int indent)
17555{
17556 msg_start();
17557 if (indent)
17558 MSG_PUTS(" ")msg_puts((char_u *)(" "));
17559 MSG_PUTS("function ")msg_puts((char_u *)("function "));
17560 if (fp->uf_name[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80)) {
17561 MSG_PUTS_ATTR("<SNR>", hl_attr(HLF_8))msg_puts_attr((char_u *)("<SNR>"), (highlight_attr[(int
)(HLF_8)]));
17562 msg_puts(fp->uf_name + 3);
17563 } else
17564 msg_puts(fp->uf_name);
17565 msg_putchar('(');
17566 int j;
17567 for (j = 0; j < fp->uf_args.ga_len; ++j) {
17568 if (j)
17569 MSG_PUTS(", ")msg_puts((char_u *)(", "));
17570 msg_puts(FUNCARG(fp, j)((char_u **)(fp->uf_args.ga_data))[j]);
17571 }
17572 if (fp->uf_varargs) {
17573 if (j)
17574 MSG_PUTS(", ")msg_puts((char_u *)(", "));
17575 MSG_PUTS("...")msg_puts((char_u *)("..."));
17576 }
17577 msg_putchar(')');
17578 if (fp->uf_flags & FC_ABORT1)
17579 MSG_PUTS(" abort")msg_puts((char_u *)(" abort"));
17580 if (fp->uf_flags & FC_RANGE2)
17581 MSG_PUTS(" range")msg_puts((char_u *)(" range"));
17582 if (fp->uf_flags & FC_DICT4)
17583 MSG_PUTS(" dict")msg_puts((char_u *)(" dict"));
17584 msg_clr_eos();
17585 if (p_verbose > 0)
17586 last_set_msg(fp->uf_script_ID);
17587}
17588
17589/*
17590 * Find a function by name, return pointer to it in ufuncs.
17591 * Return NULL for unknown function.
17592 */
17593static ufunc_T *find_func(char_u *name)
17594{
17595 hashitem_T *hi;
17596
17597 hi = hash_find(&func_hashtab, name);
17598 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
17599 return HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)));
17600 return NULL((void*)0);
17601}
17602
17603#if defined(EXITFREE) || defined(PROTO)
17604void free_all_functions(void)
17605{
17606 hashitem_T *hi;
17607
17608 /* Need to start all over every time, because func_free() may change the
17609 * hash table. */
17610 while (func_hashtab.ht_used > 0)
17611 for (hi = func_hashtab.ht_array;; ++hi)
17612 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
17613 func_free(HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf))));
17614 break;
17615 }
17616}
17617
17618#endif
17619
17620int translated_function_exists(char_u *name)
17621{
17622 if (builtin_function(name, -1)) {
17623 return find_internal_func(name) >= 0;
17624 }
17625 return find_func(name) != NULL((void*)0);
17626}
17627
17628/*
17629 * Return TRUE if a function "name" exists.
17630 */
17631static int function_exists(char_u *name)
17632{
17633 char_u *nm = name;
17634 char_u *p;
17635 int n = FALSE0;
17636
17637 p = trans_function_name(&nm, FALSE0, TFN_INT1|TFN_QUIET2|TFN_NO_AUTOLOAD4,
17638 NULL((void*)0));
17639 nm = skipwhite(nm);
17640
17641 /* Only accept "funcname", "funcname ", "funcname (..." and
17642 * "funcname(...", not "funcname!...". */
17643 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && (*nm == NUL'\000' || *nm == '('))
17644 n = translated_function_exists(p);
17645 free(p);
17646 return n;
17647}
17648
17649char_u *get_expanded_name(char_u *name, int check)
17650{
17651 char_u *nm = name;
17652 char_u *p;
17653
17654 p = trans_function_name(&nm, FALSE0, TFN_INT1|TFN_QUIET2, NULL((void*)0));
17655
17656 if (p != NULL((void*)0) && *nm == NUL'\000')
17657 if (!check || translated_function_exists(p))
17658 return p;
17659
17660 free(p);
17661 return NULL((void*)0);
17662}
17663
17664/// Return TRUE if "name" looks like a builtin function name: starts with a
17665/// lower case letter and doesn't contain AUTOLOAD_CHAR.
17666/// "len" is the length of "name", or -1 for NUL terminated.
17667static bool_Bool builtin_function(char_u *name, int len)
17668{
17669 if (!ASCII_ISLOWER(name[0])((unsigned)(name[0]) - 'a' < 26)) {
17670 return FALSE0;
17671 }
17672
17673 char_u *p = vim_strchr(name, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#');
17674
17675 return p == NULL((void*)0)
17676 || (len > 0 && p > name + len);
17677}
17678
17679/*
17680 * Start profiling function "fp".
17681 */
17682static void func_do_profile(ufunc_T *fp)
17683{
17684 int len = fp->uf_lines.ga_len;
17685
17686 if (len == 0)
17687 len = 1; /* avoid getting error for allocating zero bytes */
17688 fp->uf_tm_count = 0;
17689 fp->uf_tm_self = profile_zero();
17690 fp->uf_tm_total = profile_zero();
17691
17692 if (fp->uf_tml_count == NULL((void*)0)) {
17693 fp->uf_tml_count = xcalloc(len, sizeof(int));
17694 }
17695
17696 if (fp->uf_tml_total == NULL((void*)0)) {
17697 fp->uf_tml_total = xcalloc(len, sizeof(proftime_T));
17698 }
17699
17700 if (fp->uf_tml_self == NULL((void*)0)) {
17701 fp->uf_tml_self = xcalloc(len, sizeof(proftime_T));
17702 }
17703
17704 fp->uf_tml_idx = -1;
17705
17706 fp->uf_profiling = TRUE1;
17707}
17708
17709/*
17710 * Dump the profiling results for all functions in file "fd".
17711 */
17712void func_dump_profile(FILE *fd)
17713{
17714 hashitem_T *hi;
17715 int todo;
17716 ufunc_T *fp;
17717 ufunc_T **sorttab;
17718 int st_len = 0;
17719
17720 todo = (int)func_hashtab.ht_used;
17721 if (todo == 0)
17722 return; /* nothing to dump */
17723
17724 sorttab = xmalloc(sizeof(ufunc_T) * todo);
17725
17726 for (hi = func_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
17727 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
17728 --todo;
17729 fp = HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)));
17730 if (fp->uf_profiling) {
17731 if (sorttab != NULL((void*)0))
17732 sorttab[st_len++] = fp;
17733
17734 if (fp->uf_name[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80))
17735 fprintf(fd, "FUNCTION <SNR>%s()\n", fp->uf_name + 3);
17736 else
17737 fprintf(fd, "FUNCTION %s()\n", fp->uf_name);
17738 if (fp->uf_tm_count == 1)
17739 fprintf(fd, "Called 1 time\n");
17740 else
17741 fprintf(fd, "Called %d times\n", fp->uf_tm_count);
17742 fprintf(fd, "Total time: %s\n", profile_msg(fp->uf_tm_total));
17743 fprintf(fd, " Self time: %s\n", profile_msg(fp->uf_tm_self));
17744 fprintf(fd, "\n");
17745 fprintf(fd, "count total (s) self (s)\n");
17746
17747 for (int i = 0; i < fp->uf_lines.ga_len; ++i) {
17748 if (FUNCLINE(fp, i)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[i] == NULL((void*)0))
17749 continue;
17750 prof_func_line(fd, fp->uf_tml_count[i],
17751 &fp->uf_tml_total[i], &fp->uf_tml_self[i], TRUE1);
17752 fprintf(fd, "%s\n", FUNCLINE(fp, i)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[i]);
17753 }
17754 fprintf(fd, "\n");
17755 }
17756 }
17757 }
17758
17759 if (sorttab != NULL((void*)0) && st_len > 0) {
17760 qsort((void *)sorttab, (size_t)st_len, sizeof(ufunc_T *),
17761 prof_total_cmp);
17762 prof_sort_list(fd, sorttab, st_len, "TOTAL", FALSE0);
17763 qsort((void *)sorttab, (size_t)st_len, sizeof(ufunc_T *),
17764 prof_self_cmp);
17765 prof_sort_list(fd, sorttab, st_len, "SELF", TRUE1);
17766 }
17767
17768 free(sorttab);
17769}
17770
17771static void
17772prof_sort_list (
17773 FILE *fd,
17774 ufunc_T **sorttab,
17775 int st_len,
17776 char *title,
17777 int prefer_self /* when equal print only self time */
17778)
17779{
17780 int i;
17781 ufunc_T *fp;
17782
17783 fprintf(fd, "FUNCTIONS SORTED ON %s TIME\n", title);
17784 fprintf(fd, "count total (s) self (s) function\n");
17785 for (i = 0; i < 20 && i < st_len; ++i) {
17786 fp = sorttab[i];
17787 prof_func_line(fd, fp->uf_tm_count, &fp->uf_tm_total, &fp->uf_tm_self,
17788 prefer_self);
17789 if (fp->uf_name[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80))
17790 fprintf(fd, " <SNR>%s()\n", fp->uf_name + 3);
17791 else
17792 fprintf(fd, " %s()\n", fp->uf_name);
17793 }
17794 fprintf(fd, "\n");
17795}
17796
17797/*
17798 * Print the count and times for one function or function line.
17799 */
17800static void prof_func_line(
17801 FILE *fd,
17802 int count,
17803 proftime_T *total,
17804 proftime_T *self,
17805 int prefer_self /* when equal print only self time */
17806 )
17807{
17808 if (count > 0) {
17809 fprintf(fd, "%5d ", count);
17810 if (prefer_self && profile_equal(*total, *self))
17811 fprintf(fd, " ");
17812 else
17813 fprintf(fd, "%s ", profile_msg(*total));
17814 if (!prefer_self && profile_equal(*total, *self))
17815 fprintf(fd, " ");
17816 else
17817 fprintf(fd, "%s ", profile_msg(*self));
17818 } else
17819 fprintf(fd, " ");
17820}
17821
17822/*
17823 * Compare function for total time sorting.
17824 */
17825static int prof_total_cmp(const void *s1, const void *s2)
17826{
17827 ufunc_T *p1 = *(ufunc_T **)s1;
17828 ufunc_T *p2 = *(ufunc_T **)s2;
17829 return profile_cmp(p1->uf_tm_total, p2->uf_tm_total);
17830}
17831
17832/*
17833 * Compare function for self time sorting.
17834 */
17835static int prof_self_cmp(const void *s1, const void *s2)
17836{
17837 ufunc_T *p1 = *(ufunc_T **)s1;
17838 ufunc_T *p2 = *(ufunc_T **)s2;
17839 return profile_cmp(p1->uf_tm_self, p2->uf_tm_self);
17840}
17841
17842
17843/*
17844 * If "name" has a package name try autoloading the script for it.
17845 * Return TRUE if a package was loaded.
17846 */
17847static int
17848script_autoload (
17849 char_u *name,
17850 int reload /* load script again when already loaded */
17851)
17852{
17853 char_u *p;
17854 char_u *scriptname, *tofree;
17855 int ret = FALSE0;
17856 int i;
17857
17858 /* If there is no '#' after name[0] there is no package name. */
17859 p = vim_strchr(name, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#');
17860 if (p == NULL((void*)0) || p == name)
17861 return FALSE0;
17862
17863 tofree = scriptname = autoload_name(name);
17864
17865 /* Find the name in the list of previously loaded package names. Skip
17866 * "autoload/", it's always the same. */
17867 for (i = 0; i < ga_loaded.ga_len; ++i)
17868 if (STRCMP(((char_u **)ga_loaded.ga_data)[i] + 9, scriptname + 9)strcmp((char *)(((char_u **)ga_loaded.ga_data)[i] + 9), (char
*)(scriptname + 9)) == 0)
17869 break;
17870 if (!reload && i < ga_loaded.ga_len)
17871 ret = FALSE0; /* was loaded already */
17872 else {
17873 /* Remember the name if it wasn't loaded already. */
17874 if (i == ga_loaded.ga_len) {
17875 GA_APPEND(char_u *, &ga_loaded, scriptname)do { ga_grow(&ga_loaded, 1); ((char_u * *)(&ga_loaded
)->ga_data)[(&ga_loaded)->ga_len++] = (scriptname);
} while (0);
17876 tofree = NULL((void*)0);
17877 }
17878
17879 /* Try loading the package from $VIMRUNTIME/autoload/<name>.vim */
17880 if (source_runtime(scriptname, FALSE0) == OK1)
17881 ret = TRUE1;
17882 }
17883
17884 free(tofree);
17885 return ret;
17886}
17887
17888/*
17889 * Return the autoload script name for a function or variable name.
17890 */
17891static char_u *autoload_name(char_u *name)
17892{
17893 /* Get the script file name: replace '#' with '/', append ".vim". */
17894 char_u *scriptname = xmalloc(STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)) + 14);
17895 STRCPY(scriptname, "autoload/")strcpy((char *)(scriptname), (char *)("autoload/"));
17896 STRCAT(scriptname, name)strcat((char *)(scriptname), (char *)(name));
17897 *vim_strrchr(scriptname, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#') = NUL'\000';
17898 STRCAT(scriptname, ".vim")strcat((char *)(scriptname), (char *)(".vim"));
17899
17900 char_u *p;
17901 while ((p = vim_strchr(scriptname, AUTOLOAD_CHAR'#')) != NULL((void*)0))
17902 *p = '/';
17903
17904 return scriptname;
17905}
17906
17907
17908/*
17909 * Function given to ExpandGeneric() to obtain the list of user defined
17910 * function names.
17911 */
17912char_u *get_user_func_name(expand_T *xp, int idx)
17913{
17914 static long_u done;
17915 static hashitem_T *hi;
17916 ufunc_T *fp;
17917
17918 if (idx == 0) {
17919 done = 0;
17920 hi = func_hashtab.ht_array;
17921 }
17922 if (done < func_hashtab.ht_used) {
17923 if (done++ > 0)
17924 ++hi;
17925 while (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
17926 ++hi;
17927 fp = HI2UF(hi)((ufunc_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumuf.uf_name - (char_u *)&
dumuf)));
17928
17929 if (fp->uf_flags & FC_DICT4)
17930 return (char_u *)""; /* don't show dict functions */
17931
17932 if (STRLEN(fp->uf_name)strlen((char *)(fp->uf_name)) + 4 >= IOSIZE(1024+1))
17933 return fp->uf_name; /* prevents overflow */
17934
17935 cat_func_name(IObuff, fp);
17936 if (xp->xp_context != EXPAND_USER_FUNC) {
17937 STRCAT(IObuff, "(")strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("("));
17938 if (!fp->uf_varargs && GA_EMPTY(&fp->uf_args)((&fp->uf_args)->ga_len <= 0))
17939 STRCAT(IObuff, ")")strcat((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(")"));
17940 }
17941 return IObuff;
17942 }
17943 return NULL((void*)0);
17944}
17945
17946
17947/*
17948 * Copy the function name of "fp" to buffer "buf".
17949 * "buf" must be able to hold the function name plus three bytes.
17950 * Takes care of script-local function names.
17951 */
17952static void cat_func_name(char_u *buf, ufunc_T *fp)
17953{
17954 if (fp->uf_name[0] == K_SPECIAL(0x80)) {
17955 STRCPY(buf, "<SNR>")strcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)("<SNR>"));
17956 STRCAT(buf, fp->uf_name + 3)strcat((char *)(buf), (char *)(fp->uf_name + 3));
17957 } else
17958 STRCPY(buf, fp->uf_name)strcpy((char *)(buf), (char *)(fp->uf_name));
17959}
17960
17961/*
17962 * ":delfunction {name}"
17963 */
17964void ex_delfunction(exarg_T *eap)
17965{
17966 ufunc_T *fp = NULL((void*)0);
17967 char_u *p;
17968 char_u *name;
17969 funcdict_T fudi;
17970
17971 p = eap->arg;
17972 name = trans_function_name(&p, eap->skip, 0, &fudi);
17973 free(fudi.fd_newkey);
17974 if (name == NULL((void*)0)) {
17975 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0) && !eap->skip)
17976 EMSG(_(e_funcref))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_funcref))));
17977 return;
17978 }
17979 if (!ends_excmd(*skipwhite(p))) {
17980 free(name);
17981 EMSG(_(e_trailing))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_trailing))));
17982 return;
17983 }
17984 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(p);
17985 if (eap->nextcmd != NULL((void*)0))
17986 *p = NUL'\000';
17987
17988 if (!eap->skip)
17989 fp = find_func(name);
17990 free(name);
17991
17992 if (!eap->skip) {
17993 if (fp == NULL((void*)0)) {
17994 EMSG2(_(e_nofunc), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_nofunc))), (char_u *)(eap
->arg));
17995 return;
17996 }
17997 if (fp->uf_calls > 0) {
17998 EMSG2(_("E131: Cannot delete function %s: It is in use"), eap->arg)emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E131: Cannot delete function %s: It is in use"
))), (char_u *)(eap->arg));
17999 return;
18000 }
18001
18002 if (fudi.fd_dict != NULL((void*)0)) {
18003 /* Delete the dict item that refers to the function, it will
18004 * invoke func_unref() and possibly delete the function. */
18005 dictitem_remove(fudi.fd_dict, fudi.fd_di);
18006 } else
18007 func_free(fp);
18008 }
18009}
18010
18011/*
18012 * Free a function and remove it from the list of functions.
18013 */
18014static void func_free(ufunc_T *fp)
18015{
18016 hashitem_T *hi;
18017
18018 /* clear this function */
18019 ga_clear_strings(&(fp->uf_args));
18020 ga_clear_strings(&(fp->uf_lines));
18021 free(fp->uf_tml_count);
18022 free(fp->uf_tml_total);
18023 free(fp->uf_tml_self);
18024
18025 /* remove the function from the function hashtable */
18026 hi = hash_find(&func_hashtab, UF2HIKEY(fp)((fp)->uf_name));
18027 if (HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
))
18028 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "func_free()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("func_free()"
));
18029 else
18030 hash_remove(&func_hashtab, hi);
18031
18032 free(fp);
18033}
18034
18035/*
18036 * Unreference a Function: decrement the reference count and free it when it
18037 * becomes zero. Only for numbered functions.
18038 */
18039void func_unref(char_u *name)
18040{
18041 ufunc_T *fp;
18042
18043 if (name != NULL((void*)0) && isdigit(*name)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*name))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISdigit)) {
18044 fp = find_func(name);
18045 if (fp == NULL((void*)0))
18046 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "func_unref()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("func_unref()"
));
18047 else if (--fp->uf_refcount <= 0) {
18048 /* Only delete it when it's not being used. Otherwise it's done
18049 * when "uf_calls" becomes zero. */
18050 if (fp->uf_calls == 0)
18051 func_free(fp);
18052 }
18053 }
18054}
18055
18056/*
18057 * Count a reference to a Function.
18058 */
18059void func_ref(char_u *name)
18060{
18061 ufunc_T *fp;
18062
18063 if (name != NULL((void*)0) && isdigit(*name)((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((*name))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISdigit)) {
18064 fp = find_func(name);
18065 if (fp == NULL((void*)0))
18066 EMSG2(_(e_intern2), "func_ref()")emsg2((char_u *)(gettext((char *)(e_intern2))), (char_u *)("func_ref()"
));
18067 else
18068 ++fp->uf_refcount;
18069 }
18070}
18071
18072/*
18073 * Call a user function.
18074 */
18075static void
18076call_user_func (
18077 ufunc_T *fp, /* pointer to function */
18078 int argcount, /* nr of args */
18079 typval_T *argvars, /* arguments */
18080 typval_T *rettv, /* return value */
18081 linenr_T firstline, /* first line of range */
18082 linenr_T lastline, /* last line of range */
18083 dict_T *selfdict /* Dictionary for "self" */
18084)
18085{
18086 char_u *save_sourcing_name;
18087 linenr_T save_sourcing_lnum;
18088 scid_T save_current_SID;
18089 funccall_T *fc;
18090 int save_did_emsg;
18091 static int depth = 0;
18092 dictitem_T *v;
18093 int fixvar_idx = 0; /* index in fixvar[] */
18094 int ai;
18095 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
18096 char_u *name;
18097 proftime_T wait_start;
18098 proftime_T call_start;
18099
18100 /* If depth of calling is getting too high, don't execute the function */
18101 if (depth >= p_mfd) {
18102 EMSG(_("E132: Function call depth is higher than 'maxfuncdepth'"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E132: Function call depth is higher than 'maxfuncdepth'"
))));
18103 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
18104 rettv->vval.v_number = -1;
18105 return;
18106 }
18107 ++depth;
18108
18109 line_breakcheck(); /* check for CTRL-C hit */
18110
18111 fc = xmalloc(sizeof(funccall_T));
18112 fc->caller = current_funccal;
18113 current_funccal = fc;
18114 fc->func = fp;
18115 fc->rettv = rettv;
18116 rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
18117 fc->linenr = 0;
18118 fc->returned = FALSE0;
18119 fc->level = ex_nesting_level;
18120 /* Check if this function has a breakpoint. */
18121 fc->breakpoint = dbg_find_breakpoint(FALSE0, fp->uf_name, (linenr_T)0);
18122 fc->dbg_tick = debug_tick;
18123
18124 /*
18125 * Note about using fc->fixvar[]: This is an array of FIXVAR_CNT variables
18126 * with names up to VAR_SHORT_LEN long. This avoids having to alloc/free
18127 * each argument variable and saves a lot of time.
18128 */
18129 /*
18130 * Init l: variables.
18131 */
18132 init_var_dict(&fc->l_vars, &fc->l_vars_var, VAR_DEF_SCOPE2);
18133 if (selfdict != NULL((void*)0)) {
18134 /* Set l:self to "selfdict". Use "name" to avoid a warning from
18135 * some compiler that checks the destination size. */
18136 v = &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var;
18137 name = v->di_key;
18138 STRCPY(name, "self")strcpy((char *)(name), (char *)("self"));
18139 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 + DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
18140 hash_add(&fc->l_vars.dv_hashtab, DI2HIKEY(v)((v)->di_key));
18141 v->di_tv.v_type = VAR_DICT5;
18142 v->di_tv.v_lock = 0;
18143 v->di_tv.vval.v_dict = selfdict;
18144 ++selfdict->dv_refcount;
18145 }
18146
18147 /*
18148 * Init a: variables.
18149 * Set a:0 to "argcount".
18150 * Set a:000 to a list with room for the "..." arguments.
18151 */
18152 init_var_dict(&fc->l_avars, &fc->l_avars_var, VAR_SCOPE1);
18153 add_nr_var(&fc->l_avars, &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var, "0",
18154 (varnumber_T)(argcount - fp->uf_args.ga_len));
18155 /* Use "name" to avoid a warning from some compiler that checks the
18156 * destination size. */
18157 v = &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var;
18158 name = v->di_key;
18159 STRCPY(name, "000")strcpy((char *)(name), (char *)("000"));
18160 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
18161 hash_add(&fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab, DI2HIKEY(v)((v)->di_key));
18162 v->di_tv.v_type = VAR_LIST4;
18163 v->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
18164 v->di_tv.vval.v_list = &fc->l_varlist;
18165 memset(&fc->l_varlist, 0, sizeof(list_T));
18166 fc->l_varlist.lv_refcount = DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999;
18167 fc->l_varlist.lv_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
18168
18169 /*
18170 * Set a:firstline to "firstline" and a:lastline to "lastline".
18171 * Set a:name to named arguments.
18172 * Set a:N to the "..." arguments.
18173 */
18174 add_nr_var(&fc->l_avars, &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var, "firstline",
18175 (varnumber_T)firstline);
18176 add_nr_var(&fc->l_avars, &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var, "lastline",
18177 (varnumber_T)lastline);
18178 for (int i = 0; i < argcount; ++i) {
18179 ai = i - fp->uf_args.ga_len;
18180 if (ai < 0)
18181 /* named argument a:name */
18182 name = FUNCARG(fp, i)((char_u **)(fp->uf_args.ga_data))[i];
18183 else {
18184 /* "..." argument a:1, a:2, etc. */
18185 sprintf((char *)numbuf, "%d", ai + 1);
18186 name = numbuf;
18187 }
18188 if (fixvar_idx < FIXVAR_CNT12 && STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)) <= VAR_SHORT_LEN20) {
18189 v = &fc->fixvar[fixvar_idx++].var;
18190 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
18191 } else {
18192 v = xmalloc(sizeof(dictitem_T) + STRLEN(name)strlen((char *)(name)));
18193 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1;
18194 }
18195 STRCPY(v->di_key, name)strcpy((char *)(v->di_key), (char *)(name));
18196 hash_add(&fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab, DI2HIKEY(v)((v)->di_key));
18197
18198 /* Note: the values are copied directly to avoid alloc/free.
18199 * "argvars" must have VAR_FIXED for v_lock. */
18200 v->di_tv = argvars[i];
18201 v->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
18202
18203 if (ai >= 0 && ai < MAX_FUNC_ARGS20) {
18204 list_append(&fc->l_varlist, &fc->l_listitems[ai]);
18205 fc->l_listitems[ai].li_tv = argvars[i];
18206 fc->l_listitems[ai].li_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
18207 }
18208 }
18209
18210 /* Don't redraw while executing the function. */
18211 ++RedrawingDisabled;
18212 save_sourcing_name = sourcing_name;
18213 save_sourcing_lnum = sourcing_lnum;
18214 sourcing_lnum = 1;
18215 sourcing_name = xmalloc((save_sourcing_name == NULL((void*)0) ? 0 : STRLEN(save_sourcing_name)strlen((char *)(save_sourcing_name)))
18216 + STRLEN(fp->uf_name)strlen((char *)(fp->uf_name)) + 13);
18217 {
18218 if (save_sourcing_name != NULL((void*)0)
18219 && STRNCMP(save_sourcing_name, "function ", 9)strncmp((char *)(save_sourcing_name), (char *)("function "), (
size_t)(9)) == 0)
18220 sprintf((char *)sourcing_name, "%s..", save_sourcing_name);
18221 else
18222 STRCPY(sourcing_name, "function ")strcpy((char *)(sourcing_name), (char *)("function "));
18223 cat_func_name(sourcing_name + STRLEN(sourcing_name)strlen((char *)(sourcing_name)), fp);
18224
18225 if (p_verbose >= 12) {
18226 ++no_wait_return;
18227 verbose_enter_scroll();
18228
18229 smsg((char_u *)_("calling %s")gettext((char *)("calling %s")), sourcing_name);
18230 if (p_verbose >= 14) {
18231 char_u buf[MSG_BUF_LEN480];
18232 char_u numbuf2[NUMBUFLEN30];
18233 char_u *tofree;
18234 char_u *s;
18235
18236 msg_puts((char_u *)"(");
18237 for (int i = 0; i < argcount; ++i) {
18238 if (i > 0)
18239 msg_puts((char_u *)", ");
18240 if (argvars[i].v_type == VAR_NUMBER1)
18241 msg_outnum((long)argvars[i].vval.v_number);
18242 else {
18243 // Do not want errors such as E724 here.
18244 ++emsg_off;
18245 s = tv2string(&argvars[i], &tofree, numbuf2, 0);
18246 --emsg_off;
18247 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
18248 if (vim_strsize(s) > MSG_BUF_CLEN(480 / 6)) {
18249 trunc_string(s, buf, MSG_BUF_CLEN(480 / 6), MSG_BUF_LEN480);
18250 s = buf;
18251 }
18252 msg_puts(s);
18253 free(tofree);
18254 }
18255 }
18256 }
18257 msg_puts((char_u *)")");
18258 }
18259 msg_puts((char_u *)"\n"); /* don't overwrite this either */
18260
18261 verbose_leave_scroll();
18262 --no_wait_return;
18263 }
18264 }
18265 if (do_profiling == PROF_YES1) {
18266 if (!fp->uf_profiling && has_profiling(FALSE0, fp->uf_name, NULL((void*)0)))
18267 func_do_profile(fp);
18268 if (fp->uf_profiling
18269 || (fc->caller != NULL((void*)0) && fc->caller->func->uf_profiling)) {
18270 ++fp->uf_tm_count;
18271 call_start = profile_start();
18272 fp->uf_tm_children = profile_zero();
18273 }
18274 script_prof_save(&wait_start);
18275 }
18276
18277 save_current_SID = current_SID;
18278 current_SID = fp->uf_script_ID;
18279 save_did_emsg = did_emsg;
18280 did_emsg = FALSE0;
18281
18282 /* call do_cmdline() to execute the lines */
18283 do_cmdline(NULL((void*)0), get_func_line, (void *)fc,
18284 DOCMD_NOWAIT0x02|DOCMD_VERBOSE0x01|DOCMD_REPEAT0x04);
18285
18286 --RedrawingDisabled;
18287
18288 /* when the function was aborted because of an error, return -1 */
18289 if ((did_emsg &&
18290 (fp->uf_flags & FC_ABORT1)) || rettv->v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN0) {
18291 clear_tv(rettv);
18292 rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
18293 rettv->vval.v_number = -1;
18294 }
18295
18296 if (do_profiling == PROF_YES1 && (fp->uf_profiling
18297 || (fc->caller != NULL((void*)0) &&
18298 fc->caller->func->uf_profiling))) {
18299 call_start = profile_end(call_start);
18300 call_start = profile_sub_wait(wait_start, call_start);
18301 fp->uf_tm_total = profile_add(fp->uf_tm_total, call_start);
18302 fp->uf_tm_self = profile_self(fp->uf_tm_self, call_start,
18303 fp->uf_tm_children);
18304 if (fc->caller != NULL((void*)0) && fc->caller->func->uf_profiling) {
18305 fc->caller->func->uf_tm_children =
18306 profile_add(fc->caller->func->uf_tm_children, call_start);
18307 fc->caller->func->uf_tml_children =
18308 profile_add(fc->caller->func->uf_tml_children, call_start);
18309 }
18310 }
18311
18312 /* when being verbose, mention the return value */
18313 if (p_verbose >= 12) {
18314 ++no_wait_return;
18315 verbose_enter_scroll();
18316
18317 if (aborting())
18318 smsg((char_u *)_("%s aborted")gettext((char *)("%s aborted")), sourcing_name);
18319 else if (fc->rettv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER1)
18320 smsg((char_u *)_("%s returning #%" PRId64 "")gettext((char *)("%s returning #%" "l" "d" "")),
18321 sourcing_name, (int64_t)fc->rettv->vval.v_number);
18322 else {
18323 char_u buf[MSG_BUF_LEN480];
18324 char_u numbuf2[NUMBUFLEN30];
18325 char_u *tofree;
18326 char_u *s;
18327
18328 // The value may be very long. Skip the middle part, so that we
18329 // have some idea how it starts and ends. smsg() would always
18330 // truncate it at the end. Don't want errors such as E724 here.
18331 ++emsg_off;
18332 s = tv2string(fc->rettv, &tofree, numbuf2, 0);
18333 --emsg_off;
18334 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
18335 if (vim_strsize(s) > MSG_BUF_CLEN(480 / 6)) {
18336 trunc_string(s, buf, MSG_BUF_CLEN(480 / 6), MSG_BUF_LEN480);
18337 s = buf;
18338 }
18339 smsg((char_u *)_("%s returning %s")gettext((char *)("%s returning %s")), sourcing_name, s);
18340 free(tofree);
18341 }
18342 }
18343 msg_puts((char_u *)"\n"); /* don't overwrite this either */
18344
18345 verbose_leave_scroll();
18346 --no_wait_return;
18347 }
18348
18349 free(sourcing_name);
18350 sourcing_name = save_sourcing_name;
18351 sourcing_lnum = save_sourcing_lnum;
18352 current_SID = save_current_SID;
18353 if (do_profiling == PROF_YES1)
18354 script_prof_restore(&wait_start);
18355
18356 if (p_verbose >= 12 && sourcing_name != NULL((void*)0)) {
18357 ++no_wait_return;
18358 verbose_enter_scroll();
18359
18360 smsg((char_u *)_("continuing in %s")gettext((char *)("continuing in %s")), sourcing_name);
18361 msg_puts((char_u *)"\n"); /* don't overwrite this either */
18362
18363 verbose_leave_scroll();
18364 --no_wait_return;
18365 }
18366
18367 did_emsg |= save_did_emsg;
18368 current_funccal = fc->caller;
18369 --depth;
18370
18371 /* If the a:000 list and the l: and a: dicts are not referenced we can
18372 * free the funccall_T and what's in it. */
18373 if (fc->l_varlist.lv_refcount == DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999
18374 && fc->l_vars.dv_refcount == DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999
18375 && fc->l_avars.dv_refcount == DO_NOT_FREE_CNT99999) {
18376 free_funccal(fc, FALSE0);
18377 } else {
18378 hashitem_T *hi;
18379 listitem_T *li;
18380 int todo;
18381
18382 /* "fc" is still in use. This can happen when returning "a:000" or
18383 * assigning "l:" to a global variable.
18384 * Link "fc" in the list for garbage collection later. */
18385 fc->caller = previous_funccal;
18386 previous_funccal = fc;
18387
18388 /* Make a copy of the a: variables, since we didn't do that above. */
18389 todo = (int)fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab.ht_used;
18390 for (hi = fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
18391 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
18392 --todo;
18393 v = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
18394 copy_tv(&v->di_tv, &v->di_tv);
18395 }
18396 }
18397
18398 /* Make a copy of the a:000 items, since we didn't do that above. */
18399 for (li = fc->l_varlist.lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next)
18400 copy_tv(&li->li_tv, &li->li_tv);
18401 }
18402}
18403
18404/*
18405 * Return TRUE if items in "fc" do not have "copyID". That means they are not
18406 * referenced from anywhere that is in use.
18407 */
18408static int can_free_funccal(funccall_T *fc, int copyID)
18409{
18410 return fc->l_varlist.lv_copyID != copyID
18411 && fc->l_vars.dv_copyID != copyID
18412 && fc->l_avars.dv_copyID != copyID;
18413}
18414
18415/*
18416 * Free "fc" and what it contains.
18417 */
18418static void
18419free_funccal (
18420 funccall_T *fc,
18421 int free_val /* a: vars were allocated */
18422)
18423{
18424 listitem_T *li;
18425
18426 /* The a: variables typevals may not have been allocated, only free the
18427 * allocated variables. */
18428 vars_clear_ext(&fc->l_avars.dv_hashtab, free_val);
18429
18430 /* free all l: variables */
18431 vars_clear(&fc->l_vars.dv_hashtab);
18432
18433 /* Free the a:000 variables if they were allocated. */
18434 if (free_val)
18435 for (li = fc->l_varlist.lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0); li = li->li_next)
18436 clear_tv(&li->li_tv);
18437
18438 free(fc);
18439}
18440
18441/*
18442 * Add a number variable "name" to dict "dp" with value "nr".
18443 */
18444static void add_nr_var(dict_T *dp, dictitem_T *v, char *name, varnumber_T nr)
18445{
18446 STRCPY(v->di_key, name)strcpy((char *)(v->di_key), (char *)(name));
18447 v->di_flags = DI_FLAGS_RO1 | DI_FLAGS_FIX4;
18448 hash_add(&dp->dv_hashtab, DI2HIKEY(v)((v)->di_key));
18449 v->di_tv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
18450 v->di_tv.v_lock = VAR_FIXED2;
18451 v->di_tv.vval.v_number = nr;
18452}
18453
18454/*
18455 * ":return [expr]"
18456 */
18457void ex_return(exarg_T *eap)
18458{
18459 char_u *arg = eap->arg;
18460 typval_T rettv;
18461 int returning = FALSE0;
18462
18463 if (current_funccal == NULL((void*)0)) {
18464 EMSG(_("E133: :return not inside a function"))emsg((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("E133: :return not inside a function"
))));
18465 return;
18466 }
18467
18468 if (eap->skip)
18469 ++emsg_skip;
18470
18471 eap->nextcmd = NULL((void*)0);
18472 if ((*arg != NUL'\000' && *arg != '|' && *arg != '\n')
18473 && eval0(arg, &rettv, &eap->nextcmd, !eap->skip) != FAIL0) {
18474 if (!eap->skip)
18475 returning = do_return(eap, FALSE0, TRUE1, &rettv);
18476 else
18477 clear_tv(&rettv);
18478 }
18479 /* It's safer to return also on error. */
18480 else if (!eap->skip) {
18481 /*
18482 * Return unless the expression evaluation has been cancelled due to an
18483 * aborting error, an interrupt, or an exception.
18484 */
18485 if (!aborting())
18486 returning = do_return(eap, FALSE0, TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
18487 }
18488
18489 /* When skipping or the return gets pending, advance to the next command
18490 * in this line (!returning). Otherwise, ignore the rest of the line.
18491 * Following lines will be ignored by get_func_line(). */
18492 if (returning)
18493 eap->nextcmd = NULL((void*)0);
18494 else if (eap->nextcmd == NULL((void*)0)) /* no argument */
18495 eap->nextcmd = check_nextcmd(arg);
18496
18497 if (eap->skip)
18498 --emsg_skip;
18499}
18500
18501/*
18502 * Return from a function. Possibly makes the return pending. Also called
18503 * for a pending return at the ":endtry" or after returning from an extra
18504 * do_cmdline(). "reanimate" is used in the latter case. "is_cmd" is set
18505 * when called due to a ":return" command. "rettv" may point to a typval_T
18506 * with the return rettv. Returns TRUE when the return can be carried out,
18507 * FALSE when the return gets pending.
18508 */
18509int do_return(exarg_T *eap, int reanimate, int is_cmd, void *rettv)
18510{
18511 int idx;
18512 struct condstack *cstack = eap->cstack;
18513
18514 if (reanimate)
1
Assuming 'reanimate' is not equal to 0
→
2
←
Taking true branch
→
18515 /* Undo the return. */
18516 current_funccal->returned = FALSE0;
18517
18518 /*
18519 * Cleanup (and inactivate) conditionals, but stop when a try conditional
18520 * not in its finally clause (which then is to be executed next) is found.
18521 * In this case, make the ":return" pending for execution at the ":endtry".
18522 * Otherwise, return normally.
18523 */
18524 idx = cleanup_conditionals(eap->cstack, 0, TRUE1);
18525 if (idx >= 0) {
3
←
Assuming 'idx' is >= 0
→
4
←
Taking true branch
→
18526 cstack->cs_pending[idx] = CSTP_RETURN24;
18527
18528 if (!is_cmd && !reanimate)
5
←
Assuming 'is_cmd' is not equal to 0
→
18529 /* A pending return again gets pending. "rettv" points to an
18530 * allocated variable with the rettv of the original ":return"'s
18531 * argument if present or is NULL else. */
18532 cstack->cs_rettvcs_pend.csp_rv[idx] = rettv;
18533 else {
18534 /* When undoing a return in order to make it pending, get the stored
18535 * return rettv. */
18536 if (reanimate)
6
←
Taking true branch
→
18537 rettv = current_funccal->rettv;
18538
18539 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
7
←
Assuming 'rettv' is equal to null
→
8
←
Taking false branch
→
18540 /* Store the value of the pending return. */
18541 cstack->cs_rettvcs_pend.csp_rv[idx] = xcalloc(1, sizeof(typval_T));
18542 *(typval_T *)cstack->cs_rettvcs_pend.csp_rv[idx] = *(typval_T *)rettv;
18543 } else
18544 cstack->cs_rettvcs_pend.csp_rv[idx] = NULL((void*)0);
18545
18546 if (reanimate) {
9
←
Taking true branch
→
18547 /* The pending return value could be overwritten by a ":return"
18548 * without argument in a finally clause; reset the default
18549 * return value. */
18550 current_funccal->rettv->v_type = VAR_NUMBER1;
10
←
Access to field 'v_type' results in a dereference of a null pointer (loaded from field 'rettv')
18551 current_funccal->rettv->vval.v_number = 0;
18552 }
18553 }
18554 report_make_pending(CSTP_RETURN24, rettv);
18555 } else {
18556 current_funccal->returned = TRUE1;
18557
18558 /* If the return is carried out now, store the return value. For
18559 * a return immediately after reanimation, the value is already
18560 * there. */
18561 if (!reanimate && rettv != NULL((void*)0)) {
18562 clear_tv(current_funccal->rettv);
18563 *current_funccal->rettv = *(typval_T *)rettv;
18564 if (!is_cmd)
18565 free(rettv);
18566 }
18567 }
18568
18569 return idx < 0;
18570}
18571
18572/*
18573 * Free the variable with a pending return value.
18574 */
18575void discard_pending_return(void *rettv)
18576{
18577 free_tv((typval_T *)rettv);
18578}
18579
18580/*
18581 * Generate a return command for producing the value of "rettv". The result
18582 * is an allocated string. Used by report_pending() for verbose messages.
18583 */
18584char_u *get_return_cmd(void *rettv)
18585{
18586 char_u *s = NULL((void*)0);
18587 char_u *tofree = NULL((void*)0);
18588 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
18589
18590 if (rettv != NULL((void*)0))
18591 s = echo_string((typval_T *)rettv, &tofree, numbuf, 0);
18592 if (s == NULL((void*)0))
18593 s = (char_u *)"";
18594
18595 STRCPY(IObuff, ":return ")strcpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)(":return "));
18596 STRNCPY(IObuff + 8, s, IOSIZE - 8)strncpy((char *)(IObuff + 8), (char *)(s), (size_t)((1024+1) -
8));
18597 if (STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s)) + 8 >= IOSIZE(1024+1))
18598 STRCPY(IObuff + IOSIZE - 4, "...")strcpy((char *)(IObuff + (1024+1) - 4), (char *)("..."));
18599 free(tofree);
18600 return vim_strsave(IObuff);
18601}
18602
18603/*
18604 * Get next function line.
18605 * Called by do_cmdline() to get the next line.
18606 * Returns allocated string, or NULL for end of function.
18607 */
18608char_u *get_func_line(int c, void *cookie, int indent)
18609{
18610 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
18611 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
18612 char_u *retval;
18613 garray_T *gap; /* growarray with function lines */
18614
18615 /* If breakpoints have been added/deleted need to check for it. */
18616 if (fcp->dbg_tick != debug_tick) {
18617 fcp->breakpoint = dbg_find_breakpoint(FALSE0, fp->uf_name,
18618 sourcing_lnum);
18619 fcp->dbg_tick = debug_tick;
18620 }
18621 if (do_profiling == PROF_YES1)
18622 func_line_end(cookie);
18623
18624 gap = &fp->uf_lines;
18625 if (((fp->uf_flags & FC_ABORT1) && did_emsg && !aborted_in_try())
18626 || fcp->returned)
18627 retval = NULL((void*)0);
18628 else {
18629 /* Skip NULL lines (continuation lines). */
18630 while (fcp->linenr < gap->ga_len
18631 && ((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[fcp->linenr] == NULL((void*)0))
18632 ++fcp->linenr;
18633 if (fcp->linenr >= gap->ga_len)
18634 retval = NULL((void*)0);
18635 else {
18636 retval = vim_strsave(((char_u **)(gap->ga_data))[fcp->linenr++]);
18637 sourcing_lnum = fcp->linenr;
18638 if (do_profiling == PROF_YES1)
18639 func_line_start(cookie);
18640 }
18641 }
18642
18643 /* Did we encounter a breakpoint? */
18644 if (fcp->breakpoint != 0 && fcp->breakpoint <= sourcing_lnum) {
18645 dbg_breakpoint(fp->uf_name, sourcing_lnum);
18646 /* Find next breakpoint. */
18647 fcp->breakpoint = dbg_find_breakpoint(FALSE0, fp->uf_name,
18648 sourcing_lnum);
18649 fcp->dbg_tick = debug_tick;
18650 }
18651
18652 return retval;
18653}
18654
18655/*
18656 * Called when starting to read a function line.
18657 * "sourcing_lnum" must be correct!
18658 * When skipping lines it may not actually be executed, but we won't find out
18659 * until later and we need to store the time now.
18660 */
18661void func_line_start(void *cookie)
18662{
18663 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
18664 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
18665
18666 if (fp->uf_profiling && sourcing_lnum >= 1
18667 && sourcing_lnum <= fp->uf_lines.ga_len) {
18668 fp->uf_tml_idx = sourcing_lnum - 1;
18669 /* Skip continuation lines. */
18670 while (fp->uf_tml_idx > 0 && FUNCLINE(fp, fp->uf_tml_idx)((char_u **)(fp->uf_lines.ga_data))[fp->uf_tml_idx] == NULL((void*)0))
18671 --fp->uf_tml_idx;
18672 fp->uf_tml_execed = FALSE0;
18673 fp->uf_tml_start = profile_start();
18674 fp->uf_tml_children = profile_zero();
18675 fp->uf_tml_wait = profile_get_wait();
18676 }
18677}
18678
18679/*
18680 * Called when actually executing a function line.
18681 */
18682void func_line_exec(void *cookie)
18683{
18684 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
18685 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
18686
18687 if (fp->uf_profiling && fp->uf_tml_idx >= 0)
18688 fp->uf_tml_execed = TRUE1;
18689}
18690
18691/*
18692 * Called when done with a function line.
18693 */
18694void func_line_end(void *cookie)
18695{
18696 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
18697 ufunc_T *fp = fcp->func;
18698
18699 if (fp->uf_profiling && fp->uf_tml_idx >= 0) {
18700 if (fp->uf_tml_execed) {
18701 ++fp->uf_tml_count[fp->uf_tml_idx];
18702 fp->uf_tml_start = profile_end(fp->uf_tml_start);
18703 fp->uf_tml_start = profile_sub_wait(fp->uf_tml_wait, fp->uf_tml_start);
18704 fp->uf_tml_total[fp->uf_tml_idx] =
18705 profile_add(fp->uf_tml_total[fp->uf_tml_idx], fp->uf_tml_start);
18706 fp->uf_tml_self[fp->uf_tml_idx] =
18707 profile_self(fp->uf_tml_self[fp->uf_tml_idx], fp->uf_tml_start,
18708 fp->uf_tml_children);
18709 }
18710 fp->uf_tml_idx = -1;
18711 }
18712}
18713
18714/*
18715 * Return TRUE if the currently active function should be ended, because a
18716 * return was encountered or an error occurred. Used inside a ":while".
18717 */
18718int func_has_ended(void *cookie)
18719{
18720 funccall_T *fcp = (funccall_T *)cookie;
18721
18722 /* Ignore the "abort" flag if the abortion behavior has been changed due to
18723 * an error inside a try conditional. */
18724 return ((fcp->func->uf_flags & FC_ABORT1) && did_emsg && !aborted_in_try())
18725 || fcp->returned;
18726}
18727
18728/*
18729 * return TRUE if cookie indicates a function which "abort"s on errors.
18730 */
18731int func_has_abort(void *cookie)
18732{
18733 return ((funccall_T *)cookie)->func->uf_flags & FC_ABORT1;
18734}
18735
18736static var_flavour_T var_flavour(char_u *varname)
18737{
18738 char_u *p = varname;
18739
18740 if (ASCII_ISUPPER(*p)((unsigned)(*p) - 'A' < 26)) {
18741 while (*(++p))
18742 if (ASCII_ISLOWER(*p)((unsigned)(*p) - 'a' < 26))
18743 return VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION;
18744 return VAR_FLAVOUR_VIMINFO;
18745 } else
18746 return VAR_FLAVOUR_DEFAULT;
18747}
18748
18749/*
18750 * Restore global vars that start with a capital from the viminfo file
18751 */
18752int read_viminfo_varlist(vir_T *virp, int writing)
18753{
18754 char_u *tab;
18755 int type = VAR_NUMBER1;
18756 typval_T tv;
18757
18758 if (!writing && (find_viminfo_parameter('!') != NULL((void*)0))) {
18759 tab = vim_strchr(virp->vir_line + 1, '\t');
18760 if (tab != NULL((void*)0)) {
18761 *tab++ = NUL'\000'; /* isolate the variable name */
18762 switch (*tab) {
18763 case 'S': type = VAR_STRING2; break;
18764 case 'F': type = VAR_FLOAT6; break;
18765 case 'D': type = VAR_DICT5; break;
18766 case 'L': type = VAR_LIST4; break;
18767 }
18768
18769 tab = vim_strchr(tab, '\t');
18770 if (tab != NULL((void*)0)) {
18771 tv.v_type = type;
18772 if (type == VAR_STRING2 || type == VAR_DICT5 || type == VAR_LIST4)
18773 tv.vval.v_string = viminfo_readstring(virp,
18774 (int)(tab - virp->vir_line + 1), TRUE1);
18775 else if (type == VAR_FLOAT6)
18776 (void)string2float(tab + 1, &tv.vval.v_float);
18777 else
18778 tv.vval.v_number = atol((char *)tab + 1);
18779 if (type == VAR_DICT5 || type == VAR_LIST4) {
18780 typval_T *etv = eval_expr(tv.vval.v_string, NULL((void*)0));
18781
18782 if (etv == NULL((void*)0))
18783 /* Failed to parse back the dict or list, use it as a
18784 * string. */
18785 tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
18786 else {
18787 free(tv.vval.v_string);
18788 tv = *etv;
18789 free(etv);
18790 }
18791 }
18792
18793 set_var(virp->vir_line + 1, &tv, FALSE0);
18794
18795 if (tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2)
18796 free(tv.vval.v_string);
18797 else if (tv.v_type == VAR_DICT5 || tv.v_type == VAR_LIST4)
18798 clear_tv(&tv);
18799 }
18800 }
18801 }
18802
18803 return viminfo_readline(virp);
18804}
18805
18806/*
18807 * Write global vars that start with a capital to the viminfo file
18808 */
18809void write_viminfo_varlist(FILE *fp)
18810{
18811 hashitem_T *hi;
18812 dictitem_T *this_var;
18813 int todo;
18814 char *s;
18815 char_u *p;
18816 char_u *tofree;
18817 char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN30];
18818
18819 if (find_viminfo_parameter('!') == NULL((void*)0))
18820 return;
18821
18822 fputs(_("\n# global variables:\n")gettext((char *)("\n# global variables:\n")), fp);
18823
18824 todo = (int)globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_used;
18825 for (hi = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
18826 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
18827 --todo;
18828 this_var = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
18829 if (var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_VIMINFO) {
18830 switch (this_var->di_tv.v_type) {
18831 case VAR_STRING2: s = "STR"; break;
18832 case VAR_NUMBER1: s = "NUM"; break;
18833 case VAR_FLOAT6: s = "FLO"; break;
18834 case VAR_DICT5: s = "DIC"; break;
18835 case VAR_LIST4: s = "LIS"; break;
18836 default: continue;
18837 }
18838 fprintf(fp, "!%s\t%s\t", this_var->di_key, s);
18839 p = echo_string(&this_var->di_tv, &tofree, numbuf, 0);
18840 if (p != NULL((void*)0))
18841 viminfo_writestring(fp, p);
18842 free(tofree);
18843 }
18844 }
18845 }
18846}
18847
18848int store_session_globals(FILE *fd)
18849{
18850 hashitem_T *hi;
18851 dictitem_T *this_var;
18852 int todo;
18853 char_u *p, *t;
18854
18855 todo = (int)globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_used;
18856 for (hi = globvarhtglobvardict.dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi) {
18857 if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi)((hi)->hi_key == ((void*)0) || (hi)->hi_key == &hash_removed
)) {
18858 --todo;
18859 this_var = HI2DI(hi)((dictitem_T *)((hi)->hi_key - (dumdi.di_key - (char_u *)&
dumdi)));
18860 if ((this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_NUMBER1
18861 || this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2)
18862 && var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) {
18863 /* Escape special characters with a backslash. Turn a LF and
18864 * CR into \n and \r. */
18865 p = vim_strsave_escaped(get_tv_string(&this_var->di_tv),
18866 (char_u *)"\\\"\n\r");
18867 for (t = p; *t != NUL'\000'; ++t)
18868 if (*t == '\n')
18869 *t = 'n';
18870 else if (*t == '\r')
18871 *t = 'r';
18872 if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%s%c",
18873 this_var->di_key,
18874 (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2) ? '"'
18875 : ' ',
18876 p,
18877 (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_STRING2) ? '"'
18878 : ' ') < 0)
18879 || put_eol(fd) == FAIL0) {
18880 free(p);
18881 return FAIL0;
18882 }
18883 free(p);
18884 } else if (this_var->di_tv.v_type == VAR_FLOAT6
18885 && var_flavour(this_var->di_key) == VAR_FLAVOUR_SESSION) {
18886 float_T f = this_var->di_tv.vval.v_float;
18887 int sign = ' ';
18888
18889 if (f < 0) {
18890 f = -f;
18891 sign = '-';
18892 }
18893 if ((fprintf(fd, "let %s = %c%f",
18894 this_var->di_key, sign, f) < 0)
18895 || put_eol(fd) == FAIL0)
18896 return FAIL0;
18897 }
18898 }
18899 }
18900 return OK1;
18901}
18902
18903/*
18904 * Display script name where an item was last set.
18905 * Should only be invoked when 'verbose' is non-zero.
18906 */
18907void last_set_msg(scid_T scriptID)
18908{
18909 if (scriptID != 0) {
18910 char_u *p = home_replace_save(NULL((void*)0), get_scriptname(scriptID));
18911 verbose_enter();
18912 MSG_PUTS(_("\n\tLast set from "))msg_puts((char_u *)(gettext((char *)("\n\tLast set from "))));
18913 MSG_PUTS(p)msg_puts((char_u *)(p));
18914 free(p);
18915 verbose_leave();
18916 }
18917}
18918
18919/*
18920 * List v:oldfiles in a nice way.
18921 */
18922void ex_oldfiles(exarg_T *eap)
18923{
18924 list_T *l = vimvars[VV_OLDFILES].vv_listvv_di.di_tv.vval.v_list;
18925 listitem_T *li;
18926 int nr = 0;
18927
18928 if (l == NULL((void*)0))
18929 msg((char_u *)_("No old files")gettext((char *)("No old files")));
18930 else {
18931 msg_start();
18932 msg_scroll = TRUE1;
18933 for (li = l->lv_first; li != NULL((void*)0) && !got_int; li = li->li_next) {
18934 msg_outnum((long)++nr);
18935 MSG_PUTS(": ")msg_puts((char_u *)(": "));
18936 msg_outtrans(get_tv_string(&li->li_tv));
18937 msg_putchar('\n');
18938 out_flush(); /* output one line at a time */
18939 ui_breakcheck();
18940 }
18941 /* Assume "got_int" was set to truncate the listing. */
18942 got_int = FALSE0;
18943
18944 }
18945}
18946
18947
18948
18949
18950
18951/*
18952 * Adjust a filename, according to a string of modifiers.
18953 * *fnamep must be NUL terminated when called. When returning, the length is
18954 * determined by *fnamelen.
18955 * Returns VALID_ flags or -1 for failure.
18956 * When there is an error, *fnamep is set to NULL.
18957 */
18958int
18959modify_fname (
18960 char_u *src, /* string with modifiers */
18961 int *usedlen, /* characters after src that are used */
18962 char_u **fnamep, /* file name so far */
18963 char_u **bufp, /* buffer for allocated file name or NULL */
18964 int *fnamelen /* length of fnamep */
18965)
18966{
18967 int valid = 0;
18968 char_u *tail;
18969 char_u *s, *p, *pbuf;
18970 char_u dirname[MAXPATHL4096];
18971 int c;
18972 int has_fullname = 0;
18973
18974repeat:
18975 /* ":p" - full path/file_name */
18976 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 'p') {
18977 has_fullname = 1;
18978
18979 valid |= VALID_PATH1;
18980 *usedlen += 2;
18981
18982 /* Expand "~/path" for all systems and "~user/path" for Unix */
18983 if ((*fnamep)[0] == '~'
18984#if !defined(UNIX)
18985 && ((*fnamep)[1] == '/'
18986# ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
18987 || (*fnamep)[1] == '\\'
18988# endif
18989 || (*fnamep)[1] == NUL'\000')
18990
18991#endif
18992 ) {
18993 *fnamep = expand_env_save(*fnamep);
18994 free(*bufp); /* free any allocated file name */
18995 *bufp = *fnamep;
18996 if (*fnamep == NULL((void*)0))
18997 return -1;
18998 }
18999
19000 /* When "/." or "/.." is used: force expansion to get rid of it. */
19001 for (p = *fnamep; *p != NUL'\000'; mb_ptr_adv(p)p += has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(p) : 1) {
19002 if (vim_ispathsep(*p)
19003 && p[1] == '.'
19004 && (p[2] == NUL'\000'
19005 || vim_ispathsep(p[2])
19006 || (p[2] == '.'
19007 && (p[3] == NUL'\000' || vim_ispathsep(p[3])))))
19008 break;
19009 }
19010
19011 /* FullName_save() is slow, don't use it when not needed. */
19012 if (*p != NUL'\000' || !vim_isAbsName(*fnamep)) {
19013 *fnamep = FullName_save(*fnamep, *p != NUL'\000');
19014 free(*bufp); /* free any allocated file name */
19015 *bufp = *fnamep;
19016 if (*fnamep == NULL((void*)0))
19017 return -1;
19018 }
19019
19020 /* Append a path separator to a directory. */
19021 if (os_isdir(*fnamep)) {
19022 /* Make room for one or two extra characters. */
19023 *fnamep = vim_strnsave(*fnamep, (int)STRLEN(*fnamep)strlen((char *)(*fnamep)) + 2);
19024 free(*bufp); /* free any allocated file name */
19025 *bufp = *fnamep;
19026 if (*fnamep == NULL((void*)0))
19027 return -1;
19028 add_pathsep(*fnamep);
19029 }
19030 }
19031
19032 /* ":." - path relative to the current directory */
19033 /* ":~" - path relative to the home directory */
19034 /* ":8" - shortname path - postponed till after */
19035 while (src[*usedlen] == ':'
19036 && ((c = src[*usedlen + 1]) == '.' || c == '~' || c == '8')) {
19037 *usedlen += 2;
19038 if (c == '8') {
19039 continue;
19040 }
19041 pbuf = NULL((void*)0);
19042 /* Need full path first (use expand_env() to remove a "~/") */
19043 if (!has_fullname) {
19044 if (c == '.' && **fnamep == '~')
19045 p = pbuf = expand_env_save(*fnamep);
19046 else
19047 p = pbuf = FullName_save(*fnamep, FALSE0);
19048 } else
19049 p = *fnamep;
19050
19051 has_fullname = 0;
19052
19053 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
19054 if (c == '.') {
19055 os_dirname(dirname, MAXPATHL4096);
19056 s = path_shorten_fname(p, dirname);
19057 if (s != NULL((void*)0)) {
19058 *fnamep = s;
19059 if (pbuf != NULL((void*)0)) {
19060 free(*bufp); /* free any allocated file name */
19061 *bufp = pbuf;
19062 pbuf = NULL((void*)0);
19063 }
19064 }
19065 } else {
19066 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), p, dirname, MAXPATHL4096, TRUE1);
19067 /* Only replace it when it starts with '~' */
19068 if (*dirname == '~') {
19069 s = vim_strsave(dirname);
19070 *fnamep = s;
19071 free(*bufp);
19072 *bufp = s;
19073 }
19074 }
19075 free(pbuf);
19076 }
19077 }
19078
19079 tail = path_tail(*fnamep);
19080 *fnamelen = (int)STRLEN(*fnamep)strlen((char *)(*fnamep));
19081
19082 /* ":h" - head, remove "/file_name", can be repeated */
19083 /* Don't remove the first "/" or "c:\" */
19084 while (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 'h') {
19085 valid |= VALID_HEAD2;
19086 *usedlen += 2;
19087 s = get_past_head(*fnamep);
19088 while (tail > s && after_pathsep(s, tail))
19089 mb_ptr_back(*fnamep, tail)tail -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(*fnamep, tail - 1) + 1) :
1;
19090 *fnamelen = (int)(tail - *fnamep);
19091 if (*fnamelen == 0) {
19092 /* Result is empty. Turn it into "." to make ":cd %:h" work. */
19093 free(*bufp);
19094 *bufp = *fnamep = tail = vim_strsave((char_u *)".");
19095 *fnamelen = 1;
19096 } else {
19097 while (tail > s && !after_pathsep(s, tail))
19098 mb_ptr_back(*fnamep, tail)tail -= has_mbyte ? ((*mb_head_off)(*fnamep, tail - 1) + 1) :
1;
19099 }
19100 }
19101
19102 /* ":8" - shortname */
19103 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == '8') {
19104 *usedlen += 2;
19105 }
19106
19107
19108 /* ":t" - tail, just the basename */
19109 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 't') {
19110 *usedlen += 2;
19111 *fnamelen -= (int)(tail - *fnamep);
19112 *fnamep = tail;
19113 }
19114
19115 /* ":e" - extension, can be repeated */
19116 /* ":r" - root, without extension, can be repeated */
19117 while (src[*usedlen] == ':'
19118 && (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'e' || src[*usedlen + 1] == 'r')) {
19119 /* find a '.' in the tail:
19120 * - for second :e: before the current fname
19121 * - otherwise: The last '.'
19122 */
19123 if (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'e' && *fnamep > tail)
19124 s = *fnamep - 2;
19125 else
19126 s = *fnamep + *fnamelen - 1;
19127 for (; s > tail; --s)
19128 if (s[0] == '.')
19129 break;
19130 if (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'e') { /* :e */
19131 if (s > tail) {
19132 *fnamelen += (int)(*fnamep - (s + 1));
19133 *fnamep = s + 1;
19134 } else if (*fnamep <= tail)
19135 *fnamelen = 0;
19136 } else { /* :r */
19137 if (s > tail) /* remove one extension */
19138 *fnamelen = (int)(s - *fnamep);
19139 }
19140 *usedlen += 2;
19141 }
19142
19143 /* ":s?pat?foo?" - substitute */
19144 /* ":gs?pat?foo?" - global substitute */
19145 if (src[*usedlen] == ':'
19146 && (src[*usedlen + 1] == 's'
19147 || (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'g' && src[*usedlen + 2] == 's'))) {
19148 char_u *str;
19149 char_u *pat;
19150 char_u *sub;
19151 int sep;
19152 char_u *flags;
19153 int didit = FALSE0;
19154
19155 flags = (char_u *)"";
19156 s = src + *usedlen + 2;
19157 if (src[*usedlen + 1] == 'g') {
19158 flags = (char_u *)"g";
19159 ++s;
19160 }
19161
19162 sep = *s++;
19163 if (sep) {
19164 /* find end of pattern */
19165 p = vim_strchr(s, sep);
19166 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
19167 pat = vim_strnsave(s, (int)(p - s));
19168 s = p + 1;
19169 /* find end of substitution */
19170 p = vim_strchr(s, sep);
19171 if (p != NULL((void*)0)) {
19172 sub = vim_strnsave(s, (int)(p - s));
19173 str = vim_strnsave(*fnamep, *fnamelen);
19174 *usedlen = (int)(p + 1 - src);
19175 s = do_string_sub(str, pat, sub, flags);
19176 *fnamep = s;
19177 *fnamelen = (int)STRLEN(s)strlen((char *)(s));
19178 free(*bufp);
19179 *bufp = s;
19180 didit = TRUE1;
19181 free(sub);
19182 free(str);
19183 }
19184 free(pat);
19185 }
19186 /* after using ":s", repeat all the modifiers */
19187 if (didit)
19188 goto repeat;
19189 }
19190 }
19191
19192 if (src[*usedlen] == ':' && src[*usedlen + 1] == 'S') {
19193 p = vim_strsave_shellescape(*fnamep, false0, false0);
19194 free(*bufp);
19195 *bufp = *fnamep = p;
19196 *fnamelen = (int)STRLEN(p)strlen((char *)(p));
19197 *usedlen += 2;
19198 }
19199
19200 return valid;
19201}
19202
19203/*
19204 * Perform a substitution on "str" with pattern "pat" and substitute "sub".
19205 * "flags" can be "g" to do a global substitute.
19206 * Returns an allocated string, NULL for error.
19207 */
19208char_u *do_string_sub(char_u *str, char_u *pat, char_u *sub, char_u *flags)
19209{
19210 int sublen;
19211 regmatch_T regmatch;
19212 int do_all;
19213 char_u *tail;
19214 garray_T ga;
19215 char_u *save_cpo;
19216 char_u *zero_width = NULL((void*)0);
19217
19218 /* Make 'cpoptions' empty, so that the 'l' flag doesn't work here */
19219 save_cpo = p_cpo;
19220 p_cpo = empty_option;
19221
19222 ga_init(&ga, 1, 200);
19223
19224 do_all = (flags[0] == 'g');
19225
19226 regmatch.rm_ic = p_ic;
19227 regmatch.regprog = vim_regcomp(pat, RE_MAGIC1 + RE_STRING2);
19228 if (regmatch.regprog != NULL((void*)0)) {
19229 tail = str;
19230 while (vim_regexec_nl(&regmatch, str, (colnr_T)(tail - str))) {
19231 /* Skip empty match except for first match. */
19232 if (regmatch.startp[0] == regmatch.endp[0]) {
19233 if (zero_width == regmatch.startp[0]) {
19234 /* avoid getting stuck on a match with an empty string */
19235 int i = MB_PTR2LEN(tail)(has_mbyte ? (*mb_ptr2len)(tail) : 1);
19236 memmove((char_u *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len, tail, (size_t)i);
19237 ga.ga_len += i;
19238 tail += i;
19239 continue;
19240 }
19241 zero_width = regmatch.startp[0];
19242 }
19243
19244 /*
19245 * Get some space for a temporary buffer to do the substitution
19246 * into. It will contain:
19247 * - The text up to where the match is.
19248 * - The substituted text.
19249 * - The text after the match.
19250 */
19251 sublen = vim_regsub(&regmatch, sub, tail, FALSE0, TRUE1, FALSE0);
19252 ga_grow(&ga, (int)(STRLEN(tail)strlen((char *)(tail)) + sublen -
19253 (regmatch.endp[0] - regmatch.startp[0])));
19254
19255 /* copy the text up to where the match is */
19256 int i = (int)(regmatch.startp[0] - tail);
19257 memmove((char_u *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len, tail, (size_t)i);
19258 /* add the substituted text */
19259 (void)vim_regsub(&regmatch, sub, (char_u *)ga.ga_data
19260 + ga.ga_len + i, TRUE1, TRUE1, FALSE0);
19261 ga.ga_len += i + sublen - 1;
19262 tail = regmatch.endp[0];
19263 if (*tail == NUL'\000')
19264 break;
19265 if (!do_all)
19266 break;
19267 }
19268
19269 if (ga.ga_data != NULL((void*)0))
19270 STRCPY((char *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len, tail)strcpy((char *)((char *)ga.ga_data + ga.ga_len), (char *)(tail
));
19271
19272 vim_regfree(regmatch.regprog);
19273 }
19274
19275 char_u *ret = vim_strsave(ga.ga_data == NULL((void*)0) ? str : (char_u *)ga.ga_data);
19276 ga_clear(&ga);
19277 if (p_cpo == empty_option)
19278 p_cpo = save_cpo;
19279 else
19280 /* Darn, evaluating {sub} expression changed the value. */
19281 free_string_option(save_cpo);
19282
19283 return ret;
19284}
19285
19286static void on_job_stdout(RStream *rstream, void *data, bool_Bool eof)
19287{
19288 if (!eof) {
19289 on_job_data(rstream, data, eof, "stdout");
19290 }
19291}
19292
19293static void on_job_stderr(RStream *rstream, void *data, bool_Bool eof)
19294{
19295 if (!eof) {
19296 on_job_data(rstream, data, eof, "stderr");
19297 }
19298}
19299
19300static void on_job_exit(Job *job, void *data)
19301{
19302 apply_job_autocmds(job, data, "exit", NULL((void*)0));
19303 free(data);
19304}
19305
19306static void on_job_data(RStream *rstream, void *data, bool_Bool eof, char *type)
19307{
19308 Job *job = data;
19309 uint32_t read_count = rstream_available(rstream);
19310 char *str = xmalloc(read_count + 1);
19311
19312 rstream_read(rstream, str, read_count);
19313 str[read_count] = NUL'\000';
19314 apply_job_autocmds(job, job_data(job), type, str);
19315}
19316
19317static void apply_job_autocmds(Job *job, char *name, char *type, char *str)
19318{
19319 // Create the list which will be set to v:job_data
19320 list_T *list = list_alloc();
19321 list_append_number(list, job_id(job));
19322 list_append_string(list, (uint8_t *)type, -1);
19323
19324 if (str) {
19325 listitem_T *str_slot = listitem_alloc();
19326 str_slot->li_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING2;
19327 str_slot->li_tv.v_lock = 0;
19328 str_slot->li_tv.vval.v_string = (uint8_t *)str;
19329 list_append(list, str_slot);
19330 }
19331
19332 // Update v:job_data for the autocommands
19333 set_vim_var_list(VV_JOB_DATA, list);
19334 // Call JobActivity autocommands
19335 apply_autocmds(EVENT_JOBACTIVITY, (uint8_t *)name, NULL((void*)0), TRUE1, NULL((void*)0));
19336}
19337
19338static void script_host_eval(char *method, typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv)
19339{
19340 Array args = ARRAY_DICT_INIT{.size = 0, .capacity = 0, .items = ((void*)0)};
19341 ADD(args, vim_to_object(argvars))do { if ((args).size == (args).capacity) { (args).capacity = (
args).capacity? (args).capacity<<1 : 8; (args).items = (
Object*)xrealloc((args).items, sizeof(Object) * (args).capacity
); } (args).items[(args).size++] = (vim_to_object(argvars)); }
while (0);
19342 Object result = provider_call(method, args);
19343
19344 if (result.type == kObjectTypeNil) {
19345 return;
19346 }
19347
19348 Error err = {.set = false0};
19349 object_to_vim(result, rettv, &err);
19350 api_free_object(result);
19351
19352 if (err.set) {
19353 EMSG("Error converting value back to vim")emsg((char_u *)("Error converting value back to vim"));
19354 }
19355}
19356
